The three oldest go to school. She only finished the 5th grade; she did not continue due to a lack of financial means. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anybody else. Amélia has never left the neighborhood where she was born; she lives with her family in the Mahubo sector. For more than 17 years, she has had her own business. She does not have any employees and she earns about 2,000 MZN to 3,000 MZN per month, which she uses to pay for household expenses. She even saves some in her house, as she does not have a bank account. She has had loans with others banks, for example TCHUMA. Later she decided not to continue with them for various reasons. She found out about Hluvuku through friends. This is her 3rd loan, which has a value of 10,000 MZN. She plans to use it to buy products (beer, refreshments, wine, rice, oil, etc.) in order to increase her merchandise stock. The previous loans were for 4,000 MZN and 8,500 MZN, which she used for the same purpose. She promises to pay off the loan on time so she will be able to have access to others. In the future, she would like to ask for more loans to improve her business establishment.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell products (beer, refreshments, wine, rice, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Gul Sorkh Group

texts.en:
Torpeky is a member of the Gul sorkh group. She lives in the 1st district, Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and the mother of four children, two sons and two daughters. They are all studying at school. She is a tailor and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Torpeky is a good tailor and can sew different kinds of clothes, so she is quite popular in her area. She needs the loan to purchase cloth, different kinds of threads, large needles and scissors. She hopes to progress in the future and to open a shop instead of working from home.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, different kinds of threads, large needles and scissors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new carpentry tools

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Pich T., 35, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. T. is a motor-taxi driver and earns an income of $3 per day. His wife produces hummocks (spelled "hammocks" in English), earning an income of about $1 per day. T. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a trailer to attach to the motorbike. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.  This is his second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. T.'s wife appears in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy a trailer to attach to his motorbike

loans.name: Ndèye Khoudia

texts.fr: Ndèye Khoudia D. est une femme de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère 04 enfants   en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SANKAGNE 2 depuis son inauguration le 31 mai 2007 et a en 3 ans reçu successivement 6 crédits qu'elle a toujours bien remboursés. Elle est exploitante de bananerais et son actuel prêt lui servira a acheter de l'engrais organique, de la paille pour le paillage, de payer de la main d'œuvre pour les frais de plantation, de payer les frais d'arrosage et donner une caution au groupement du quartier. Avec le bénéfices qui seront réalisés à partir de son activité elle soutien son mari pour la prise en charge quotidienne de la famille.
texts.en:
Ndèye Khoudia D. is a married, 37 year-old woman with four children at home. She has been a member of the SANKAGNE 2 Banc Villageois since it opened on May 31, 2007. In three years, she has received six loans and repaid them in full. She operates a banana plantation. The current loan will be used to buy organic fertilizer and straw for mulch, hire people for planting, pay for watering, and give a security deposit to the neighborhood group. With the profits from her business, she helps her husband with the day-to-day needs of the family.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operate her banana plantation

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Sos R., 37, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. 

R. and her husband are blacksmiths and earn an income of USD 7 per day. R. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more metal and charcoal to expand her current business. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. R.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: buy metal and charcoal

loans.name: Benkadi  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Benkadi 2  sont mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles polygames avec en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Dougounikoro dans la commune rurale de Sanando, préfecture de Barouéli, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de parenté. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs superficies de culture, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. 
L’arachide, le mil et le fonio sont des spéculations que les membres du groupe vont cultiver.
Madame Tata D. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter deux sacs de complexe céréale, 2 bidons d’herbicide et recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour et de récolte  dans ses champs. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Konobougou, en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes et des femmes du village. 
Avec une superficie de 2,50 hectares, elle espère produire 10 sacs de mil et 8 sacs de fonio. Une partie de la production est auto consommée tandis que le reste est vendu pour prendre en charge les frais de condiments, les fournitures scolaires et les soins de santé des enfants. 
Madame Tata D. compte réaliser 70.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The six women of the Benkadi 2 group are married and most live in large polygamous families. They average 34 years of age and three children each. They all live in the village of Dougounikoro in the rural commune of Sanando, Barouéli prefecture, in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali) They know each other through marriage and kinship ties. With the goal of increasing their cultivable land, they turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second planting loan cycle. The group members will grow peanuts, millet and fonio (a species of millet). Mrs. Tata D. plans to use her loan to buy two bags of complex fertilizer and to recruit the labor for ploughing and harvesting the fields. She obtains fresh agricultural supplies at the market in Konobougou and labor from the village association of young people and women. She hopes to produce 10 bags of millet and 8 bags of fonio on 2.50 hectares of land. One part of the harvest is consumed by the family while the rest is sold to provide for the costs of seasonings, school supplies and the children’s health care. Mrs. D. expects to make 70,000 CFA by the end of the crop year.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for complex fertilizer, herbicides and labor for ploughing and harvesting.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie N. is from the village of Molatuhan Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Elvie is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Elvie owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Elvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed for the business. This will be Elvie's fifth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to help meet the daily needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed for the business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia R. is from the village of Ubong, Solana, Cagayan. She is 51 years old. Lydia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lydia owns & operates a business selling fish and vegetables in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Lydia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lydia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. Despite his young age, he has 4 years of experience working with mobile phones. He began as an employee in a mobile phone shop and opened his own store in 2008. With his requested loan of US$ 2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will increase his merchandise selection and purchase prepaid telephone cards which he then sells. This will be his second loan.

 The majority of mobile phone users in Lebanon purchase these prepaid cards; it is less common to have an annual phone contract. In the future, he is looking to further expand his business and increase his capital.

loans.use: increase his merchandise selection and purchase prepaid telephone cards for resale

loans.name: Velenda

texts.en:
Velenda E. is a married woman who lives in Purok Tuway, Brgy. Canmoros, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  General Store and Food Vending businesses. Her husband Roberto E., who is 34 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are 3 to 8 years old. 

Velenda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Velenda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 9th loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000 which she intends to use to buy more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and for home repairs. 

Velenda E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Eron

texts.en:
Eron N. lives in the Kyebando Nsooba neighborhood in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, three of whom are in school. Eron lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

Eron is in the business of selling clothes. She has been doing so for over ten years and works seven days out of every week. Eron sells her clothing at the market for retail prices. She also generates additional income through farming.

Eron has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. The main business challenges for Eron include transportation and the rainy season that hinders her customers from reaching her. Her goal for her business is to start importing secondhand clothes.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Elkanah

texts.en:
Elkana M. is 45 years old. He is married and supports a family of six members. His children are between 4 and 20 years of age. He has a retail shop, that he has been running for the last three years, on a busy street in Narok. 

Elkana learned about KADET from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his second loan. He is planning to use the loan to boost his capital so that he can buy more goods for his store. With the anticipated profit he intends to buy his own car inorder to transport goods to different markets with ease and to expand his business.

Elkana's future dream is that he will become a wholesaler. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for his store.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Arnaldo tiene 47  años, vive en casa propia, está casado con la señora Cristina Marín, tienen cuatro hijos de los cuales 1 está cursando el segundo año de Administración en Empresas en la facultad, otro está en la secundaria y 2 están en la primaria, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres todos tienen ls posibilidad de recibir buena educación.
Arnaldo emprendió su actividad como fletero hace más de 5 años cuando pudo adquirir para su camioneta que le es de mucha utilidad, pues actualmente está transportando caña de azúcar a la fábrica Alpasa distante a 12 km de la ciudad, además cuenta con una despensa donde atiende su esposa con la ayuda de sus hijos, cuentan con clientela formada.
Arnaldo es un señor muy sacrificado quien se esfuerza diariamente para brindarle lo mejor a su familia y buena educación a sus hijos para adquirir una profesión universitaria.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de cubiertas y mercaderías en general para aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is 47 years old.  He lives in his house with his wife Cristina Marín.  They have four children; one is in the second year studying Business Administration in college,one is in high school, and two are in primary school.  Thanks to their parents effort, all four children have the opportunity to receive a good education.

Arnaldo began his work as a freighter over five years ago when he bought a truck, which has been very useful since he uses it to transport sugar cane from the Alpasa factory located 12km outside the city.  Additionally, the family has a small grocery store with an established customer base, which has wife takes care of with the help of their sons.

Arnaldo is a very selfless man who works every day to give his family the best and provide his sons with a good education so they can have advanced careers.

Arnaldo needs the loan to buy tires for his truck and general merchandise to increase the grocery's stock.

loans.use: Purchase tires and buy merchandise to stock his grocery.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida is a resident of Raiwind, a small city in Pakistan known for its dairy industry. She lives with her family in a 2-room brick house in the area of Raja jang. She moved here 21 years ago after her marriage to M. A., a security guard in a private organization. Sajida has 3 sons and 2 daughters. Her elder son works in a factory while the other children are studying at the local school.

Sajida supports her family financially by doing embroidery. She has a good number of clients in nearby areas and receives regular orders from them every month. She learned embroidery skills from her mother before her marriage and now these skills are providing monetary advantages for her. Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah to improve her embroidery business. She will purchase embroidery material such as beads, colored thread and unstitched clothing in bulk and craft new embroidery designs that will help her finish her orders on time and increase her household income. Sajida has been operating this business for over 10 years and she is confident that business conditions will improve after making this loan investment. She is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan years, she has built a good credit record and attended every meeting.

loans.use: to buy embroidery material in bulk

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a single woman who lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a sand selling business for the past one year, selling at wholesale to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are house contractors. She hopes to be supplying sand in large quantities in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase six tons of sand for resale. She decided to work with Yehu to get a loan to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To  purchase six tons of sand for resale.

loans.name: Giannina  Daysi

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Giannina; ella tiene 19 años de edad, soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de juguetes navideños, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria, la socia a la vez es estudiante de la carrera profesional de turismo en la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco, la socia espera poder abrir su propia agencia de viajes.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más juguetes para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Giannina is a member of the "VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Giannina is 19 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling Christmas toys.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor.  Giannina is also studying a degree in tourism at the Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Dusco.  She hopes to be able to open her own travel agency.

Giannina is requesting this loan to buy more toys for her business.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more toys for her business

loans.name: Maria Vanessa

texts.es:
Vanessa de 26 años,  tiene una pequeña panadería que desde hace años atrás  ha estado administrando para poder mantener a sus dos hijos ya que es madre soltera. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana ha estado trabajando en su pequeña panadería desde que la liquidaron de su trabajo y con el dinero ahorrado compro harina, mantequilla y huevos para hacer panes y venderlos a sus vecinos. En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano elaborando los panes en su pequeño local.

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para su negocio por eso quiere continuar haciendo panes con ayuda de mas personal pero para lograr incrementar su negocio necesita comprar con el préstamo harina, mantequilla, huevos para su panadería.
texts.en:
Vanessa, 26 years old, has a small bakery that she started years ago to be able to take care of her two children, since she is a single mother.

Living in an urban area, she has been working in her small bakery since they closed down her work, and with the money she saved, she bought flour, butter, and eggs to make breads and sell them to her neighbors. Now she works starting very early (in the morning), making the breads in her little shop.

She has many aspirations for her business, and this is why she wants to continue making breads with help from more staff, but in order to grow her business she needs to buy flour, butter, and eggs for her bakery with this loan.

loans.use: Flour, butter, eggs

loans.name: Paulita Candida

texts.es:
Paulita mujer emprendedora, casada y con proyectos de mejora su vivienda y condiciones de vida. Tienen su propio negocio una pulpería en donde vende variedad de productos de uso cotidiano. 
Lo inicio con apoyo de su esposo, se le ha presentado la dificulta de recurso económico para suplir las necesidades de sus clientes. Agradece a la financiera que atreves de ella le ha brindado el apoyo para aumentar su inventario. 
Sus planes a futuro es convertir su pulpería en miscelánea. Con el préstamo que solicitad comprara cosméticos, ropas, accesorios, útiles escolares, productos básico arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite entre otros productos. Siendo  de gran beneficio al obtener mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Paulita is an enterprising woman, married, and with plans to improve their house and their living conditions. She has her own convenience store business where she sells a variety of daily use products. She started out with her husband’s support. She has been faced with the financial difficulty of providing her clients for their needs. She is thankful to the organization that has supported her in increasing her inventory. 

Her plans for the future are to convert her convenience store into a market. With the loan that she requests she will purchase cosmetics, clothing, accessories, school supplies, rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil and other products. She has seen a great benefit in obtaining more products.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama San Miguel, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Atlacahualoya, Axochiapan, en el estado de Morelos, México, está integrado por 7 mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, ellas son la señora Cecilia M. M. va a comprar mercancía azúcar por kilo, huevo por kilo, papel higiénico, aceite por litro, la señora Margarita M. Aragón va a comprar mercancía jabón, azúcar por kilo, aceite por litro, huevo por kilo, sabritas, refrescos, la señora Roberta M. M. va a comprar mercancía refrescos, jugos, jabón, chiles en vinagre, azúcar, huevo, aceite, la señora Lina C. Hernández va a comprar mercancía sabritas, refrescos, jugos por caja para surtir su negocio, la señora Alicia E. N. va a comprar harina, azúcar, huevo, mantequilla, esencias y una batidora para su negocio, la señora Virginia R. A. va a comprar hojas de maíz, maíz, manteca, una cazuela, para realizar sus tamales, la señora Alma América F. R. va a comprar refrescos, pepsicola por caja, jarrito, coca cola por mayoreo. La señora Roberta es la representante del grupo ella tiene 50 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos, ellos son Luis Enrique de 10 años de edad está estudiando la primaria, Arseño de 20 años de edad se fue a Estados Unidos a trabajar, Nayely tiene 17 años de edad no estudia le ayuda a su mama a atender la tienda. La señora Roberta tiene su tienda de abarrotes y solicito su préstamo para surtir su tienda va a comprar azúcar, jabón, cloro, refrescos, sabritas, pan bimbo, galletas, barcel, arroz, azúcar, leche, papel higiénico, agua purificada, frijol, platos y vasos desechables, inicio su negocio hace 10 años tenían dinero ahorrado, su esposo se fue a estados unidos a trabajar y después ella también se fue a Estados  Unidos a trabajar en una lavandería,  ella estuvo 2 años y medio y su esposo 3 años, ella le mandaba a su mama y se lo fue guardando en el Banco, su esposo también fue ahorrando le mandaba a su hermano y lo fue guardando en el banco lo que mandaba y cuando regresaron le entregaron el dinero que fueron ahorrando de ahí compraron el terreno, construyeron su casa y surtieron su tienda.  La señora Roberta también tiene su negocio de alfarería elabora cazuelas y ollas de diferentes tamaños, los jarros los elabora en día de muertos su esposo y ella trabajan en la alfarería y su hija en la tienda. Atlacahualoya es un pueblo donde les gusto a sus hijos vivir su mamá y sus hermanos llegaron ahí a trabajar en el campo y se quedaron a vivir ahí y como su mama cuidaba a sus hijos ellos ya no quisieron regresar a San Marcos y se quedaron a vivir en Atlacahualoya a ellos les gusta porque es tranquilo siembran cebolla, guajes del verde, celebran la fiesta de San Miguel el 29 de septiembre hay feria, primeras comuniones, bailes, toros. Su negocia a ayudado a su familia a tener dinero para los gastos de su hijo para la escuela, las mejoras que desea hacer a su vivienda son arreglar su casa ponerle azulejos, sus planes y esperanzas son sus hijos serán los que hicieran algo mas, les va a dejar su casa para ellos, ya si quieren seguir ya ellos verán, los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les damos las gracias por sus préstamos y que nos sigan prestando, espeR. no quedar mal, les agradecemos mucho porque nos están ayudando a crecer en nuestros negocios”.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "San Miguel," and it is located in the community of Atlacahualoya, Axochiapan, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. It consists of 7 women who know each other and are neighbors. They are Señora Cecilia M. M., who is going to buy merchandise: sugar by the kilo, eggs by the kilo, toilet paper, and oil by the liter; Señora Margarita M. Aragón is going to buy merchandise: soap, sugar by the kilo, oil by the liter, eggs by the kilo, Sabritas chips, and soft drinks; Señora Roberta M. M. is going to buy merchandise: soft drinks, juices, soap, peppers in vinegar, sugar, eggs, and oil; Señora Lina C. Hernández is going to buy merchandise: Sabritas chips, soft drinks, and juices by the case to stock her business; Señora Alicia E. N. is going to buy flour, sugar, eggs, butter, fragrances, and a mixer for her business; Señora Virginia R. A. is going to buy corn husks, corn, lard, and a casserole to make her tamales; Señora Alma América F. R. is going to buy soft drinks, PepsiCola by the case, pitchers, and CocaCola wholesale.

Señora Roberta is the representative of the group. She is 50 years old and is married, with three children: Luis Enrique is 10 years old and is in primary school; Arseño, who is 20, left for the United States to work; Nayely, who is 17, is not in school but helps her mother tend the store. Señora Roberta has a grocery store and is applying for the loan to stock her store. She is going to buy sugar, soap, bleach, soft drinks, Sabritas chips, Bimbo bread, crackers, Barcel snacks, rice, sugar, milk, toilet paper, purified water, beans, and disposable plates and glasses. She began her business 10 years ago with money they had saved. Her husband went to the United States to work, and later she also went to the United States to work in a laundry. She was there for two and a half years and her husband for three years. She sent money to her mother and she kept it in the bank. Her husband also saved and sent money to his brother, who kept what he sent in the bank. When they came back, her mother and her husband's brother turned over the money they had saved and then they bought land, built their house, and stocked her store. Señora Roberta also has a pottery business. She makes casseroles and pots of different sizes. She makes jars on the Day of the Dead. She and her husband work in the pottery business and their daughter works in the store. Atlacahualoya is a town where her children like to live. Her mother and her brothers came there to work in the fields and stayed there to live, and since her mother was taking care of their children, they didn't want to go back to San Marcos and stayed in Atlacahualoya to live. They like it because it is peaceful. They plant onions and green calabashes. They celebrate the fiesta of San Miguel on the 29th of September. There are fairs, first communions, dances, and bullfights. Her business has helped her family to have money for the school expenses of their son. The improvements that she wants to make on her house are to fix it up and put on tiles. Her plans and hopes are that her children will do something more. She is going to leave her house to them, if they want to continue living there, they will see.

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad "We give them thanks for their loans and for continuing to lend to us. We hope we don't make a bad impression. We thank them very much because they are helping us to grow in our businesses."

loans.use: Buy sugar, boxes of soap, bleach, soft drinks, Sabritas chips, Bimbo bread, crackers, Barcel snacks, rice, beans, eggs, sugar, milk, toilet paper, purified water, and disposable plates, glasses, and spoons

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, tiene 37 años, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con sus hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad, los cuales dependen económicamente de ella. El negocio de Blanca comienza desde las 10 de la mañana, su ventaja es que no existe otra persona cerca que venda tortillas por lo que eso le genera clientela.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar maíz, leña y gas, esto le ayudara a generar mayor producción, a cubrir la demanda y generar mejores ingresos para salir de sus gastos, lo cual le ayudara a brindar una excelente atención y servicio a los clientes.
El objetivo de Blanca es mantenerse en el negocio, aumentar su ganancia para algún día poder comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 37, lives in San Miguel in the Department of San Miguel with her children (ages 10 and 8) who are financially dependent on her. She sells tortillas and begins her work at 10am. Her advantage is that there are no other tortilla vendors nearby, so she is able to attract customers.

Blanca is requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood, and gas. This will help her increase production, keep up with demand, and generate more income so that she can stay ahead of her expenses. As a result, she will be able to provide excellent care and service to her customers.

Blanca’s goals include maintaining her business and increasing her revenues so that she will be able to buy a house someday.

loans.use: Purchase corn, firewood, and gas

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: From the province of Kompong Tom, Eng R., 55, makes a living by selling fish. She sells the fish that her husband gives her or that she buys from other fisherman. She currently earns an average of US$2 per day and she has been running her business for several years. Her husband is 40 years old and is a fisherman who works along a local river. Eng R. is the mother of three teenage children, all of whom are in school. Eng R. is concerned that she is hardly riding her bicycle to sell and she dreams of having a used motorbike to pick up her fish, but she doesn’t have money yet to buy one. Therefore, Eng R. would like to borrow a loan to purchase a second hand motorcycle for her transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a second hand motorcycle for her transportation.

loans.name: Fedila

texts.en:
Fedila is 52 years old, married and has two children. 

Fedila is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Fedila requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF tobuy feeds and to purchase an additional pig.

Fedila has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Fedila would like to repair their house and expand her pig fattening business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and purchase an additional pig

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 44-year-old divorced father of two children. Khalil works and lives in Saida, Lebanon. He specializes in vehicle repairs, fixing and painting bodywork. Khalil started his own business in 1995, but he has 30 years of experience. He works hard to provide for his children and he always tries to add something new to his business, to keep it growing.

Khalil has been a borrower of Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, for eight cycles. Each time he requests a loan, he uses it for a special improvement to his business. This time, Khalil is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a car to fix and sell for a good price, as he also likes to trade cars from time to time. Khalil hopes to buy a garage of his own and expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a car to fix up and trade

loans.name: Señor De Locumba Group

texts.es:
Bàrbara 56 años D. edad, divorciada, 3 hijos varones. Presidenta del grupo comunal "Señor D. Locumba".
D. sus 3 hijos, sòlo uno depenD. D. elL. y tiene 15 años estudia en el colegio secundaria.
Bàrbara es docente jubilada; por necesidad tuvo que buscar otro ingreso y venD. comida en L. puerta D. su propia casa. Por las mañanas prepara caldos (sopas), por las tardes menu`s (almuerzos), y por las noches venD. mazamorras (postres), y comidas.
El prèstamo que solicitò es para comprar abarrotes al por mayor y poder abastecer su negocio.
(En L. fotografìa Bàrbara està vestida con chompa color rojo y pantalòn azul, es L. segunda D. L. derecha. L. persona D. L. fotografìa pequeña D. L. parte superior derecha es Erick C. H. no se encontraba presente en L. reuniòn porque estaba estudiando; L. persona que no se encuentra en L. fotografìa es Carlos V. E. y no estuvo presente por motivo D. viaje).
texts.en:
Barbara is 56 years old, divorced, and has 3 sons.  She is the president of the communal bank "Señor D. Locumba."

Of her 3 sons, only one is still dependent upon her.  He is 15 years old and is in middle school.  

Barbara is a retired teacher.  Out of necessity, she had to look for another source of income so she sells food from a door in her house.  In the mornings she prepares soup and in the afternoons lunches.  At night she sells pastries and meals.

She is requesting a loan to buy groceries at wholesale so that she can have supplies for her business.

In the photograph, Barbara is dressed in a red sweater and blue pants; she is the second person on the right.  The person in the small picture on the right siD. is Erick C. H..  He was not present at the meeting because he was studying.  Carlos V. E. is also missing from the group picture; he could not attend the meeting due to the fact that he was traveling.

loans.use: to buy groceries at wholesale to use in her business

loans.name: Millicent Wambui

texts.en:
Millicent, 29, is married and has two children who are 9 and 4. Her spouse does business to produce additional income while she runs a boutique. She has been in this business for two years and has been getting good returns.

This is her second loan with KADET; she successfully repaid her first. She will use the money to restock her boutique with more clothes. She plans to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to open another outlet. 

She in future hopes to operate a large scale fashion shop and import clothes  herself.

loans.use: to buy stock for her boutique

loans.name: Yolanda Esmeralda

texts.es:
Yolanda Esmeralda tiene 48 años, es soltera vive  con una  hija de 12 años  en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA Patrón San Miguel se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Pailaloma a 60 minutos de la oficina pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 13 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de maíz, papas y trigo.

Yolanda se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas y trigo, los productos los compra en  Chillanes y en San Pablo cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es dar lo que la hija necesite sobre todo la educacion.

Ser una persona alegre.
texts.en:
Yolanda Esmeralda is 48 years old, single and lives with her 12 year old daughter in the Chillanes neighborhood, province of Bolívar.

The V.R.C. COOPERATIVA Patrón San Miguel Communal Bank is located in the Pailaloma area some 60 minutes from the office in the Chillanes neighborhood. The Bank is made up of 13 members who are in agriculture; they grow corn, potatoes and wheat.

Yolanda is a farmer; she grows corn, potatoes, and wheat. She buys her products in Chillanes and San Pablo at the end of each month and later sells them in the Sunday market of Chillanes.

Yolanda needs the loan to buy materials for her crops as well as fertilizers and manure. The loan will help her economically to meet her needs and increase her production as she fights plagues, diseases and the change in climate that affects her crops. Yolanda’s dream is to give her daughter everything she needs, especially and education.

She considers herself to be a happy person.

loans.use: buy materials for her crops as well as fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: La señora Irene es de la comunidad en el estado de Puebla, México, ella tiene 58 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 5 hijos Santos de 27 años de edad, Simón de 24 años de edad ellos son solteros, Yovani de 14 años de edad está estudiando la secundaria, Ángeles de 28 años de edad y Minerva de 26 años de edad ellas son casadas, ella tiene su negocio de venta de alfarería y solicito su préstamo para comprar loza, ollas, cazuelas, jarros, Greta, celite y leña, ella inicio su negocio hace 4 años por necesidad, aprendió con sus vecinos viendo como elaboraban las cazuelas y las ollas, ella fue guardando  lo de la venta de sus puerquitos que creaba y con eso compro la loza y el material para elaborar las cazuelas, las ollas y los jarros, ella está orgullosa de trabajar la alfarería su esposo le ayuda a vender la loza sale de viaje en su camioneta va a Tenancingo, Chalma, al estado de México, hay algunos clientes de esta comunidad que vienen a compran greta, celite para elaborar sus ollas, cazuelas y jarros, ella está contenta con este préstamo que le dan por que le da gusto comprar más loza para cuando llegan a comprar tiene mercancía para ofrecerles a sus clientes. San Marcos es un pueblo bonito, celebra  el 29 de Junio la fiesta de San Pedro, hay misas, procesión, jaripeo de toros. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos, gracias a ustedes estamos triunfando”.
texts.en: Mrs. Irene is from Puebla, México.  She is 58 years old, married and has 5 children.  Santos is 27 years old and  Simón is 24 years old.  They are single.  Yovani is 14 years old and in high school.   Ángeles is 28 years old and Minerva is 26 years old.  They are married.  She has her pottery business and applied for her loan to purchase pottery, cooking pots, casserole dishes, pitchers, glaze, celite, firewood.  She started her business 4 years ago out of necessity.  She learned by watching how her neighbors made the dishes and pots.  She saved what she earned from the pigs she raised and bought the pottery and the material to make dishes, pots and pitchers.  She is proud to be a potter and her husband helps her sell it.  He travels with his truck to Tenancingo, Chalma in Mexico.  Some customers in this area come to buy glaze and celite to make their cooking pots, casserole dishes and pitchers.  She is happy with this loan they are giving her because she can buy more pottery so she will have merchandise to offer her customers when they come to shop.  San Maros is a pretty town that celebrates San Pedro on June 29th with masses, processions and a rodeo with bulls.  She would like to say thank you to Kiva and Fundación Realidad for her loans, “thanks to you we are succeeding.

loans.use: to purchase pottery such as cooking pots, casserole dishes, pitchers, glaze, celite, firewood to sell and to make the cooking pots and casserole dishes.

location.town: Barrio San Pedro, Acteopan, Estado de Puebla

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 57-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and four children; two of them are still attending school. He has been involved in the agricultural field for the past 25 years. Then, he decided to proceed with his work independently; so he bought a plot of land and executed his own farming work. 

His farm produces all types of vegetables which are all sold to local markets. Because of his older age, he hired a part-timer to help him with the farming work. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase fertilizers and seeds. He notes that these purchases will allow him to better grow his products and will increase his business productivity. In the future, he is planning to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Tweyambe Hakabanda Group

texts.en:
Anthony is an enterprising 78-year-old man with three children. He lives in his own house in Kibaale, Uganda, with the desire to see all of his children self-reliant.

For 28 years Anthony has been a butcher and from his profits he has been able to pay the school fees for his children. He faces the challenge of defaulters but hopes to expand his business by opening up other branches.

Anthony is a member of a group where by policy each member guarantees the others’ loans. He is requesting a loan to buy cows for slaughter.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughter.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23 year old single man. He has been working as a barber for 8 years. He is well known in the region and liked by most of his customers.

Unlike most of his friends, who spent their childhood playing and enjoying every moment of it, Ahmad was only almost 15 years old when he started working. He is a hard worker. He develops his work every time he finds the suitable time to do so. 

Ahmad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy cosmetics requested by most of his customers. In addition, He will be paying off what's left from his new car purchase.
 
Ahmad hopes to expand his business more and more and to live up to his customers expectations.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for his business.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh was born in 1952. She lives in Phan Xa village in the Uy No community. She has two sons -- one has married and one is a taxi driver. Her husband has  died and her life is very hard.  

Minh has a store at home selling beverages. She has had this job for many years and has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND.  Minh has participated in SEDA since 2004.  In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 6,758,000 VND and repaid it punctually.  For this cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es: La señora Carmen Rosa D. 50 años es la presidente D. comité Camino al Éxito, hace 3 años ella integra este grupo, con 7 integrantes, todos se unieron con un propósito D. generar más ingresos para poder mantener a cada una D. sus familias, Carmen Rosa es casada y tiene 3 hijos, una D. ellas es independiente y los otros dos dependen D. ella y D. su esposo, ella tiene el negocio D. trabajos D. corospum  hace 6 años y con el tiempo ha prendido nuevas técnicas gracias a estudios y también a las revistas que tiene, con el esfuerzo D. ella y su esposo pagan los gastos D. su hogar, en el futuro ella quiere poner una pequeña empresa o un taller D. manualidades. Con el ultimo préstamo, piensa comprar materiales y herramientas.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen Rosa is 50 years old and serves as president of the committee named “Camino al Éxito” (Road to Success).  She joined this group three years ago and now there are seven members.  They are all united in their goal of generating more income to maintain their families.  

Carmen Rosa is married and has three children, one daughter is independent and the other two are still dependent on her and her husband.  She has a business making items out of craft foam.  Carmen started this business six years ago and has implemented new techniques over time as a result of courses she has taken and magazines she has read.  Due to their efforts, Carmen and her husband have been able to pay their household expenses.  In the future, she hopes to open either a small store or a craft workshop.  

With this latest loan, Carmen plans to buy materials and equipment.

loans.use: to buy materials and equipment.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 49 years old and married with five children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling clothes in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Nadia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a big shop for her business extension.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 38 and married with three children ages 18, 15 and 9. All of her children are schooling. She has been in farming in her hometown of Nkubu in Central Kenya for 16 years. Her farm produce of wheat, maize, beans and potatoes is sold locally.

She has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says she will use the income to venture into poultry farming. The milk produced from the dairy cow will go a long way in supplementing family meals.

Catherine, however, says the high costs of farm inputs like fertilizers and poor market prices are causing great harm to farmers. She remains happy with Juhudi Kilimo loan services.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en: Sareth, 52, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Sareth sells porridge and Chinese noodle, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a soldier, earning an income of USD 5. Each month, the family has to spend USD 100 on food and USD 32 on the other necessary expenses. Sareth is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Sheila has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned good, snacks and beverages.

Sheila is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Sheila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned good, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 39 years old and is married with four children aged between 5 and 13 years old. Alfred owns a canteen selling bread, biscuits, cakes and drinks. This is his second successful year in this business and his work is open from 7 a.m. until 6:30 p.m. every day. He currently employees one person to help him. 

Alfred has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase large quantities of food like bread, biscuits, cakes and drinks to sell. With this loan, Alfred will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting and saving for better financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of food like bread, biscuits and drinks to sell

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 36 year old a married woman and has two children, one is in school. She has had a business selling cool water and soda in Kator, South Sudan for four years.

Jackline requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase soda for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for the school fees of her child.

loans.use: To purchase soda to sell

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 2 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Altagracia is the coordinator of Fe y Amor 2 & 5 (Faith and Love). This group is made up of ten micro-entrepreneur women, and it is located in the city of La Romana, a rural area of the country dedicated to the harvest of sugar cane, in a batey founded for sugar cane workers, especially for Haitians.

Altagracia lives with her long-term partner and her six children. She says that her most important challenge is to have a house, and stop paying rent, and her most favorite thing to do is to eat; she loves to eat. She is running a miscellaneous sales business where she sells chicken, charcoal, and clothes. She has a small stand by her house where she sells the chicken and the charcoal, especially in the morning, and in the afternoon she sells the clothes by walking in her and other communities. With this loan, she is planning to buy many pounds of chicken, bags of charcoal, and different clothing. 

She is excited to receive her third loan with Esperanza. She has been part of this group for almost a year, and with each loan she has been able to improve her business. With her business profits, she will reinvest in her business and save. Altagracia thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: to buy pounds of chicken, charcoal, and clothes.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma es socia del banco comunal Bellavista del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos.
Lleva buen tiempo trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, tiene una bodega bien surtida en el mercado, donde pasa casi todo el día, en las mañanas tiene que regresar a su casa para hacer el almuerzo para sus hijos, a pesar que trabaja no descuida su hogar, siempre está al pendiente de sus hijos.     
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 cajas de panetones, 2 cajas de leche, 6 cajas de chocolate, 1 kilo de canela, ½ kilo de clavo, 2 kilos de chuño, 1 paquete de harina preparada, ½ caja de huevos, 2 cajas de galletas, condimentos para embasar.
Su esposo es el que mantiene el hogar y los ingresos que ella genera son para hacer crecer el negocio familiar, tiene una persona que le ayuda en su bodega mientras está ausente, gracias a Manuela sigue creciendo.
texts.en: Irma is a member of the communal bank called Bellavista in the district of Calleria in Ucayali.  She is 34 years old and married with 4 children.  She has been working with loans from the communal bank for some time, and this has helped her stock her small general store where she works all day.  In the late mornings she returns home to prepare lunch for her children,  and still needs to take care of her house after finishing work.  Irma is always watching out for her children's well being.  With the loan, she will stock her store with various items such as pastries, milk, chocolate, cinnamon, cloves, flour, eggs, crackers and condiments.  Her husband covers the household expenses so Irma's income is used to grow the business.   Irma now has a person helping her at her store, and thanks to the loans she's received she continues to increase her sales.

loans.use: to stock her small grocery store with milk, chocolate, cinnamon, cloves, and other items.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. María vive en la zona del plan 3000. Tiene 3 hijos, es madre soltera  vive junto a su madre quien le ayuda con el cuidado de sus hijos. Ella tiene un taller de Cerrajería en su propio domicilio donde realiza marcos para ventanas y puertas de fierro. El crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de material de  construcción para un tinglado para el taller de cerrajería  ya que en la temporada de lluvia no pueden trabajar. La Sra. María es una persona trabajadora, ya que siendo madre soltera ella sola se encarga de mantener a sus tres hijos y pagar sus estudios, con esta actividad salió adelante, su deseo es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales, y personas de bien, se siente agradecida por el apoyo brindado .
texts.en:
María lives in the plan 3000 zone.  She lives with her mother and she herself is the single mother of three children.  Her mother helps her care for her children.  She runs a metal shop out of her home where she makes metal door and window frames.  She will use the money from this loan to buy building materials for a workshed for her workshop, because she’s unable to work during the rainy season.

María is a hardworking woman.  As a hardworking woman she must support her three children and provide for their education, and watch them become professionals and people of means.  She’s grateful for the support she gets.
 .

loans.use: to buy building materials for a workshed.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 65-year-old businessman. He is married to Elizabeth, a businesswoman, and they are blessed with one child aged 19. Philip has been running a retail shop for the past ten years making a monthly income of 4,500 KES, which he uses to support his family.
Philip is applying for his fourth loan with Kiva partner KADET after repaying his previous loans successfully. Philip will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil in preparation for the increase in purchases during the festive season. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will expand his business. 
Philip's hope and dream is own a wholesale shop, which will help him educate his child up to university level.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kédiaw  Diabate

texts.fr: l'emprunteuse est une femme mariée sans enfants. Elle exerce un commerce de d'huile de palm et de miel.Elle vit avec son mari et son petit frère dans la maison de ses parents, tous deux décédés.Elle a démarré son activité avec des fonds reçus de la tontine de son quartier. Pour renforcer son commerce , elle sollicite un prêt de 150 000f de l'UIMCEC pour acheter 100 litres d'huile de palm et 50 litres de miel. Son ambition est d'établir une cantine au marché central pour mieux écouler ses produits.
texts.en: The borrower is a married woman without children. She has a business selling palm oil and honey. She lives with her husband and her little brother in her parents' house, both of whom are deceased. She started up her business with funds received from her area's tontine, or community lending institution. To strengthen her business, she seeks a loan of 150,000f from UIMCEC to buy 100 liters of palm oil and 50 liters of honey. Her ambition is to establish a canteen at the central market to better sell her products.

loans.use: to buy 200 liters of palm oil and 50 liters of honey.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née en 1982 à Sikasso, Fatoumata est divorcée et mère de deux garçons vivant dans une grande traditionnelle élargie à Médine, un des quartiers périphérique de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, Fatoumata s’est initiée  à cette activité d’achat et de ventes des articles d’alimentation depuis plus de cinq  années. Elle mène son activité devant son domicile à Médine Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de deux années et elle a bénéficié  de quatre prêts qui ont été remboursés avec succès.
Ainsi, elle sollicite un cinquième prêt pour  lui permettre d’acheter auprès de ses fournisseurs de Sikasso mais aussi de Bamako, 50 paquets de boisson NBB, 50 casiers de boisson BRAMALI, 80 cartons d’eau minérale, 15 cartons de lait Candia, 30 cartons de boisson en canette différentes (Malta, Vimto, Ivorio), 20 paquets d’eau minérale en sachets et des cartons de biscuits de qualité différentes.
 Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 170 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt
texts.en:
Born in 1982 in Sikasso, Fatoumata is divorced and the mother of two lively boys.  They live in a large traditional extended family in Médine, a district on the outskirts of Sikasso (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

After having tried several types of work unsuccessfully, Fatoumata took up the business of buying and selling grocery products more than five years ago.  She conducts her business in front of her home in Médine Sikasso where she is much in demand by her customers for the quality of her products. 

In order to meet the growing demand of her customers, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso more than two years ago and she has taken out four previous loans which were successfully repaid. 

She is requesting a fifth loan which will allow her to buy, from her suppliers in Sikasso in Bamako, 50 cases of the drink NBB, 50 cases of the drink Bramali, 80 cases of mineral water, 15 cases of Candia milk, and 30 cases of various canned drinks (Malta, Vimto, Ivorio), 20 packs of mineral water in bags, and boxes of  various types of cookies. 

She foresees earning a monthly profit of 170,000 FCFA which will mostly be used to increase her working capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is married with three children. She has sold trousers, shoes and bags to earn a living for the past four years. She earns extra income from her farm as well.

Since Catherine joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children. She has applied for a 60,000 KES loan to buy additional trousers, bags and shoes to sell. She hopes to expand her business into a wholesale one in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional trousers, bags and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Julia Mercedes

texts.es:
Julia originaria de León, pero actualmente vive en Estelí, soltera, de oficio comerciante, madre de 4 hijos. Ella cuenta que inicio su negocio con ayuda de sus hermanos y el papa de sus hijos, fue a la edad de 30 años que inicio su negocio de pulpería, este ha sido su  primer negocio y lo administra en su casa.
Julia solicita el préstamo para comprar granos básicos como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergente y jabón, pasta de dientes, avenas, pan, cosméticos etc. Ella  estima que este préstamo le será de gran ayuda, para poder surtir con más productos su pulpería, incrementar el volumen de sus ventas a  y asi generarles mas ganancias en su negocio, sus objetivo es ampliar su pulpería para satisfacer las necesidades de sus  clientes.

loans.use: Para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergente y jabón, pasta de dientes, avenas, pan, cosméticos etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sheila would like to buy beauty products and hair products

loans.name: Herize

texts.en: Ferize H. is 49 years old. Previously he has worked in the mining industry but 10 years ago the mining company was closed so he had to start a business to take care of his family. He started a retail business. He opened a stall on the town market and sold clothes on it. Two years ago his wife took this business and he started another business – taxi driving. Now in the mornings he helps his wife on the market stall and in the evenings he is on the street with his taxi. Ferize H. needs $1200. This money together with his own savings will help him to exchange his car to a newer one.

loans.use: For a new car

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela is a hard working and responsible woman. She is a single mother of a son. Nine years ago, she became unemployed and to sustain and educate her child, she started her own business. In the beginning, she only sold refreshments and fried snacks, but by customer request, she started to better stock her business, which grew out to be a well assorted grocery store. Recently, she was able to buy a refrigerator that she needed to offer higher quality products and to further expand her offering.

With the goal to increase her assortment, Gaby requests a loan of $475 that she will use to buy merchandise, because she wants to give good service to her customers and count on them to return. She commits to pay back the loan in 6 to 12 months.

Right now is the moment to help those who need most. You can become an important part of her accomplishments. She and her son appreciate your generosity a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Gabriela es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, ella es madre soltera de un hijo, hace nueve años quedó desempleada y para poder darle sustento y educación a su pequeño inició su propio negocio, inicialmente sólo vendía refrescos y frituras pero a petición de sus clientes fue surtiendo mejor su negocio, que ahora es una tienda de abarrotes bien surtida, hace poco logró comprar un enfriador que necesitaba para ofrecer sus productos en mejores condiciones e incrementar su variedad.

Con la finalidad de incrementar sus ventas, Gaby solicita un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía porque quiere brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes y contar con su preferencia, ella se compromete devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, tú puedes ser parte importante es sus logros, ella y su hijo agradecen mucho tu generosidad y ayuda.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia Z. works making and selling ice creams at the 16th of July Fair in the city of El Alto. As a creator of the famous "tocinillios" (homemade ice creams), Ms. Julia says that it's been over 10 years that she has dedicated herself to this business, which helped her to get by as a single mother to 4 children.

Today, Julia is grandmother to two children who live with her, along with two of her younger children, who also work in her business. Her principal objective is to establish a branch in the city of Cochabamba, where there exists an important market due to the climate and access to ingredients.

At the moment, Julia needs capital in order to supply herself with ingredients that come from Cochabamba, which she will use to prepare the ice creams she will sell at parades and gatherings for the next national holiday.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Julia Z., se dedica a la fabricación y venta de helados en la Feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto; precursora de los famosos “tocinillos” (helados caseros), la señora Julia cuenta que son más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, mismo que le permitió salir adelante sola y con sus 4 hijos.

En la actualidad, Julia es abuela de dos nietos que viven con ella y con dos de sus hijos menores, dedicados al mismo negocio. Su principal objetivo es el establecimiento de una sucursal en la ciudad de Cochabamba donde existe un importante mercado por las condiciones climáticas y el acceso a la materia prima.

Por el momento, Julia necesita de capital para poder abastecerse de materia prima procedente de Cochabamba, para preparar la venta de sus helados en los desfiles y concentraciones a raíz de la proximidad de las fiestas patrias.

loans.use: Julia needs capital in order to supply herself with the ingredients she needs to make her ice creams.

loans.name: Farkhad

texts.en: Farkhad lives in the Yenikand village of the Salyan region. This 54-year-old man is married and has 4 children. He started farming 14 ago and now requests a loan of  $475 to buy pesticides for his farm.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Sra Carina Treposwski, 59, is married to Sr. Justo, 66, together they have three adult children. Their children remain grateful to them and have not forgotten how Carina and Justo sacrificed to bring them up and pay for their studies, for this they give them a little money each month. 
Carina began her business in 1989 with the help of her husband. It cost them much to open their small shop. When Justo’s Father died Carina and Justo inherited a small piece of land. With this land, they care for three cows, which provide the milk they sell in their store. This supplement has allowed them to pay for their children’s education. 
Today, they have more money but their age prevents them from doing other activities. From time to time they have to pay for visits to the doctor as well as other obligations.
The store is their sole source of income. It is for this reason that Carina wishes to vary the products she offers as well as bring in items included in a notions store. Regarding the latter, no such store exists in her areas and she is sure that she will be successful.

loans.use: Purchase  ítems for a general store: clothing, gifts, perfumes, shoes and other

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa (his mother is pictured) is married and has one child.  H.'s family lives in the Salyan region in the Yenikand village.  He has run this business for 7 years.  Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Lusajo

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Lusajo M. is 31 years old. She is married with three children, ages 1,4, and 8. In 2005, Lusajo established a shoes and clothing business. Lusajo has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA. She now requests a loan of $900 in order to purchase additional stock. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Radhadevi

texts.en:
Mrs. Radha Devi S. is a 45 year old lady who lives in Chappagaun village. Chappagaun is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. S. lives in a single family home with her husband, one son and two daughters. Her older daughter is studying at BBS 2nd year level and her younger daughter is in grade 2. Her son is studying in grade 5.

Mrs. S. and her husband Mr. Dal Bahadur S. are both engaged in mushroom farming. They sell their product at the local market and supply local shops.

Now Mrs. S. seeks a Rs 10000 loan to buy fertilizer and mushroom seeds for their work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and mushroom seeds for her work

loans.name: Fatuma's Tunajiamini Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 35 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, aged 15, 13, 10, and 6 months. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, aged 80 and 75. Fatuma owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2005. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 7:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Fatuma now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has business dealings in food vending as well.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Taga 3 Centre – Group 3

texts.en:
The seven women from Taga, Savaii, who constitute the loan group, are borrowing from SPBD for the first time. They all have undergone four weeks of training in business management and savings account maintenance, and have passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments, and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and will guarantee that each one of them does payments on time.

Lineta E. (39, married, 5 children) will purchase: a sewing machine, materials, 2 scissors, 4 spools of thread, 5 needles, petrol, and other materials to make clothes.

Niaumasi L. (68, married, 7 children) will purchase: a weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, seeds, and a wheel barrow for her cabbage, tomato, taro and other produce plantation.

Finauvale L. (51, married, 9 children) will purchase: a weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, taro roots, and will hire laborers for her bananas, yams, taro and other produce plantation.

Ane S. (44, divorced, 5 children) will purchase: a weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, fertilizer, and will hire workers for her taro plantation.

Vasati F. (77, married, 6 children) will purchase: a weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, seeds, 2 knives, and a filing. She will also will hire workers and buy food for her cabbage, tomato, beans and other produce plantation.

Maria Imeleta N. (27, single) will purchase: flour, sugar, rice, salt, and a packet of chicken and mutton flaps (lamb ribs) for her retail shop.

Tumama T. (48, married, 4 children) will purchase: timber, sand, sugar, noodles, chemicals, and other food for her canteen and plantation businesses.

loans.use: Purchase a weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, farming tools, etc.

loans.name: Dorothea's Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Dorothea is a divorced woman with 3 children, ages 28,18, and 14 years old. Dorothea sells food, and she started in 1998. Every day, she works from 8 am to 9 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $225 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Rosemery and Frida, one who sells clothes and the other is a shop owner.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Asnati

texts.en:
Hello from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 49 year-old Asinati Shemahombe. She is married, and has six children aged between 15 and 25. She has three dependents, who live with her because they are orphans. In 2003, Asinati established her café business. Asinati requires a loan in order to purchase additional ingredients, such as rice, beans, cooking oil and sugar, as well as utensils. She thanks you for your support.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Purchase additional ingredients, such as rice, beans, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou S. is 51 years old, married with 7 children in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Peyrissac since 2001. She buys loads of firewood and re-sells them at retail. Fatou would like to strengthen her business to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Fatou S.,51 ans, mariée, 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 2001. Elle achète des chargements de bois de chauffe et revend au détail. Fatou veut renforcer son activité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To trade in firewood

loans.name: Fatuma Kazigati's Group

texts.en:
Fatuma K. is the leader of a group of four women.  She is 50 and married.  Fatuma lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.
Fatuma runs a small restaurant in Kiguli Zone.The market for her business is fair.The greatest challenge Fatuma faces is the limited availability of capital.

Fatuma plans to use this loan to expand her business.  In doing so, she will also be able to increase her income.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ajakore

texts.en: Ajakore supplies bags of charcoal to women who cook food on the roadside -- roast yam, plantains, and corn at strategic locations. She also sells to housewives who use firewood for cooking. She has been in this business since 1998. She learned this business from her elder sister. Ajakore is 36 years old and married to Mr. M.. They have three children. She and her family live in Lagos state. Ajakore needs the loan amount of $450 to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokheng D., 28, and her husband, Mr. Khim Khon, 28, live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1996 and have three children: one son and two daughters. All of their children study in local schools.

Mrs. Sokheng has been a silk weaver since 1995, a skill she learned from a relative. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Khim is also a weaver and does construction work, farms, and raises animals as well.

Mrs. Sokheng is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to buy a construction crane for her husband's construction business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and to buy a construction crane for her husband

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 40 años de edad, estudió tercero de secundaria, es conviviente, progenitora de 03 hijos (02 varones de 21, 18 años y 01 mujer de 10 años de edad), vive en el Jr. Cuzco Nº 104 del Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo – Puno.

Hace 04 años es socia del Banco Comunal “Wiñay Marca”- Yunguyo. A los 18 años de edad tuvo su pareja y empezaron con la venta de: lavadores, tachos, baldes, etc. (plastiquería) a la fecha  que trae de la ciudad de Desaguadero, paralelo a su negocio, aperturó su tienda de abarrotes hace 04 años.

Con el crédito que solicitará de S/.3000.00 nuevos soles, el que pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará: plastiquerias valor de S/.1500.00 y abarrotes con S/.1500.00, para ser comercializados al por mayor y menor.

Su sueño es tener una tienda de plastiquerias y que sus hijos estudien para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Lidia is 40 years old, studied until the third grade, lives with her partner, is the mother of three children (two boys ages 21 and 18, and one 10 year old girl), and lives at Jr. Cuzco Nº 104 in the district and province of Yunguyo – Puno. For the past four years, she has been a member of the “Wiñay Marca”- Yunguyo Communal Bank. At 18, she and her partner began to sell scrubbers, wastebaskets, buckets, etc. (plastic goods) that she brought from the city of Desagadero. While she was selling plastic goods, she opened a grocery store four years ago. With this loan of $975, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy plastic goods and groceries to be sold wholesale and retail. Her dream is to have a plastic goods store and to see her children study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic goods and groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase beauty products and materials for a small beauty parlor.

loans.name: Kae

texts.en:
Mr. Kae K. is a villager in Krodas Khor village in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. He is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar and wine. His wife, Mrs. Sum Im, is farmer who cultivates a little rice revenue. Their small income cannot provide for better living conditions for the household.

On the rice plantation, the soil has become infertile which reduces the rice crop. In order to deal with this problem, Mr. Kae K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to make his wife's soil more productive.

Mr. Kae K., 32, is the father of four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the remaining two are too young to work or study. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make the rice crop more productive.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence F. sells clothing and cosmetics at Ankaful near Elmina. Florence has received junior high education. She is married and has 1 child. Her husband works in arts and crafts. Florence has been selling clothing and cosmetics since 2006. She is responsible for helping her husband pay rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of the family.

Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to buy more clothing and cosmetics for re-sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her family. The items she has in hand are samples of the kind of goods she sells.

loans.use: additional capital to enable her to buy goods for re-sale

loans.name: Marie
