texts.fr: La dame Marie G. est une veuve de 50 ans, mère de 04 enfants avec 02 autres tous adultes mais elle continue de participer aux dépenses familiales. Elle envisage avec ce prêt d’acheter de l’huile de palme et du jus de citron pour les revendre en détail. Elle ira s’approvisionner en Guinée Bissau ou la denrée est moins chère pour la revendre à Dakar, la capitale sénégalaise. Le bénéfice obtenu lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marie G. is a widow, aged 50, the mother of 4 children with two others, all adults, but she continues to participate in covering family expenses. With this loan, she plans to buy palm oil and lemon juice to retail. She will go to stock up in Guinea Bissau where foodstuffs are less expensive, and then will sell her goods in Dakar, the capital of Senegal. The profit she will make will allow her to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her business buying and selling palm oil and lemon juice

loans.name: Thuli Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuli Maiya L. lives in Khokhana-Dobato, Lalitpur. She has four members including herself in her family. 
She is a farmer in Khokhana-Dobato, and she grows different types of vegetables. Due to the lack of technology, most of the farmers in this area depend on seasonal farming. 

Mrs. L. sells her vegetables in the local vegetable market in the mornings and evenings. Now she is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her work. She has two sons and a daughter. All of her children are now studying. A few years ago her husband died and now she has sole responsibility for her 3 children.

loans.use: To buys fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Demoiselle A. Afiwaga âgé 49 ans est célibataire avec un enfant. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des pagnes. Elle est une revendeuse ambulante c’est-à-dire qu’elle vend de maison en maison et de quartier en quartier. Elle a commencé par exercer cette activité depuis 1998 ce qui fait qu’elle est bien expérimentée dans le domaine. 
Ce troisième prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 12 pièces de pagne de qualité supérieure.
texts.en:
Ms. Afiwaga A. is 49 years old and single with one child. She sells fabrics door to door in different neighborhoods. She has been doing this since 1998 and, as such, has a great deal of experience. This third loan that has been requested will allow her to purchase 12 pieces of superior quality fabric.

Translated from French by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Fabric

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther G. is 29 years old and married without a child. She hopes to have a child some day. She sells medicine and provisions. She is a hardworking woman.

Esther is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more medicines and provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine and provisions to sell

loans.name: Carmen Eddy

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar.
Carmen es casada, tiene 52 años y 5 hijos, Carmen viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo, sus productos los transporta con carro propio, además tiene carros con los cuales realiza transporte de pasajeros.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Carmen sueña con hacer crecer sus negocios y tener una cadena de farmacias.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Bienestar communal bank. She is married, 52 years old and has 5 children. Carmen travels to the Ayacuchana forest where she sells groceries, an activity she does with her husband. The products are transported in their own car and they also have cars that they use as public transport. Carmen needs a loan of 3000 Soles which will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Carmen dreams of growing her business and having a chain of pharmacy stores.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice and sugar

loans.name: Nathaniel Roy

texts.en:
Nathaniel Roy S. is from the city of Santiago. He is 43 years old. Nathaniel Roy is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nathaniel Roy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising fish for sale.

Nathaniel Roy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nathaniel Roy is requesting a new loan of 9000 Philippine Pesos which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serving the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Dolores Yolanda

texts.es: Dolores Yolanda Calderón tiene 62 años, es madre soltera. Tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Dolores tiene un negocio cono lo es la venta de productos de belleza y ropa,  el cual es distribuido de manera ambulante. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 8 años y lo encontró como una manera de ganarse la vida, principalmente como una alternativa por el alto nivel de desempleo. Dolores inicio con muy poca cantidad de cosméticos distribuidos principalmente a personas conocidas como sus amistades y familiares, después fue ampliando su negocio hasta ofertárselo a mayores cantidades de clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo en la compra de mercadería como cremas, perfumes, desodorantes, pinturas de uña, pintura de labios entre otros. Los sueños de Dolores son de ampliar cada día mas su negocio de tal manera que sea un ingreso para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dolores Yolanda Calderón, 62, is a single mother. She has three children who all work independently. Dolores sells beauty products and clothes as a street vendor. She started this business eight years ago, and she found a way to make a living. Primarily, it is a good alternative to the high level of unemployment. Dolores started with a very small amount of cosmetics, which she mainly distributed to people she knows like her friends and family. Later, her business was growing and she could offer her products to more customers. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy merchandise like creams, perfumes, deodorants, nail polish, and lipstick, among other things. Dolores’ dream is to expand her business every day in such a way that it becomes an income for her and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is engaged in a gasoline and cell-phone load retailing business. Her business is very in demand in their village but she lacks enough capital in order to meet her desired income. This is the reason why she is asking to borrow PHP 4,000 from Kiva as additional capital to further improve her business.

Jovita’s husband, George, is managing a farming business that supports their major family necessities. Jovita dreams that someday, they will able to support the education of their two children till they finish college.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal Kutimuy que significa Regresa en quechua.
Marcelina es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Marcelina se dedica a la compra y venta de tuna en época de producción, producto que compra de los productores y los lleva a la ciudad de lima en donde los comercializa, también compra tara y cochinilla que vende a los intermediarios. Además Marcelina brinda servicios de transporte con su carro.
Marcelina necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de neumáticos para su carro.
Los sueños de Marcelina son tener una tienda estable y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the Kutimuy -- which means "return" in quechua -- community bank. Marcelina lives with a partner, is 40 years old and has two children. Marcelina is dedicated to the purchase and sale of tuna (the exotic fruit, prickly pear), when it's in season. She buys from producers and takes the product to the city of Lima where she sells it. In addition, she purchases tara (a native shrub) and cactus which she sells to middlemen. In addition, Marcelina provides transportation services with her car. Marcelina needs a loan of 3,000 soles which will be invested in the purchase of tires for her car. Marcelina's dreams are to have a stable shop and that her children finish their education.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of tires for her car.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda A. is from the village of Danao. She is 46 years old. Nilda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Nilda operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Nilda has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (about $208) a month for these activities.

In 2000, Nilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Nilda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Nilda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando M. S. es un señor de 31 años de edad quien vive con su esposa y sus dos pequeñas hijas en una comunidad llamada El Saíno de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios, lo que ayuda a mitigar el efecto de inmigración.

Desde muy joven don Fernando se ha dedicado a la siembra de piña, por lo tanto, dice que tiene bastante experiencia en el cuidado y mantenimiento de esta clase de cultivo tiene un pequeño  terreno en el cual ha sembrado piña anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirlo por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Fernando es un micro crédito de ¢400,000 cuatrocientos mil colones), para darle mantenimiento y asistencia a su plantación, además de comprar los insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar una muy buena cosecha. 

Don Fernando es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Luz del Futuro Saino , una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Fernando M. Sequeiro, 31, lives with his wife and two small daughters in a community named El Saíno de Pital. It is located in the Alajuela province. The main productive activities are livestock and agriculture. Growing pineapple stands out because it is primarily sold in international markets. For that reason, the development of the community has been growing in the last few years. This generates a larger demand for products and services, which helps to mitigate the effect of immigration. Fernando has devoted himself to growing pineapples since he was very young. He, therefore, has considerable experience in the care and maintenance of this type of crop. He has a small piece of land where he has previously grown pineapple. It gave him good results at distribution time. That is why he wishes to expand his fields. Thanks to this business, his family’s quality of life has improved considerably. Fernando is asking for a loan for ¢400,000 (four hundred thousand colones) for maintenance and assistance in his fields. He will also buy necessary supplies to guarantee a very good harvest. Fernando is a member of the Luz del Futuro Saino Community Credit Company, one of the 100 organizations partnered with EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his third loan, and he expects to grow more on a personal and economic level. Thanks to this type of organization and their means for facilitating loans, he can spend more time on his productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and maintenance for planting pineapples

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora María es soltera, tiene 51 años, con 5 hijos,  todos casados y con ingresos propios.
La despensa montó gracias a un pequeño capital que había  ahorrado durante varios años. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta ambulante de ropas. 
Quiere comprar mercaderías al por mayor, pues, así consigue más barato y tiene un margen importante de ganancia. 
La señora María es una persona muy activa tiene un espíritu jovial, y cuenta con un carácter muy agradable por lo que muchas personas siempre está alrededor de ella. Manifiesta que quiere mejorar su negocio ya que es la fuente de su ingreso. 
Ella se esfuerza al  máximo para mejorar su casa, pero sin descuidarse del capital de su negocio por lo que considero que es una persona a quien debemos apoyar constantemente, ya sea económica y moralmente.

loans.use: Compra de Gaseosas, Yerbas, Vinos y Otros

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok H. makes wooden furniture. He sells his finished product to buyers who come directly to his house and he  transports his furniture to sell around his community. He makes over 10 sets before selling out. He also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make additional income. His wife stays at home to do housework and also helps him in the business. 

Recently, Sok H. has run out of essential materials from his stock supply and he hopes to acquire other raw materials to continue making furniture. He depends on using his Kiva loan as an advance. Sok H. is a 49-year-old married man blessed with four children; three of whom are married. Two of Sok H.'s children are employed. His eldest daughter works in garment industry and his second son is a carpenter.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make furniture

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Doña Francisca T. de Cuarenta y cinco años de edad casada con originaria de la comunidad de Xantun del Municipio de Totonicapan  su actividad principal es la venta de ropa para damas, ella inicio su negoci hace diez años el problema que se tiene  es la falta de capital, por ser una persona muy sencilla las instituciones bancarias no confia en ella, manifiesta que escucho un anuncio por una emisora que la asociacion ASDIR da credito con requisitos factibles ya que dicho credito lo invertira en la compra de chalinas, para esta epocas son muy famosos por la epoca de frio del departamento Totonicapan.

loans.use: Ampliacion de Capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora MARIA P. Z., tiene 33 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN LUIS. Ella  presenta estudios  hasta 4to de Primaria y  tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 12 años de edad quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de leña y cerveza .Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro leña al por mayor para venderla en su casa y pueblos aledaños.
Con este crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles comprará leña y cajas de cerveza al por mayor. La socia sueña con aumentar sus ventas para poder así obtener dinero para educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria P. Z. is 33 years old. She lives in the Trujillo district of the province of Trujillo, in the State of La Libertad, Peru. This associate is part of the “San Luis” communal bank. She has completed studies up to the 4th grade of primary school and has 2 children of 9 and 12 years of age who are her economic dependants. This associate is in the business of buying and selling firewood and beer. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought firewood at wholesale in order to sell it at home and in surrounding towns. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy firewood and cases of beer at wholesale. This associate dreams of increasing her sales in order to earn money for educating her children.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: will purchase firewood and cases of beer at wholesale

loans.name: Maria Eulalia

texts.en:
Maria is a client of Asociación Arariwa.  She is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members and her group is called Virgen Inmaculada Concepción - Anta.  She is from Cusco and lives in Cusco.  She is 52 years old and married with three children.  One works in tourism, one studies at the university and the other is in high school.

Maria works at home.  She intends to use this loan to help her husband maintain his metalworking machines.  He works in is in Cusco.

Maria appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To help her husband maintain his metalworking machines

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This client was born in 1985 and is single. Since childhood he worked with his father and learnt a lot from him. Four years ago he established this shop for himself and carried on his work.

This is the second loan that he will receive from Al-Thiqa. The loan will increase his business and he will gain a good profit.

loans.use: To purchase iron and a welding machine

loans.name: Agali Awamu Nanono Marriam Group

texts.en: Marriam N. is both a loan group leader and a hardworking business woman. She is a widow with two children who has made a living selling clothes for the last 13 years. Marriam has applied for a loan to buy more clothing to sell to her customers. The loan will help her improve upon her business. She believes she can do this because she works very hard, is committed to raising her living standards and wishes someday to travel to Mecca for a pilgrimage.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Abosede

texts.en: Abosede is 35 years of age, and married with three children. Her husband is a civil servant in Lagos. She sells drinks both wholesale and retail. She started this business 8 years ago in order to support her family in the little way she can by providing the basic necessities of life. She needs a loan amount of NGN 170,000 to purchase more drinks in larger quantities to sell. She believes that having an assortment of drinks will increase her sales. She says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mich

texts.en: Mr. S., 29, is a married man who is blessed with school-aged children. He currently lives with his family in a wooden house in Phnom Penh city, where he has also built a medium-sized workshop from which he provides an invitation publishing service. His wife tries to earn money to meet the family’s financial crisis by sewing clothes from home. S. hopes to purchase more necessary equipment in order to provide a good service, and has therefore requested a loan from Kiva partner, HKL.

loans.use: To purchase more necessary equipment

loans.name: Amy Tawa

texts.fr: Amy Tawa D. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3 ans et demi. elle fait de l'embouche bovine et ovine, une activité qui lui génère des revenus lui permettant de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Amy Tawa D. is a 48-year-old married mother of 8 children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" (Village loan group) for 3 and a half years. She raises cattle and sheep, and this business generates an income that allows her to participate in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her business

loans.name: Maruush

texts.en:
Maruush is living with her husband who works in the city and moved from the countryside two years ago. She wanted to switch to clean fuel because it produces less smoke than other products and she wanted to contribute to reducing the city’s air pollution. Since purchasing the product, she has saved money on fuel and is happy that she purchased the eco-friendly fuel.  She said, “This product is very efficient to use”. She is also happy to receive reduced interest rates for the fuel.

About XacBank Eco Products Program
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world.  Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius.  60% of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. 60% of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To purchase clean and energy efficient heating fuel

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
El Nabi Elyas is a village in Jenin District where Kamal and his family live and his vegetables store is located. Kamal is a 47-year-old man who is married and has one daughter. His small store is located on the main street of El Nabi Elyas village where almost everyone coming to the area must pass by.

Kamal has requested a loan from FATEN to fill his store with a larger variety of vegetables and fruits as well as enlarging his space to be able to serve a larger number of customers. This will reflect on his financial situation and help him make more money.

Kamal tells us that his store faces one problem: being banned from selling his vegetables to those who are from Israel while Jenin is an area open to visitors from Israel.

loans.use: To purchase a larger variety of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Jyldyz's Group

texts.en:
The childhood of Jyldyz I. was not so bad; that means not so good. From an early age, she has been taught to be strong and able to confront the difficulties which life sometimes brings. However, she is kind, cheerful and social, someone who one can talk through the long winters evening and never get fed up. Having graduated from the university, she worked as a supervisor in a company that later declared bankruptcy. Her determined mind did not collapse and later on, she opened up her own business, which she still has. At the beginning, she sold goods such as sugar, oil, flavoring, and salt at home but later on she bought a pavilion. Speaking about her private life, she is 39 and a tremendous lady. She is married and has three children; two of them are boys and the youngest is a daughter. Her older son and daughter attend a local school and after school, they help her in the business. Her husband is a taxi driver and also helps her in her job. She opened up the business about 10 years ago with 1,000 KGS (22$) and since then she did a complete overhaul of their house and bought a car. Now her profit is 10,000 KGS (227$). She is planning in the future to buy cattle and expand it. However, now she needs a loan to buy tableware and souvenir ware to sell during the spring holidays. 

Aynur M. is a decisive woman. She is 47 and has two children. Her daughter who is 24 graduated from the university and now works in a private company. Her son who is nineteen is a student. At first, 15 years ago, she started her business with 10,000 KGS (227$). She was selling clothes but shifted to reselling cattle. Now her profit is 8,000 KGS (181$) and they have already bought a car. Now, to buy three cattle to fatten and resell, they need a loan from Mol Bulak Finance. 

Farida K. is a married 32-year-old young lady.  She has three children: two sons and a princess daughter. Her husband is a taxi driver who is a good supporter of her. She sells daily foodstuffs. They began their business five years ago with 5,000 KGS (113$) and now the profit is 7,000 KGS (160$). They want to increase the turnover by getting a loan from Mol Bulak Finance.

Dinara J., 43, is married and has four children. Her husband is a metalworker. As to her, besides being a housewife, she manages to keep a cow and four sheep. She feeds and resells them. Even though they do not have much livestock, they have been able to increase their number and marry their children. Dinara wants to get a loan to purchase sheep.

Chynara S. is 32. She is married and her husband has a tractor, which they bought recently. He is tractor driver. They have four smart children. Three of them attend school and the youngest is at home. In 1994, they seeded a field with potatoes and built a house. Now she fattens 10 small cattle and she needs a loan to buy three small cattle to increase the number of livestock. They are planning to build a shed and a house for their children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy tableware and souvenirs to sell

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita owns a small resto store in Norala, South Cotabato. She found it hard to look for additional capital for her business until she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. Her store started to operate in 1994 and later, in 2008, she became a member of CEVI. 

Today she has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos. She needs it in order to buy more groceries for her store. This will be helpful to her since she has five children she needs to support.

loans.use: Groceries

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary A. is from the village of Pta.Sulong, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosemary engaged in the food sector, particularly in fish vending. Through this activity she is able to earn a monthly net income amounting to 5,000.00. 

In 2006, Rosemary joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemary has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Rosemary is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will also be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Rosemary from PMPC.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish vending.

loans.name: Mrs. Heng Chom Village Bank Group

texts.en: This bank loan group consists of eleven people who are villagers in Boeng Leu village in Kandal province. Mrs. Heng C. is the group president, selected by all the members who will use the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Dara Vanna, are farmers who own a five-hectare plot of land to grow rice and corn to sell to support their family. Their problem is that their field is a long way from the irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Heng C. is asking for a loan to buy a hose and rice and corn seed. The couple has three children, two of whom are in local public school, while the other is one year old.

loans.use: To buy a hose and rice and corn seed

loans.name: Li

texts.en:
Mr. Li L., 35, has been working as a domestic fisherman for more than seven years. He sells the fish to buyers, earning an average of $4 each day. He is married with one teenage child who is attending the local school. His wife helps feed the family by sewing clothes for the garment industry. 

Li L. is applying for a loan to add to his savings in order to buy an old motorbike to provide good transportation for the family.

loans.use: To buy an old motorbike.

loans.name: Rouguietou

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Rouguietou B. est une ancienne agent de la Loterie Nationale Sénégalaise(LONASE). Cependant depuis 3 ans elle s'est virée dans le commerce de tisuus, parfums et ...etc. Elle s'approvisionne de l'extérieur, très souvent en Gambie ou Mauritanie, où les marchandises sont à bon prix. Ainsi, pour préparer son prochain voyage, elle sollicitait un prêt de 100 000 FCFA pour compléter son budget
texts.en:
Miss Rouguietou B. is a former agent of the Senegalese National Lottery (LONASE). Three years ago she went into retail commerce: clothing fabric, perfume, etc. She gets her supplies from abroad, quite often in Gambia or Mauritania, where the merchandise is low-priced. Thus to prepare for her next trip, she is requesting a 100,000 FCFA loan to complete her budget.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: complete her budget to resupply products

loans.name: Iv

texts.en:
Iv S., 44, is widowed and resides with one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. S. sells groceries for an income of USD 4 per day. Her child is employed at a private company, earning an income of about USD 4 per day to help cover the family expenses.

 S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Saira Patricia

texts.es:
Saira Patricia C. C. tiene 30 años. Es casada y vive con su esposo y 4 hijos, Johanna (10), Martha (9), Angélica (7) y Héctor (18 meses), en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.

Saira es una socia de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa, que está ubicada a una hora y media del cantón Chillanes.  Son 18 socios en total, que en la mayoridad tienen sus propios negocios. Esto es el primer  préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Saira se dedica al negocio de naranjas y cacao. Realiza sus compras en Bucay. 
Solicita el préstamo para naranjas y cacao. Su sueño es engrandecer su negocio que tenga para un futuro mejor. 

Le gusta trabajar y jugar con su familia.
texts.en:
Saira Patricia is 30 years old. She is married, and lives with her husband and 4 children, Johanna (10), Martha (9), Angélica (7), and Héctor (18 months), in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province. Saira is a member of the Santa Rosa rural bank, located an hour and a half from Chillanes canton. There are 18 members in all, the majority of whom have their own businesses. This is the 1st loan they have requested from San José Cooperative. Saira sell oranges and cacao. She buys her merchandise in Bucay and is soliciting the loan to buy more oranges and cacao. Her dream is to enlarge her current business in order to have a better future. She likes to work and play with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING ORANGES AND CACAO FOR HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas B., 24, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its quality palm products. Her husband appears in the photograph.

B. is employed as a garment factory worker for an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a recycler, earning an income of USD 10 per day.

B. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to repair her house. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya S. is from the village of Horom in the Shirak region. She dreams of sending her two daughters (aged four and five years) to university one day. With this in mind, Raya has run a successful microbusiness for the past 15 years. She specializes in raising cattle and growing vegetables. In addition to saving for her children’s education, she also supports her extended family in Gyumi with vegetables grown on her farm.
At this time, Raya is ready to expand her business. She is looking for a loan to purchase additional livestock and expand her vegetable-growing business. With the loan, Raya is expecting her income to increase by 20 per cent. She is confident that her business plan will be successful. This is important to her as she wishes to be able to stay in her birthplace of Horom, surrounded by her friends and family.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Salle

texts.en:
Salle M. is from the village of SWP Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Salle is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Salle owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling dried goods like shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. Salle has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Salle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Salle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 60,000 PHP from GDMPC. Salle is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which she will use to expand her business. This loan will be Salle's seventh loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its Field Partners to enable them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Aliyyah

texts.en:
Aliyyah S. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 21 years old, married and has 1 infant. Aliyyah owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling video compact discs in the local community. Aliyyah has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Aliyyah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aliyyah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to invest in expanding the business. Aliyyah is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Aliyyah from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 52-year-old married woman from Lebanon. From the past fifteen years, she has been selling a wide range of goods from her home to customers from her community. She is well known in her town for the delicious home-made products she produces.

She believes that her business would be better if she were to sell her goods in a different part of Lebanon. That’s why, she is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase milk in order to produce Lebanese food products and deliver her products to other areas.  In the future, she would like to rent a space to sell her merchandise from, as well as selling her popular home-made food products. For the time being, she will continue to sell goods from her home.

loans.use: to purchase milk

loans.name: Rode Maria

texts.es: Rode Maria a su edad de 32 años por eso creó un negocio como es una farmacia,  hace más de 3 años que este negocio le ayudó a responder a la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia, ella atiende este negocio las 24 horas del día por lo que sus diferentes clientes llegan a su vivienda a buscar los medicamentos que ofrece. La mayoría de sus clientes también le realizan ciertas preguntas de medicamentos pues ella le brinda algunos consejos, pues también les ofrece medicamentos a un buen precio. Su mayor desafío es la innovación constante para sostener a su clientela. En la actualidad solicita su crédito para comprar una mayor variedad de productos farmacéuticos con el objetivo de diversificar mas la oferta.
texts.en: Rode Maria is 32 years old and she set up a pharmacy. She has had the business for more than 3 years and it has helped her meet her family's needs. Her store is open 24 hours a day for the various clients that come to her business in search of medicines that she sells. The majority of the clients also ask for advice on medications and she is able to guide them. She offers her prodcuts at a comfortable price. Her greatest challenge is offer innovation to retain her client base. She requests a loan to purchase a greater variety of pharmacy store products with the goal of improving her store.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ilkin

texts.ru:
Ilkin S. 26 let. On jenat i imeyet dochku kotoroy 2 qoda. Ilkin yavlyayetsya IDP pesonom , on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayets v Fuzuli regione, posolok Bala Behmenli vmeste so svoyey semyoy.

Ilkin uje 4 qoda kak v etom biznese skotovodstva. Seychas Ilkin nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznesa.
texts.en:
Ilkin S. is 26 years old.  He is married and has a 2-year-old daughter.  Ilkin is an IDP.  He is a refugee from the Fuzuli region and now lives in the Bala Behmenli village in the Fuzuli region with his family.

Ilkin has been involved in the animal husbandry business for 4 years.  He currently needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cattle and develop his business.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia tiene 23 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad hermosa del Cusco, Perú y desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Patricia es joven hermosa y trabajadora que es profesional en diseño grafico y trabaja en un empresa de diseño. Patricia y su papá Ricardo tienen un pequeño negocio familiar que consiste en brindar servicios de hospedaje.
     
Patricia con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 600 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea construir más habitaciones del hospedaje. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Patricia, 23, is single.  She lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Perú and has collaborated with Arariwa’s Micro Finance Unit’s “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank for a long time.  

Patricia is a beautiful, hard working young woman who is a professional Graphic Designer employed by a design firm.  

Patricia and her father have a small family business consisting of rental rooms. Patricia will use her next, $600 USD, loan to build more rental rooms.

She is grateful for the opportunity provided and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To build more rental rooms.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a 48-year-old woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is an innovative single mother of five children. She owns a house and dreams of mentoring her children to become entrepreneurs. For eight years now, Imelda has been selling clothes and this has enabled her to educate her children and renovate her house. She confesses to having challenges with her finances and this has deterred her from meeting ever-increasing customer demand. Imelda intends to use this loan to purchase trousers, shirts, shoes and dresses to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase trousers, shirts, shoes and dresses for her shop

loans.name: Kilekon

texts.en:
Kilekon K. is 27 and is married to Sitat Kilekon, who is a farmer. Together they have three children whose names are Esiat, Kaapai and Irene. The children go to school and are in form three, class eight, and class four. Kilekon is a livestock trader in the Enkaroni open air market which is a very busy market in Kajiado. He sells his livestock to butchers in Kitengela and Kajiado for slaughter. 

Kilekon was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Kitengela office. He has been running his livestock trading business for one year and he makes a monthly profit of 13,000 KES. Kilekon is applying for his first loan of 30,000 KES with KADET to buy cows, goats and sheep for trading. 

Kilekon describes himself as hardworking and ambitious. His dream is to specialize in supplying livestock to Nairobi, Kenya meat commission slaughter houses. Kilekon is hoping that this loan will boost his business and enable him to open a butcher shop in the Bissil market.

loans.use: to buy cows, goats and sheep for trading

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has been operating a vegetable selling business for the past four years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. In her business, Janet faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting goods. She hopes to expand and diversify in the future.

With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, green vegetables and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans that will give a boost to her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes, green vegetables and tomatoes.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
44-year-old Gemma E. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has two children aged 16 and 17. Gemma is engaged in farming. She plants rice crops and sells her harvest at the market. She also planted coconut trees on a part of her land. Gemma works hard to build her business and sustain her family.

Gemma needs fertilizers and other farm inputs. She applied for a loan of 17,000 PHP from CEVI, a KIVA partner. She will use the loan to buy what she needs for her farm. She is hopeful that this loan will help her maintain and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizers

loans.name: Mark Heller

texts.en:
Mark Heller D. is from Gango, Ozamiz City. He is 46 years old. Mark Heller is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mark Heller owns and operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately $690 a month for these activities.

In 2005, Mark Heller joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. 

Mark Heller is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be his 7th loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Femia

texts.en: Femia S. is from the village of Barangay Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 35 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Femia owns and operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Femia has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Femia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Femia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Femia is requesting a new loan of 27,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Femia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin Alberto Z.  tiene 33 años de edad y vive con su conyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 12 años, en el el municipio de Malambo a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla; alli tiene un   punto de venta  de mercancias  variadas, donde aprovecha para generar  otros ingresos con la venta de minutos y recargas a celulares. Edwin incursionò en la actividad  comercial  hace tres años, como cobrador de terceros, y con sus ahorros logrò emprender su miscelanea  en la casa de su madre, donde vende variados articulos como perfumes, elementos de aseo y papelerìa en general. Anteriormente se dedicò a la elèctrònica pero no le fue muy bien porque las personas no reconocen esta actividad y todo se va descontinuando muy rapidamente. Por eso buscò otra actividad que le generarà ingresos y una vez emprendiò su miscelanea, tambien adquiriò 3 planes de celulares para vender minutos y simultaneamente de dedica a hacer domicilios de medicinas y a cobrar facturas de manera independiente, actividades que le permiten obtener  ingresos complementarios a los que genera  por cuenta de su miscelanea. Hace un año le recomendaron la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, organzaciòn con la que recibiò su primer financiamiento y adquiriò 3 vitrinas que surtiò con ese mismo crèdito. Este es su segundo financiamiento y con èl espera incrementar sus ventas en un 35% , teniendo en cuenta que comprarà ùtiles escolares porque es la temporada de ingreso a la escuela y justamente alrededor de su negocio  existe un importante colegio y es parte de su mercado mas seguro. Su meta es aumentar la cobertura de clientes y lograr como todo buen padre una educaciòn de calidad para sus hijos, porque sueña con verlos algun dia convertidos en profesionales exitosos.
texts.en:
Edwin Alberto Z. is 33 years old.  He lives with his wife and their two children, ages 2 and 12.  They live in the Malambo municipality, which is 15 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  He has a business selling varied merchandise there.  He takes advantage of the opportunity to generate other income by selling minutes and recharges for cell phones.

Edwin ventured in the business activity three years ago as a third party debt collector.  With his savings he managed to undertake his convenience store in his mother’s house.  He sells various items like perfume, cleaning products, and general stationery items.  Previously he worked with electronics, but it did not go very well for him because people do not know about electronics.  Everything stopped very quickly.

That is why he looked for another business activity that would generate income for him.  Once he undertook his store, he also got three cell phone plans to sell minutes.  He also makes home deliveries of medications, and  does independent invoice collection.  These activities allow him to get complementary income in addition to what he gets from his store.

He was recommended to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo a year ago.  He got his first loan from them, and he got three display cases that he stocked with the same loan.  This is his second loan, and he hopes to increase his sales by 35%.  He will buy school supplies because it is the season for school to start.  There is an important school very close to his business, and that is the most secure part of his market.

His goal is to increase his customers, and, like all good fathers, give his children a quality education.  He dreams of one day seeing them become successful professionals.

loans.use: To buy school supplies

loans.name: Reina Melany

texts.es:
Doña Reyna de 39 años de edad, reside en Chinameca departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposo y tiene tres hijos de 26, 24 y 16 años de edad, los dos mayores están fuera del hogar, pues ya se casaron y viven con su pareja. Doña Reyna atiende un comedor en el mercado municipal de Chinameca, lo inicio hace 10 años trabajando de lunes a domingo.
Ella actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en arroz, frijol, aceite, maíz, plátanos, tomates, condimentos, bebidas, esta compra le ayudara muchísimo al negocio y a su familia, ya que con toda esta mercadería estará aumentando la producción de alimentos y al mismo tiempo las ganancias.
Las aspiraciones de doña Reyna es seguir incrementando el negocio, también que su hijo pueda culminar sus estudios.
texts.en: Reyna is 39 years old and lives in Chinameca, a department of San Miguel.  She lives with her husband and has three children of ages 26, 24, and 16; the two eldest are out of the home and have since married and live with their partners.  Reyna tends to a dining hall at the municipal marketplace of Chinameca; she started 10 years ago working from Monday to Sunday.  She is requesting the loan to invest in: rice, beans, oil, corn, bananas, tomatoes, condiments, and beverages, a purchase that would greatly help her business and her family.   With all the merchandise, she would increase her food production and earnings alike.  Reyna aspires to continue growing the business and also for her son to complete his education.

loans.use: Purchase of: rice, beans, oil, corn, bananas, tomatoes, condiments, and beverages.

loans.name: Angelita's Group

texts.en:
Angelita M. is from the village of Disimuray, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 54 years old. Angelita is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Angelita is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Angelita owns & operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Angelita has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells one of the raised animals.

In 2009, Angelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more breeding livestock. This will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Hanifah

texts.en:
Hanifah S. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children. Both of her children are currently in school.  Hanifah has a business selling clothes, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Hanifah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Hanifah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food and sometimes pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Hanifah hopes to own a plot of land.    

Hanifah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Delsa

texts.en:
Ma. Delsa is a widow with four children to support. She works hard to support her family. She owns and operates an eatery business, and earns additional income from running a general store. Ma. Delsa is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her eatery business.

Ma. Delsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to eventually repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her eatery business

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Dulce Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 36años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar.  Silvia tiene  grado de instrucción  superior. 
La señora se dedica a la venta de artículos artesanales,  trabaja  con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace cuatro meses, su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio venta de artículos artesanales.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, comprará materiales como lanas para la producción de chompas, chullos y  chalinas.  Ella trabaja sola en su negocio.
Su sueño es tener una empresa y exportar su artesanía en grandes cantidades.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque intercambiamos palabras con las demás socias, estamos alegres.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the Communal bank " Dulce Amanecer" ( Sweet Morning), located in the district of Puna, a province and department of Puno.  She is 36 years old, single, and has two children of schooling age.  Silvia has a degree in higher education.  She sells arts and crafts and has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement four months now.  Her initial loan was for 500 Nuevo Soles, money which she used towards her business of selling arts and crafts.  With this new loan of 300 Nuevo Soles, she will purchase materials such as wool for the production of sweaters, scarves, and hats.  Silvia works alone in her business and her dream is to have a company and export her products in large quantities.
What she likes most about the communal bank is the meetings because she can talk to the other members; they are very happy.

loans.use: To purchase wool in bulk in different colors

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement composé de veuves et de femmes mariées, ayant en moyenne 37 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Barouéli, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tissus, de miroir, du tiéké et de la poudre de henné.        
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier  prêt solidaire. 
DALLA D., qui est la présidente du groupe, espère  s’approvisionner en tissus avec les grossistes au grand marché de Bamako et du Burkina Faso. Elle vend ses habillements à domicile, au marché de Barouéli et  dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser au cours du cycle un bénéfice moyen de 100 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, les frais de contributions des différentes cérémonies civiles, certaines dépenses familiales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group comprising widows and married women who are, on average, 37 years old with 2 children and live in traditional extended households in the city of Barouéli in the Barouéli prefecture in the Ségou Region (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They know each other through familial, neighbourhood, and friend connections. They sell fabric, mirroirs, tiéké (a Malian food dish), and henna powder.
The women of the Benkadi group are on their first solidarity (group) loan.
Dalla D., the president of the group, hopes to supply herself with fabric from the wholesalers at the grand markets in Bamako and Burkina Faso. She sells clothing at her house, at the Barouéli market, and at the surrounding markets, in cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of women and men.
She foresees realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA throughout the loan cycle, and will use this profit to reimburse the loan and pay for various social ceremonies and family expenses, with the remainder being reinvested in her business activity.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 39 años de edad y vive en una pequeña comunidad rural perteneciente al distrito de Lambayeque.

Mercedes se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortas y bocaditos desde hace 5 años. Esta actividad la desarrolla en su domicilio y cuenta con clientela establecida  que esta más que satisfecha con los deliciosos productos que Mercedes hace.

Mercedes ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que utilizará para la compra de ingredientes (harina, manteca, huevos, azúcar, leche, etc.) para realizar sus tortas y bocaditos. La gran demanda que tienen los productos de Mercedes le exige contar siempre con los insumos necesarios a la mano pues sus pedidos están a la orden del día.

Mercedes estaría muy agradecida de concedérsele el crédito pues necesita de sus ingredientes para seguir laborando. Ella es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación y sabe que puede lograr sus metas pues en la zona no tiene mayor competencia.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 39, lives in a small rural town in Lambayeque.

Mercedes has operated a food sales business, making and selling cakes and snacks, for 5 years.  She operates the business from her house and has a long list of customers who line up for her delicious cakes and snacks.

Mercedes has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new soles loan that she use to buy the ingredients (flour, butter, eggs, sugar, milk, etc.) that she needs to make her cakes and snacks.  She wants to ensure that she always has enough of the ingredients she uses to make her cakes and snacks so she can meet any level of demand for her products.

Mercedes would be very grateful to you if you would help her with this loan because she needs it to continue operating her business. She plans to work hard and she knows that she can reach her goals because there's no competition for her products in the neighborhood.

loans.use: Comprar ingredientes.

loans.name: Florecitas De Santa Ana Tlapaltitlan Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "Florecitas de Santa Ana Tlapaltitlan" ubicado en el estado de México. Esta conformado por nueve integrantes entre ellas se encuentra la señora Ines, ella esta casada desde hace 27 años, tiene 4 hijos; la señora nos platica que lleva 15 años vendiendo flores y tiene un pequeño invernadero, ella vende en las calles ya que las necesidades en su familia eran cada vez mayores y los ingresos tanto de su esposo como los de ella no eran suficientes, Ines esta muy entusiasmada en que su negocio crezca anhela tener un local para vender arreglos florales, con el prestamo que le brinden va a invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y semillas de esta manera va a poder tener más variedad de flores para cultivarlas y así vender en mayor cantidad. Su sueño es brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de seguir estudiandoen y algun día lograr una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
This group is called “Florecitas de Santa Ana Tlapaltitlan”, which is located in the State of Mexico and has nine members.

One of the members is Sra. Ines. She is 27 years old, married, and has four children. Sra. Ines says that she has been selling flowers for 15 years and manages a small greenhouse. She sells her products on the street. The needs of her family keep growing each time, and the incomes that both she and her husband generate are not sufficient. Ines is very excited about growing her business and hopes to have a shop where she can sell floral arrangements. This loan will allow her to invest in the purchase of fertilizers and seeds so that she can cultivate a wider variety of flowers and sell them in larger quantities. Her dream is to provide her children with the opportunity to continue their studies so that they can earn a professional degree someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for cultivating flowers.

loans.name: Jinnilyn

texts.en:
Jinnilyn is 37 years old and is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 12 years old while the youngest is 4. She lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato, with her family. Jinnilyn and her husband are both farmers. They have been growing rice for eight years. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Jinnylyn hopes to have her children finish college. She also hopes to have her own capital.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La señora Gladis es socia del banco comunal Las Bellas del Distrito Manantay, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 41 años de edad, en madre soltera y tiene dos hijos.
Desde hace tres ciclos trabaja con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la compra y venta de plátanos, productos que en estos momentos se ha elevado y hay mucha demanda y sobre todo competencia.

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 comprará 30 racimos de plátano verdes para revenderlos.

Tiene dos hijos que dependen totalmente de su trabajo y por eso trabaja incansablemente, sale a trabajar en la madrugada para poder comprar los plátanos que luego llevara a vender, tiene su puesto que tiene en un mercado de la zona.  Agradece a Manuela Ramos por la oportunidad que le ha brindado para poder tener un pequeño capital.
texts.en:
Señora Gladis is a member of the communal bank "Las Bellas" (The Beautiful Ones) in Manantay District, Ucayali Department.  She is 41 years old and a single mother of two children.

Señora Gladis has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for three cycles.  She makes her living buying and selling bananas.  At this time, there are a lot of bananas and a lot of demand, but over all, a lot of competition.

With this new loan of S/. 1,200.00 (USD $450), Señora Gladis will purchase bunches of green bananas for re-sale.

Señora Gladis has two children who depend wholly on her work.  That is why she works tirelessly.  She leaves for work at dawn to buy the bananas that she will later sell.  She has a stall in a local market.  Señora Gladis is thankful to Manuela Ramos for the opportunity she has been offered to have a little capital.

loans.use: to purchase bananas.

loans.name: Sukhav

texts.en:
Sukhav is a chicken seller.  Her husband is a farmer and their income is $13 per day.  They have 3 children, two are studying in school.  Every month, she has to spend $52 on food, $6 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $13 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy chicken food for feeding chickens to sell.  Before she only fed a few chickens at home.  After she learned how to feed chickens well, she started to feed more and it is going well.  She wants to continue feeding more and more to get eggs and chickens to sell. When she gets more income, she plans to repair her house and send her children to study at least to finish high school.

loans.use: To buy chicken food for feeding chickens to sell

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim and her husband are farmers. In addition, they also raise cows at home. The couple has seven children - four sons and three daughters. Two are married, three are garment workers and the other two are in school. They are living in a village along National Road Number Five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sim is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

Photo: Sim and her husband.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Caminando Con Jesus Group

texts.es: Dalia Carolina tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos y junto a ellos reside en el Barrio Concepcion en el Departamento de La Paz. Doña Dalia inició su actividad laboral desde muy temprana edad ya que ayudaba a su madre a vender elotes y algunos productos derivados de este como el atol y los tamalitos, luego de unos años se dedicó a vender Loteria. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos de puerta en puerta. Su vida no ha sido nada facil, en parte porque sus hijos estan estudiando y su ex-esposo no le ayuda con los gastos escolares a penas y le da para la alimentacion de ellos y a parte de eso como realiza sus ventas al credito algunos de sus clientes y clientas le han quedado mal con los pagos. Con el prestamo que está solicitando comprará shampoos, desodorantes, fragancias, peines, cremas, jabones, barniz de uñas, sombras, listicks, entre otros. Con el apoyo de este prestamo surtira de mas productos su negocio y asi podra ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad. Su mayor desafio es que recorre grandes distancias para poder vender sus productos. Sus metas son ayudar a sus hijos a culminar sus estudios y ser una distribuidora de cosmeticos autorizada en la zona. Sus compañeras de grupo Francisca y Adela, se dedican a la venta de golosinas y de cuajada. Este es el primer ciclo para el Grupo y esperan cumplir con puntualidad los pagos.
texts.en: Dalia Carolina, 34, is a single mother with two children.  She lives in Concepcion, a town in the "departamento" of La Paz.  She started working very young because she had to help her mother with various businesses: first, food sales and, later, sales of lottery tickets.  Dona Dalia now makes a living selling cosmetics door to door.  Her life isn't easy, partly because her children are in school and her former husband barely helps with school fees and other expenses, and partly because she sells on credit and her customers don't always pay on time.  She will use this loan to buy shampoos, deodorants, perfumes, combs, creams, soaps, nail varnish, eye shadow, lipsticks and other inventory.  The loan will help her stock her business so that she can provide a wider range of products to her customers.  Her biggest challenge is the distances she has to travel to sell her products.  Her goals are to see her children finish school and to be an authorized cosmetics distributor in her neighborhood.  Her fellow group members, Francisca and Adela, operate retail businesses, selling snacks and dairy products.  This is the group's first round of funding and they expect to repay their loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали житель района Дангары. Ему 38 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Более 10 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Он продает фрукты. Кредит берет для покупки дыни, арбуза, яблок, груши и инжира.
texts.en: Safarali lives in the Dangara district.  He is 38 years old, married and has two children.  He has a secondary education and has been involved in sales at the market for over 10 years.  He sells fruits.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cantaloupes, watermelons, apples, pears and figs.

loans.use: to purchase cantaloupes, watermelons, apples, pears and figs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. Melania has a grocery store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 25 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Melania is well known in their community as a strong person and a  very hardworking mother. In the future, Melania hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, spices, noodles and drinks for her store

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and describes herself as aggressive, humble, and trustworthy. She operates a clothing sales business where she sells sweaters. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an open air market in Nairobi and her primary customers are retailers from different parts of the town. 

Josephine's biggest business challenge is her low purchasing power. She is requesting a loan for 50,000 KES, which she will use to add to her stock of sweaters . Her business goal is to open another shop in the city center within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters.

loans.name: Laita Group

texts.en:
Tecla is 42 years old and lives in Gweru. She is married and has four children aged 7, 10, 14, and 18 years.  Three of them attend school, and the oldest helps out at her poultry and piggery business, which she has run for the past two years.

She has applied for $400.00 to buy animal feed.  Tecla is facing capital challenges as well as competition.  

With the additional income from her loan, she will be able to sustain her family. 

She however needs to open a butchery and if her business does well this might help her maximize her profits.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a 34-year-old married woman with six children; four of them in school. She has had a business selling bread in Kator, South Sudan, for five years. Monica requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread for sale. She will use the extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bread for sale.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción, esta decido por un nuevo préstamo, ya que necesita comprar insumos agrícolas para continuar con los cultivos, además que recibió buena atención, por el momento su compra será en abono, herbicidas, pago de mozos, para dar el mantenimiento necesario al cultivo.
El logro comprar de su préstamo anterior los productos agrícolas, ayudando por medio de la cosecha a su familia, gracias a Dios todo el proceso fue un éxito, no ha tenido cambios malos y su familia goza de buena salud.
texts.en:
Concepción has decided to request a new loan. He needs to purchase farm supplies to continue with his crops. In addition, he has received good attention. At this time, he will purchase labor, fertilizer and herbicides for the necessary maintenance of his crops. 
With the previous loan, he was able to purchase farm supplies which helped his harvest and family. Thanks to God, it was a success. There were no bad changes and his family is in good health.

loans.use: purchase labor, fertilizers and herbicides.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth e socia del Banco Comunal Alondras, tiene 30 años, es madre de 4 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 4 años. Elizabeth vende panes en el Mercado y tambien vende cosméticos, con los préstamos que ha recibido pudo armar su capital con el cual pudo comprar mas mercaderías, tambien compró su casa y gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe aprendió a educar a sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para vender aprovechando la campaña navideña. Su meta es abrir su tienda de ropas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of Alondras Communal Bank. She is a 30-year-old woman and has four sons. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years. 

Elizabeth works selling bread and cosmetics at the market. Previous loans have enabled her to build up enough financial resources to buy more merchandise. She also bought her own house. Thanks to financial support, she was able to educate her sons. With this loan, she will buy clothes to sell during the Christmas campaign. Her goal is to open up a clothes shop.

loans.use: To buy an assortment of clothes.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married with four children. Anita is 44 years old and lives in Camul, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Anita is a farmer/rubber tapper. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticide.

Anita became a member of PMPC this year, 2011.  In the future, Anita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticide for her rubber plantation.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 35-year-old businessman who is married to a farmer. They are blessed with three children who are ages 14, 8 and 6. John has earned about KES 10,000 a month for the past seven years by running a retail shop. He is applying for his first loan term from KADET after being introduced to our organization by a staff member. He will use this loan to buy sugar, rice and cooking oil for his shop. He will use the additional profits made possible by this loan to educate his children. His goal for the future is to buy a farm.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Vicenta Lourdes

texts.es: La Sra. Vicenta  tiene como actividad la venta de comida, actividad que desarrolla solo los fines de semana, solo los días domingos, preparando lechón y pollo al horno esta actividad la desarrolla conjuntamente con su hijos y su esposo quienes le ayudan en esta actividad, el destino del crédito es para la compra de una maquina espiadera para pollos y así de esta manera aumentar su productividad y poder ampliar su  snack, la Sra. realiza muy ricos sus platos y es muy conocida por el lugar por la buena atención que brinda a su clientes, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Vicenta’s activity is food sales, an activity she does only on weekends, specifically on Sundays. She prepares roasted piglet and roasted chicken. Her children and husband help her with this activity. The loan will be used to buy a chicken rotisserie to increase production and be able to expand her snack bar.

She makes very delicious dishes and is well known in the place for the good service she provides her customers. She’s a very hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy a chicken rotisserie.

loans.name: Mirzoabdullo

texts.ru: Мирзоабдулло мужчина  жена домохозяйка, пенсионерка. Сыновья находятся в России , присылают деньги каждый месяц.
