Сам Мирзоабдулло является пастухом, он пасет коз, овец  соседей и за каждое поголовье скота он получает определенную плату. Сам разводит скот в течении 35 лет. Этот бизнес является почти основным источником дохода семьи, не считая денежных переводов с России. Каждый воскресный  день он выводит свой скот на продажу и от полученной выгоды покупает молодых овец. Настоящий кредит получен на покупку коз и овец.
texts.en: Mirzoabdullo is a man, whose wife is a homemaker and a retiree.  His sons are in Russia and send money every month.  Mirzoabdullo is a shepherd and takes the neighbors' goats and sheep to a pasture.  He earns a set pay for each livestock head.  He has also been breeding livestock for 35 years.  This business is almost the primary source of income for the family, not counting the monetary transfers from Russia.  Mirzoabdullo takes his livestock out for sale every Sunday and purchases young sheep with the money earned from the sales.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of goats and sheep.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase printing materials, such as toner cartridges and paper.

loans.name: Asdf

texts.en: A.

loans.use: asdf

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.en:
Mrs. V. P. buys used clothing in Laredo, Texas and sells it in the western markets of the city of Nuevo Laredo, Mexico. She has been doing this for about 7 years.

"I need my own transportation, so that I can sell my clothes in other markets in the area. I am asking for a loan of $1,200.00 to buy a car."

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La señora compra la ropa usada en Laredo Texas y la vende en los tianguis del poniente de la Cd. de Nvo. Laredo, esto lo lleva haciendo aproximadamente 7 años.

"Tengo la necesidad de transportarme en un vehiculo propio, para poder vender mi ropa en diferentes colonias de la localidad, solicito un prestamo de $1,200.00 dlls para la adquisicion de un carro".

loans.use: Sale of new and used clothing. / Venta de ropa nueva y usada.

loans.name: Reyna Luz

texts.en:
Reyna is 38 years old and married with 2 children. Due to the current economic situation, her husband was forced to immigrate to the northern part of the country in search of a better way of life. Up to this day, her husband has sent very little money, and, thus, Reyna opened a grocery store in her home. She would like to invest her loan in the business (olive oil, sugar, salt, cookies, sweets, bread) so that her neighbors find everything they need in her grocery store. Reyna is a part of the Laguna Azul 2 Group.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

REYNA TIENE 38 AÑOS, CASADA TIENE DOS HIJOS, DEBIDO A LA SITUACION ECONOMICA EN LA QUE SE ENCUENTRAN SU ESPOSO TUVO QUE EMIGRAR HACIA EL NORTE DEL PAIS EN BUSCA DE MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA, HASTA AHORA SU ESPOSO LE HA ENVIADO MUY POCO DINERO Y POR LO TANTO REYNA ABRIO UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA, ELLA QUIERE INVERTIR EL PRESTAMO EN EL NEGOCIO (ACEITE, AZUCAR, SAL, GALLETAS, DULCES, PAN) DE TAL FORMA QUE SUS VECINOS ENCUENTREN TODO LO QUE BUSQUEN EN SU TIENDA. REYNA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO DE LAGUNA AZUL 2.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.en:
Zenobia H. lives in Ayacucho, Peru, with her three children. She owns and operates a small store, selling groceries and household necessities. She opened her store about 5 years ago, and has had a growing client base ever since. This small business has become even more important in the last two years, when her husband abandoned her for another woman, leaving Zenobia as the sole provider for her family. Nevertheless, she has prioritized education for her children, making sure all three attend school.

Prior to her initial loan with FINCA Peru, granted 5 years ago, Zenobia spent over 2 hours a day commuting to and from the central market, where she operated a small fruit kiosk. Her first “préstamo” or loan allowed her to purchase the storefront that she now occupies. It is much closer to her home, and she is able to spend less time on a crowded bus and more time with her children.

Zenobia says that in her Village Bank she has learned not only financial management, but also the importance of punctuality and responsibility. Zenobia hopes to receive US$500 for her next loan, and plans to use the money to purchase a small refrigerator, so she can sell cold drinks during the summer.

loans.use: Zenobia hopes to receive US$500 for her next loan, and plans to use the money to purchase a small refrigerator, so she can sell cold drinks during the summer.

loans.name: Chingiz

texts.en: Chingiz has had his orchard business for 10 years.  This 43-year-old man lives in Khaladj village, in the Salyan region. He is married, has three children. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides.

loans.use: to buy pesticides

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente Ricardo C. is 44 years old and living with María C., they have been married for 13 years and they still love each other like the first day. They have two children aged 24 and 20. Vicente sells cleaning supplies such as detergent, fabric softener, bleach, brooms and other articles.

Before beginning in this line 4 years ago, Vicente worked with a brother-in-law who taught him how to make cleaning products. He began making small quantities and demand for his products grew. Today his business is flourishing. He sells his cleaning products to many stores in his city and generally sells his merchandise by going door-to-door.

Vicente has asked for a loan so that he can buy the ingredients necessary to make his cleaning products. These ingredients include chlorine, distilled water and baking soda.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as  chlorine, distilled water and baking soda.

loans.name: Fabiana De Los Santo

texts.en:
Just one year ago, Fabiana didn’t have any idea about where and how to gain access to capital so she could start selling homemade sweets (candies).

Currently she has been operating her business for 5 months, ever since she found out that she could obtain loans from FSMA. Fabiana, 36, defines herself as an assiduous and energetic person who struggles to provide food and education for her five children.

Fabiana hopes her business will grow rapidly and that she can get a lot of new customers. She is requesting a second loan to buy ingredients needed in order to prepare more goods and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy ingredients necessary to prepare candies for her business

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Hello from Mbeya, Tanzania!  Elida M. is a 55 year old woman. She is married with three children, who are between 22 and 35.  She has one other dependent: her nephew. In 2005, Elida established a business selling fish and charcoal.  She now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Tanzanians rely on charcoal to cook their meals since they still use small coal pots.  They arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Husna's Mbuyuni Group

texts.en:
Husna H., age 30, is married with 2 children (15 and 6 years old). Husna owns a clothing business, which she started 7 years ago. Working from 8am-4pm daily, she earns about $45 a month from this business.

In the past, Husna successfully took out 1 previous loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more clothing for her business. She now hopes for a loan for the same purpose. Husna belongs to the loan group called Mbuyuni and will be sharing this loan with subgroup members Rehema H., Subira M., Pili Shomui, and Salma K.. These women have businesses dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy clothing inventory

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 38 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 20 and 16 years old. Elizabeth owns a small grocery store that she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

In the past, Elizabeth has taken out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Romoke

texts.en: Romoke Y. is married with 2 children.  She is 30 years of age and hails from ilogbo in Lagos State,Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. She acquired the skill for one and a half years and has been in the business for the past 5 years. Romoke needs a loan of $450 to enable her buy more foodstuffs and provisions for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and provisions for sale.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 43 year-old Hilda A.. She is widowed, and has 3 children between the ages of 13 and 19. Hilda owns a carpentry business. She earns about US $170 every month from this business. She is assisted by her three employees. Hilda requires a loan in order to purchase stocks of wood and nails in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets. The lack of tangible collateral assets means they are deemed not-creditworthy by financial institutions, restricting access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of wood and nails in bulk.

loans.name: Adegoke

texts.en: T. Adegoke is the mother of 4 children. She is 44 years old and married. She lives at Jakunde – 0koko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 4 years. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy more foodstuffs and provisions in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and provisions for sales

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akoko A. was born in Lomé on April 22, 1976. She is married and presently has two children. Since she lacked support, she did not continue her studies. She began selling generic products, and since 1998 groceries. Her business is now doing wonderfully well. She received a first loan which allowed her to diversify the range of products she offers.

This made her clientele grow, and she is requesting this second loan to bolster her inventory by the purchase of 6 sacks of rice, 4 tins of oil, and 6 cases of generic products.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Akoko est née à Lomé le 22 avril 1976. Elle s’est mariée et a actuellement deux enfants. Par manque de support elle n’a pas pu faire de grandes études. Elle s’est alors lancée dans le commerce de produits génériques, et d’alimentation générale depuis 1998. Son commerce aujourd’hui marche a merveille. Elle avait eu un premier prêt qui lui a permis de varier la gamme de ses produits.

Cette variation a fait accroître sa clientèle et elle sollicite ce deuxième prêt pour gonfler son stock par l’achat de 6 sacs de riz, 4 bidons d’huile et 6 cartons de produits génériques.

loans.use:
Purchase of rice and other staples

Achat de riz et d'autres produits de premières nécessités

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
Gulnora H. lives in the city of Tursunzade. She is 25 years old and has a high school education. Gulnora has a small trading location at the local market. She sells sugar and sweets. Gulnora lives with her parents who are retired. Therefore,she has to provide for the family. Business is the main source of income for her family. Gulnora wants to buy products from wholesale traders, which is why she needs money. She would like to receive a loan and plans to repay back within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Хайдарова Гулнора Юсуповна жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 25 лет,образование среднее. Гулнора имеет на рынке города Турсунзаде небольшую торговую точку. Она торгует сахаром и сладостями. Гулнора живет с родителями пенсионерами. Поэтому содаржать семью ей приходится самой. Бизнес является основным источником дохода ее семьи. Клиентка хочет закупить у оптовых поставщиков товар ,для чего ей нужны деньнги.Гулнора обратилась в нашу организацию за кредитом,планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Bilikis

texts.en:
Bilikis is a young hard-working mother of two children; she is 33 years old and is married to Mr. S.. Bilikis sells fresh tomatoes and peppers to her customers; she has been in this business for the past eight years. Tomatoes and peppers are used in the preparation of local dishes, so the demand for them is high.

Bilikis started this business in 2000. She needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to buy more tomatoes and peppers for sale. She says thank you.

loans.use: Purchase more tomatoes and peppers

loans.name: Ikhtiyar

texts.en: Ikhtiyar is 29 years old, married, and has 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli, the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. Currently, Ikhtiyar is settled in Baku. For the past 3 years, he has been running a grocery sales business. At present, Ikhtiyar needs a loan of US$1,200 to buy various food items for sale in his store.

loans.use: Purchase of food items for sale

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis inicio el negocio de venta de mercería porque se quedo sin trabajo y uno de sus hijos sufre de crisis epilépticas, y el necesitaba solventar los gastos tratamiento para su enfermedad que es muy caro; además que debía de mantener a los demás hijos, ya su esposa por la enfermedad de su hijo se le complicaba trabajar porque necesitaba estar al pendiente de el.

El necesita un préstamo por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía para el negocio y así incrementar las ventas y poder darles a los clientes un producto de calidad.
texts.en:
Luis started the business of selling clothes and merchandise because he was without work and one of his children suffers epileptic seizures, and he needs to meet the treatment expenses for his illness, which is very expensie. Also, he should support his other children, now that it is complicated for his wife to work, because of their son's illness she needs to be at his side.

He needs a loan of $750 which he will pay back in six months to buy merchandise for the business and so increase the sales and provide his customers with a quality product.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Saren

texts.en: Mrs. Saren P., 25,, is raising pigs to support her family and is also a rice farmer, which she started in 2005. She earns approximately $1.50 per day and lives in Kompong Tom Province. She is married with one child who is still young and her husband, Mr. Bao Choun, 25, makes a living purchasing chickens from other places to store and sell out to his regular customers. Saren is applying for a loan 1,000,000 riel ($250) for her husband to purchase chickens for sale. (Mrs. Saren's husband is pictured, because she was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: You

texts.en: You H., 48, is a widow living in the Kampong Cham province with her one child and her niece. She is a farmer and makes $3 US a day and is supported by her child and her niece who work in garment factory and as a farmer, respectively. You H. is asking for a loan of $500 US to purchase a water pump to irrigate her rice field.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara O. sells firewood wholesale and retail. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N 40,000 to purchase more firewood to sell. Clara is 48 years old and married with 5 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: A sus 59 años, Alfonso es conciente que para progresar en la vida tiene que trabajar arduamente, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a su esposa, y juntos quieren salir adelante. Habiendo vivido su niñez en su natal Amantani (Isla del lago Titicaca), Alfonso sabe que muchas veces escasean los productos en su isla. Son ya 10 años que tiene en el negocio de la venta de productos agrícolas, él surca las aguas del lago Titicaca todas las semanas llevando sus productos y no solo se limita a transportar lo que él cosecha, sino también abastece a su isla de todo lo que sus moradores podrían necesitar (Víveres, muebles, abarrotes, etc), su negocio es muy rentable, ya que es el único que realiza esta labor.  Alfonso es feliz sabiendo que a los pobladores de Amantani, no les falta nada gracias a su esfuerzo, pero justamente trasladar todo sus productos, es lo más difícil de su trabajo, él quiere darle una mejor vida a su esposa, que es quien más le ayuda en su trabajo, es por eso que nunca descansa en el afán de cumplir sus metas. Este primer préstamo le ayudará a Alfonso a progresar, quiere cumplir con todas sus cuotas y de esta manera no poner en dificultades, a su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita planea comprar más mercadería para llevar a su isla, invertirá todo el préstamo en ello, ya que siente que los moradores de Amantani todavía necesitan muchas cosas.
texts.en:
At 59 years of age, Alfonso is aware that he has to work hard to progress in life. He lives in a rented room with his wife, and both of them want to move forward. Having spent his childhood on his native Amantani Island (Lake Titicaca), Alfonso knows that produce there is frequently in short supply. He has been in the business of selling farm produce for 10 years now and sails across Titicaca every week with his goods. He not only takes over the produce he has harvested, but also stocks the inhabitants of the island with everything they might need (supplies, furniture, groceries, etc.). His is a very profitable trade, as he is the only person doing this job. It makes Alfonso happy to know that the people of Amantani want for nothing thanks to his efforts, but transporting all of these goods is the hardest aspect of his work. He wants to give his wife a better life, she being the person who helps him the most in his labours, hence his unwaivering determination to achieve his goals. This first loan will help Alfonso to move forward. He wants to keep up with his payments so as to avoid creating difficulties for his local communal bank. He intends to use the requested money - indeed, the entire loan - to buy more merchandise to take to the island, as he feels that the residents of Amantani still need a good many things.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Sunday Davidson

texts.en: Sunday Davidson O. is 38 years old and single. He lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria, and he has one child. Sunday is a printer. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN ($700) to purchase more printing materials for his printing business. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase printing materials for his business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel S. is married and has 4 dependents; his wife is a seamstress.  He has received schooling through the junior high level. Since 1990, Samuel has sold TV motherboards and other electrical parts at Kisi near Elmina.  Samuel uses his income to pay his family's rent and utility bills, his children's school fees, and other financial expenses. Samuel will use the loan to meet customers' growing demand by increasing the inventory of TV motherboards and other electrical parts for sale in his shop. With the new profits from his expanded business, Samuel plans to continue building the house he started for his family.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of TV motherboards and other electrical parts available for sale in his shop.

loans.name: Matanat

texts.en:
Matanat was born in 1961. She is single. Matanat is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan's Fuzuli town, now resettled in the Fuzuli region, in the town of Horadiz.

Matanat has 5 years of experience in the poultry business. Now she wants a loan of AZN 2000 to buy 20 turkeys, 20 geese, and some hens for expanding her poultry business.

loans.use: To buy turkeys, geese, and hens

loans.name: Eberth

texts.es: Eberth tiene 26 años es un joven muy conciente y preocupado, vive en la casa de sus padres a quienes desea dar una vejez tranquila y sabe que trabajado mucho lo logrará. Aunque todavía no ha culminado sus estudios universitarios de Ingeniería Civil, Eberth ya ha decidido que es hora de contribuir en los gastos de su familia, es por eso que con la ayuda de sus padres tiene un negocio de diseño de planos, el cual le da los ingresos necesarios para costearse sus estudios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede ejercer su carrera y ganar dinero a la vez, lleva 3 años en este negocio y lo más difícil para él es tener que dejar de dormir para cumplir un trabajo, aun así sabe que sus esfuerzos tendrán su recompensa y anhela poder culminar sus estudios rápidamente y convertirse en un gran profesional. Eberth se encuentra en su primer préstamo con MFP y tiene el firme compromiso de no fallar en sus pagos y de ser responsable con el resto de las socias de su banco comunal. Con los 500 soles que solicita implementará mejor su lugar de trabajo y podrá atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eberth is 26 years old. He is a very responsible and concerned young man. He lives with his parents, to whom he would like to provide with a decent senior life, and he knows that if he works hard, he will be able to do so. Although he hasn’t finished his Civil Engineering college studies, Eberth has decided that it’s time to contribute to cover the family expenses, and that’s the reason why with the help of his parents his own a plan design business, which gives him the necessary income to cover his college expenses. What he enjoys the most about his job is to be able to practice his skills and make money. At the same time, he’s been working in this business for 3 years and the most difficult part of the work is to lose hours of sleep in order to fulfill his obligations. Still, he knows his efforts will be rewarded and he hopes he will be able to finish school soon so he can become an outstanding professional. This is the first loan Eberth requests to MFP and he is committed not to fail to cover any payments and to be responsible with the rest of the members of the community bank. He will use the 500 soles to make improvements in his work place to provide better care for his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement in his work place

loans.name: Bendita Machaieie Pedro

texts.pt:
Bendita Machaieie Pedro M. é natural de Gaza uma das províncias do sul de Moçambique, tem 53 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 6 filhos com idade o primeiro com 33 anos de idade e o ultimo com 18 anos respectivamente. Alem dos filhos sustenta uma neta que mora com ela.

Bendita estudou até o segundo ciclo de liceu na época colonial e parou por falta de condições dado que ficou orfao dos pais aos nove anos de idade, aos 4 anos saiu da província de Gaza na companhia dos pais quando o pai conseguiu emprego na cidade de Lourenço marques (actualmente Maputo). 

Bendita solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku pela primeira vez no valor de 12000,00mt com qual pretende aumentar o seu volume de negocio adquirindo mais produtos. Actividade que a desenvolve desde 1996, deste negocio tem rendimento mensal de 36000,00mt. Futuramente pretende introduzir outro tipo de negocio que consistira na prestação de serviços de aluguer de quartos e recorrera ao credito.
texts.en:
Bendita Machaieie Pedro M. is a native of Gaza Province in the south of Mozambique. She is 53 years old, married and the mother of 6 grown children. The first is 33 years old, and the youngest is 18 years old. In addition to her children, she supporta a granddaughter who lives with her. Bendita studied through the second year of high school in the colonial era and stopped due to circumstances. She was orphaned at age nine, and at 4 had left the province of Gaza with her parents when her father got work in the city of Lourenço Marques (currently Maputo). Bendita is requesting a loan through Hluvuku for the first time in the amount of 20,000 meticais, with which she plans to increase the volume of her business by acquiring more products. She has been developing the business since 1996 and has a monthly revenue of 36,0000 meticais. In the future, she plans to introduce another type of business which will consist of providing room rental services, and she will use credit.

Translated from Portuguese by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell various products

loans.name: Cipriano Javier

texts.es: Cipriano Javier R. Hernández tiene 35 años de edad es padre de familia y tiene tres niñas, su vivienda esta ubicada en uno de los lugares mas pobres de su localidad, sin embargo el ha sido un hombre esforzado por su bienestar y el de su familia, la actividad económica de Cipriano es la elaboración de artesanías de forma manual. Inicio este negocio para proporcionar a su familia el sustento, la educación y la estabilidad económica. El señor Cipriano inicio como ayudante en la elaboración de artesanía lo que permitió aprender a fabricar piezas de barro que se venden en el municipio de La Paz Centro, a nivel nacional e internacional. El financiamiento que necesita Cipriano es para comprar materia prima que le permita elaborar sus artículos ya que el anhela transportar sus productos a una feria que se realizara en el mes de Noviembre en Miami y con este dinero comenzar a trabajar con capital propio
texts.en:
Cipriano Javier R. H. is 35 years old and is a father of three girls. His home is located in one of the poorest places in his location. However, he has made an effort for his well being and his family. The economic activity of Cipriano is the manual elaboration of crafts. He started this business to offer his family sustenance, education and economic stability. Mr. Cipriano started as an assistant in the elaboration of crafts which allowed him to learn how to make mud pieces that are sold in the municipality of La Paz Centro at a national and international level. The financial support that Cipriano needs is to buy raw material that will allow him to elaborate his crafts. Cipriano wishes to transport his products to a fair that takes place in the month of November in Miami. This money will allow him to work with his own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella A., 55 years old, lives in Camanga Village, Tukuran, Zambonaga Del Sur. She is married with 4 children.  She has been doing vegetable gardening for 28 years with a present monthly income of PHP 6,000.  She joined Paglaum MPC last year, and she is on her 3rd loan in the amount of PHP 7,000.  The gains she generates from her vegetable garden will be used for expansion of her market gardening.

loans.use: Expansion of her vegetable garden

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: Modesta A. A. tiene la edad de 40 años. Es una madre soltera. Tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Modesta es una pulpería. Hace más de 21 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, por lo que al iniciar con este negocio no fue fácil, por lo que tenía que cuidar a sus hijos y velar por la condiciones de vida de la familia, es por eso que decide iniciar con muy poco capital, pero con esto logra comprar unos pequeños estantes para colocar las golosinas, y así fue que logra obtener clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, detergente entre otras cosas. su deseo es de acondicionar su pulpería con mucho mas productos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Modesta A. A. is a 40 year old single mother of 3 children, all of whom are students. She operates a small grocery store out of her home and has been in business for over 21 years. Starting her business wasn’t easy – she still had to look after her children and take care of the family’s living situation. With very little capital, she bought a few racks of candy and started attracting customers.

The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, detergent and other items. She hopes to expand her grocery store so that she can offer more products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Badamhand

texts.en:
Badamhand B. is a widow with two children aged 28 and 22. Her family lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. In 2002, Badamhand started running a butcher stall in Huchit shonhor, the local food market. She buys sheep meat for 800,000 - 1,000,000 tugrugs ($1 USD = 1450 MNT) from the wholesale centers on a daily basis and resells all of them on same day.

Besides selling meat through the stall, she also provides a few restaurants and cafes with their daily meat needs. Her youngest son Bat-Erdene is a university student. After his classes he helps his mother's retail business. With the profit, Badamhand pays her youngest son's university tuition and she also invested in her eldest son Batbold's grocery store business. Since her business inventory has decreased she is requesting a loan to increase the inventory.

loans.use: To purchase sheep meat for her business

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es:
La señora Emerita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Doradinas en Acción” vive en el Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 40 años, 01 hijo que aun dependen de ella, por lo que Emerita, trabaja muy duro día a día.

Su carácter emprendedor y el amor a su familia le motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes que poco a poco fue aumentando y ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  
En la actualidad tiene sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con alegría y entusiasmo. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Emerita, se siente muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, y desea seguir cumpliendo sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Ms. Emerita is a member of the community bank "Doradinas en Acción.” She lives in the department and province of San Martin in the district of Bellavista. She is 40 years old and lives with her partner. Ms. Emerita works very hard every day to support her son who depends on her. Her enterprising spirit and love for her family motivated her to open her own grocery store. It grew little by little and Ms. Emerita gained experience in this type of activity. She has made herself well-known and liked by her customers. Currently Ms. Emerita has regular clients that stop by her store daily to buy everything a housewife needs. Ms. Emerita personally attends to each of them with joy and enthusiasm. With this loan of 2,000.00 S she will buy bags of rice and sugar, packets of beans, different brands of boxed milk and boxes of canned fish, eggs, and personal hygiene products. With these products she will be able to continue giving superior service to her clients. Emerita is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos and hopes to continue achieving her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries in order to expand and stock her products

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
56-year-old Evelyn E. is a farmer. She helps her husband grow rice to help pay the expenses in their home, which are increasing because her grandchildren are living with them also. She started her business in 2005. Farming is not a difficult job for her because she grew up on the farm and her parents are farmers.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy insecticides and to pay the laborers who will harvest her crop. Someday, her dream is to have a larger farm so that she will have many workers and more harvest to share with other people.
She likes CEVI a lot and she hopes to make use of CEVI loans again in the future.

loans.use: To pay the farm laborers and purchase insecticides

loans.name: Tserendorj

texts.en:
Tserendorj B. is a very decent and reliable person who lives with his daughter and wife in Uvurkhangai province, Mongolia. He started his business in 2003, selling machinery parts with his daughter. Now he is conducting his business with his wife while his daughter has started a car repair service of her own. He is known by customers to be an honest seller and everyone in his province likes to buy machinery parts from him.

He wishes to increase his sales in order to earn more profit. Now he has one container and one counter to sell his machinery parts. His budget is around in 8,000,000 tugrug (~5600 USD). From this number, you can see how good he is at his business. He is considered in his community as very experienced and intelligent. He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100 USD) loan to maintain and continue his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Antonine

texts.en:
Antonine owns a tailoring business in Shauri moyo Nairobi. Antonine has requested her first loan of Kes. 40,000 in order to add to her stock of fabric. She hopes to open a wholesale shop one day and to educate her children.  Married with four children, Antonine also cares for her parents. She describes herself as humble and cooperative.




About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to stock of fabric

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es una socia dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 61 años, madre de seis hijos, todos mayores de edad, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, la tienda funciona en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo  quien es obrero. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” desde hace cuatro años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que le permitió invertir en golosinas para vender, en la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 1500 soles, que será utilizado para comprar productos de primera necesidad como fideos, arroz, azúcar, etc. La meta de Rosa es ampliar su negocio y seguir trabajando para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa is one of our dynamic members. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. Rosa is 61 years old and the mother of 6 adult children. She sells groceries from her store that she operates out of her home. She has the support of her husband, who works as a laborer.

Rosa became a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Virtuosas” (Virtuous Women) four years ago. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 soles and used to purchase candy for resale. At the moment, she needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy basic necessities such as noodles, rice, sugar, etc. Rosa’s goal is to expand her business and continue increasing her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities such as noodles, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: El señor Oscar Danilo P. tiene la edad de 36 años ,habita en el Km. 13 carretera a Masaya , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como domestica en una casa privada , para apoyarle con los gastos del agua, luz y la compra del gas butano ,ellos tiene un hijo el cual estudia secundaria , los planes futuros hacia su familia es poder apoyar a su hijo con sus estudios para que pueda estudiar en la universidad y sea una persona de bien , don Oscar desde hace cuatro años labora para ULTRANIC como chofer, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no tiene todos los recursos para poder construir su vivienda de una solo ves , lo cual agradece a Afodenic por la buena aprobación de su crédito el cual espera poder  lograr sus metas en la construcción para una mejor comodidad en la familia ya que es muy pequeña, el desembolso lo va a invertir en materiales de construcción , para el anexo que le hará. Comprara: cemento, arena, piedra, hierro para comenzar  hacer la obra.
texts.en:
Oscar Danilo P., 36, lives with his wife, who works as a domestic in a private home to help him with household expenses like water, electricity and butane gas, at Km.13, Masaya highway. They have a son who is a middle school student. His future plans for his family is to help his son with his studies so that he can go to university and become an upstanding citizen. For the past 4 years, Oscar has been employed as a driver by ULTRANIC. His greatest obstacle is that he lacks the necessary funds to build his house once and for all. He is grateful to Afodenic for approving his loan with which he hopes to reach his goal of finally having a more comfortable dwelling for his family since their present house is very small. He will use the funds to buy building materials for the addition he plans to build. He will buy: cement, sand, stone and iron to start construction.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone and cement.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This client is 35 years old, married, and has one child who graduated from high school.

The client has been working in his shop for more than fourteen years. Before establishing this shop he worked with a tailor to gain experience. However, he was eager to be on his own and decided to open his own business.

Now he needs a loan to purchase a new sewing machine and some cloth. He expect that his income will increase and he will raise his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en:
Kemi sells sarongs of various colors and sizes at retail prices to her customers in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is 43 years old, married with 3 children. Her husband is an engineer and he also supports the household.

Kemi has been in this business for 5 years. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a sixty year old married mother of four children, some of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Aba, like many other women in the community, works to support her husband to provide for the family. She trades in maize. She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities and supplies to food vendors in her community. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk so she can supply to more customers to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia O. is married to a commercial driver and they have seven children. She is 49 years old, and her youngest child is ten.

Felicia sells plantains, cooking oil, garri (cassava flakes) and tubers of yam in a major market in Benin City. She hopes to expand her business and provide her children with the basic necessities of life, including their education.

She needs a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Burged

texts.en:
Burged has lived with her husband and two daughters in the city for the past year. To help support her family, she imports meat from the countryside and sells it at the local market.

Burged purchased several tons of energy efficient fuel to stay warm in the long cold days of winter as well as to save money from fuel costs. Since using the fuel, she has noticed that it keeps her yurt (tent) warmer for a longer period of time.


About XacBank Eco Products Program:
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world. Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius. Sixty percent of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. Sixty percent of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To buy clean and energy efficient heating fuel

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann A. is a 27-year-old mother of two. Both are minors and grade school students. She is a native of Talim Island in the town of Binangonan, which is located in Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is happily living with her two children and her 33-year-old husband, Arnold A., who is a driver.

She has hopes of escaping the cycle of poverty. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and a KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2009 with hope of securing working capital to establish a business. Since then her business has continued to grow and provide good income for her family; therefore couple now request their 2nd loan in the amount of 10,000 pesos to use as working capital to continue their fish cage business. The loan will be used to pay for bundles of fishnet, bamboo, rope, fingerlings (small fish) and labor expenses.

Mary Ann is looking forward to increased orders for fish from the nearby town so that they can generate enough proceeds for her family. She dreams of sending her children to school until they finish college and finding a stable living. Also of building their own house because they’re only living with their parents now.

loans.use: to use as working capital to continue their fish cage business

loans.name: Léa

texts.fr: O. Léa est née le 23 Mars 1966 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin.  Léa habite le quartier Gbowèlè à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique, depuis 6 ans. Mariée à SOGLI Epiphane, un commerçant, Léa est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. Léa a un autre enfant à sa charge. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges familiales. Léa a arrêté les classes au cours secondaire. Il y a environs 7 ans que Léa a commencé la vente de boissons de SOBEBRA (Société Béninoise de Brasserie). Parallèlement à cette activité, Léa vend également des yaourts et des tissus à Allada. C’est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, et à Allada, que Léa achète ses produits.  Léa avait bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés à ALIDé. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire, Léa sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Léa O. was born March 23, 1966, at Ouidah, a historic town in Bénin. Léa For six years she has lived in the Gbowèlè neighborhood in Allada, inthe Atlantic Department, with her husbaand Epiphane Sogli, a businesssman. She has one child of her own who is in school, and she cares for another child. Together, she and her husband take care of household expenses. , Lea dropped out of secondary school. About seven years ago she began selling drinks manufactured by a local brewery, and she also sells yogurt and yard goods. She buys these products in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She has had two loans from ALIDé that have been repaid. She seeks a third loan, with the goal of increasing her turnover.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 20 cases of soft drinks and six rolls of material.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy corn

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en:
Hoy V., age 39, is married and resides with her children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has six children. She is employed as a teacher at a public primary school in the province, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a farmer growing rice, earning an income of USD 5 per day. 

Their standard of living has improved since V. and her husband have had these businesses. V. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase pigs to raise and fish for sale. This is her third loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva. V. is pictured in front of her classroom at school.

loans.use: buy pigs to raise and fish to sell

loans.name: Jocelyne's Group

texts.en:
Jocelyne N. is from the village of Brgy, Sto.Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 47 years old and the leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jocelyne is married and has two school-aged children. She makes a living from her business selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. She has had her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Jocelyne joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyne has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jocelyne is requesting a new loan of 23000 PHP which will also be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the eleventh loan taken out by Jocelyne from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product line

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface M. N. is forty-one years old. He is married and has two children for whom he hopes to provide quality education. 

His business is located at Thika town. Thika is well known for its large scale production of pineapples. It is a fast growing medium-size town in Kenya. 

Boniface has been selling passion fruit for the last eight years to the local people. He says that business is good and the only challenge at times is getting the fruit to the market during the rainy seasons, which render the roads impassable. 

He is taking out a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more fruit to expand his business. He wants to grow his business to a point where he can export the fruit. He is hardworking, patient and humble.

loans.use: To buy more passion fruit to sell.

loans.name: Djumamurod

texts.en:
S. Djumamurod is a young, married man who breeds calves in a small village in Isfara town of Sugd region. Djumamurod is young, but full of energy. He tries every single day to make the life of his family better. Djumamurod started his business three years ago. He has great experience in cattle breeding because he observed it from childhood. He would like to expand his business and to purchase more calves. This will help him to increase his income and improve his life conditions. We wish his good luck and appreciate your help!   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a married man with three school-aged children.  He started a business for painting and repairing jacks four months ago.  He is a member of Mijingo group in Faulu Kenya.  Through the group, he can get a loan from Faulu Kenya.  Therefore, he has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy spray pumps and paints. He hopes to stabilize his business in ten years.

loans.use: To buy spray pumps and paints

loans.name: Mansab's Group

texts.en:
Mansab lives with her family in Multan, Pakistan, which is famous for its tombs and holy places. She is a housewife who is playing her role as a good wife and kind mother. 

Her husband drives an auto rickshaw which is their only source of income. He drives his rickshaw from 9am to 7pm. He goes to different areas in search of customers, and this keeps his rickshaw working for ten continuous hours. Now the rickshaw needs maintenance; otherwise, its engine will seize up.
 
Mansab has applied for a loan from Asasah which will be used for overhauling and maintaining her husband’s rickshaw. A newly maintained rickshaw will help him make more money because he will be able to work for greater periods of time and can work more efficiently.

loans.use: To repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Vicentina;  ella tiene 51 años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 25 y 16 años de edad; la socia se dedica a comercio minorista ella compra al por mayor yeso y vende en su casa, La socia vende yeso para los tarrajeos de las casas y los acabados finales,  La socia es jubilada ella es docente de profesión. La socia solicita el préstamo para compra al por mayor yeso para los tarrajeos y acabados de las casas. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Vicentina belongs to the communal bank "Arcangel Gabriel." She lives in the Huanchac district of Cusco province, in the department of Cusco. Vicentina is 51 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 25 and 16. She works in retail trade, buying plaster at wholesale and selling it from her house. She sells material that is used to plaster the walls of homes and provide finishing touches to the home. She is a retired teacher. She is requesting this loan to buy more plaster at wholesale. Vicentina appreciates and is infinitely thankful for the loan that was granted, which will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. She pledges to make each of her payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy plaster at wholesale to sell at retail

loans.name: Ye

texts.en: Ye P., 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. P. is employed at a local garment factory for an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 4.75 per day. P. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to repair the house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to open a tailor shop.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair the house.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is a market entrepreneur from Pavlograd. She is  divorced with a 19-year-old daughter. Galina sells women's clothing in the central marketplace of her home town. She offers a nice clothing selection of various sizes for different age groups. Galina launched her venture 15 years ago. Experience working in the trade and professionalism have helped her increase her inventory up to 60,000 Grivnyas today. Her monthly net profit ranges from 5,000 to 7,000 Grivnyas.   

Galina is seeking a loan of 9,000 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal clothing for fall and winter. Her business is the only source of income in the family: Galina's daughter is a college student and lives with her at the moment. Galina has an optimistic view of life. She never gives up and presses on even when faced with hardships. One of her plans is to generate additional profit and remodel her apartment which is a costly undertaking in Ukraine.

loans.use: to increase her turnover

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira D. is from the village of Poblacion in the municipality of Aurora in Zamboanga del Sur Province. She is 43 years old. Elvira is single and has two school-age children. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over four years, and she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elvira joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elvira from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mrs. Khann Chanthy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people make up this village bank loan located in Kampong Luong village in Takeo province. Mrs. Khann C., who was born in 1967, is the village bank president having been selected by the other members. Each member will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to supP. their business.

Mrs. Khann C. is a pig breeder at her home from which she is able to earn a large profit to supP. her family. Her husband, Mr. Meng Chang Chhorng, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) plot of land that he uses to cultivate rice to sell to supP. their family. He is also a fisherman.

Mrs. Khann C.’s problem is that it is time to do farming but her husband does not have enough money to supP. doing so. So, to improve matters, she is asking for a loan to enable him to farm this current year. She is the mother of three children who are all studying in school and helping their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To enable her husband to farm this year

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 46 años, vive con sus 4 hijos y su madre en su casa propia. Hace más de 3 años se dedica a vender cerveza durante los fines de semana, asimismo cuando se presenta alguna actividad como celebraciones o fiestas patronales tiene más salida de venta de este producto. Por otro lado se dedica también a cuidar sus animales, así como cuidar su campos agrícolas, en donde siembra papa, maíz, arveja y habas. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hijo para vigilar sus animales, mientras Juana vende cervezas. Afirma que este negocio la ayuda a afrontar las carencias económicas, ya que le genera las rentas necesarias mientras espera la temporada de cosecha, por tal motivo desea incrementar su capital  de trabajo. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más cajas de cerveza, asimismo desea comprar sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Juana is 46 years old and she lives with her 4 children and her mother in a house she owns. She has been engaging in selling beer for more than 3 years: she works during the weekend and also during special events such as celebrations or festivals, when she sells a higher quantity of her product. She also engages in agriculture, taking care of her lands where she plants potatoes, maize, peas and broad beans. Sometimes her son helps her taking care of her animals while she sells beer. She says this activity helps her facing her financial problems, as it generates enough income to get by until the harvesting season, and for this reason she wants to increase her working capital. This is her second loan with MFP: she is very happy to know she can count on economic support as she has always been responsible with her repayments. She also likes being part of her communal bank as all its members are very responsible and caring people. She is thankful to those lenders who will manage the loan she is requesting, as it will be very helpful in the development of her activity. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more beer cases, as well as some more bags of fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more beer cases.

loans.name: Maguinda

texts.en: Maguinda D. is a married woman who lives in Prk.II, Nangka, Brgy. Argawanon, San Remegio, Cebu. She earns her living with a handicraft business. Her husband, Max Arthur D., age 26, works as a construction worker to earn his living. They have four children who are 1 month to 6 years old. Maguinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Maguinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 14,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 8,000 PHP, thus improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing 19,000 PHP which she intends to use to purchase raw materials so that she can continue to save up for future house repairs. Maguinda D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest, age 52, is a married man with 11 children living in a permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He deals in farming and goat raring. He wants his children to study up to university so that they can have a good future. He dreams of being a lifetime animal farmer. He wants a loan to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for the children.

loans.name: Ahmed Foday

texts.en: Pictured here is Ahmed Foday K.. The thirty-year-old was born in Kabala town; he is single with one child. Ahmed sells assorted goods – photo albums, body creams, toiletries, cards, etc. He travels to the capital city Freetown (about 624 km both ways) to buy the goods he sells. This loan will definitely limit the number of trips he will have to make, increase his business size and quality, and increase his sales-to-profit-margin.

loans.use: Buy photo albums, body creams, toiletries, cards, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cotton and plastic slippers

loans.name: Amna's Group

texts.en:
Amna resides in Samundri, a small city of Punjab Pakistan that is known for its agriculture industry. She came here after her marriage, and she lives with her family in a 2 room brick house. 

Amna is 28 years old and has 4 sons, who she is raising with great care and discipline. All of the children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Amna believes in the importance of education so that her children will complete their studies and become successful in their lives.  

While Amna carries out her responsibilities as a housewife, her husband operates a cosmetics shop in the market. He started this business 10 years ago and it has proven to be a very good source of income for him. He sells different cosmetics products such as mascara, eyeliner, lipstick and nail polish.

Amna has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband in his business. With a loan, he will buy cosmetics products in bulk quantity to sell at his shop. This will help him offer a greater range of products to his customers, so that he can make more sales and income. Amna is hopeful that an investment will be more productive for her husband and bring his business to a more profitable position. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself a responsible client by paying her installments on time and attended every meeting. 

In the photo, the woman with a book (an Asasah Passbook) is Amna.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Binitihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is married and has six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Bintihamisi operates a fish business, selling fish from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is the change of seasons. Bintihamisi decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase a deep freezer to store fish. In the future, Bintihamisi hopes to establish a store to sell fresh fish.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer to store fish

loans.name: Jesús Santiago

texts.es:
Jesús Santiago C. O. tiene 48 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre vive con la compañera y con los hijos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 7 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNION SAN ANTONIO, Recinto San Antonio parroquia San José del Tambo distancia de la oficina a 150 minutos de la comunidad se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Jesús Santiago se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder comprar un carro.

Le gusta disfrutar del deporte.
texts.en:
Jesús Santiago C. O. is 48 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has 7 children.

The members of the UNION SAN ANTONIO community bank are located in San Antonio precinct, in San José del Tambo parish, 150 minutes from our office, in Chillanes canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  They have been in this business for a long time.

Jesús Santiago is a farmer.  He grows corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  He buys his products in the Matilde Ester shopping area and sells his products in Bucay.

José Santiago is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for growing corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to be able to buy a car.  He enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Frelyn

texts.en:
Frelyn M. is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occdental. She is 30 years old, single and has an infant-aged child. To make a living, Frelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Frelyn is just starting this business.
In 2011, Frelyn joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a busy entrepreneur managing a fishing business. Her previous loan from ASHI has provided working capital to expand her business and purchase additional fishing materials. With this loan, Rosemarie has noticed that her monthly income has almost doubled, since she has attracted new customers with additional inventory of fish.

Rosemarie joined Kiva's partner, ASHI, in 2001, attracted by ASHI's lower interest rates and range of loans for business, education and home repair. Prior to ASHI, Rosemarie had no access to capital to support her entrepreneurial dreams. Positive growth from her business has helped Rosemarie fund the education of her children. Since joining ASHI, Rosemarie has experienced positive changes in her life. She hopes her fishing business will continue to flourish so she can provide long-term financial stability for her family.

Her fishing business also contributes income for them and that’s why, even if sometimes selling fish is hard to do, she never gets tired of doing it. Therefore, she is now requesting another loan for the much larger amount of 45,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase an additional fishnet and support the maintenance of their pump boat. This will allow her to grow their business further so that their children can fulfill their dreams of experiencing a life that’s full of happiness. She is continuing to pray and wishes lenders all the best and good luck. She hopes they will continue to support poor families like them, who want to improve their standard of living. Her long-term goals are to help support her children's education, invest and build a better house for the family, and to have a full-fledged fishing business.

loans.use: To buy a fishnet and support the maintenance of their pump boat to catch more fish to sell

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: Segundina tiene 60 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 32 años de experiencia en la  ganadería y la agricultura, junto con su esposo sacaron adelante a sus hijos que ahora son mayores de edad y ahora  sigue dedicándose a estas tareas  para  apoyar a los menores que aun están estudiando, siembra papa, maíz, trigo y habas, adicionado a esto cría animales de ganado vacuno ovino y ahora intensifica la crianza de animales menores, principalmente los pollos que tiene en su misma granja, es así que tiene  muchas posibilidades de salir, en la actualidad su esposo es la ayuda principal que tiene y desea seguir dedicándose a esta labor hasta donde sigan dando sus fuerzas. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos y cuyes.
texts.en:
Segundina is 60 years old and she lives with her husband and two children in their own home. She has 32 years of experience in raising cattle and farming. Together with her husband she has brought up her children, who are now grown up, but she continues with this work to support the youngest children who are still studying. 

She plants potatoes, corn, wheat and beans, and she also rears cattle and sheep. Currently she is rearing smaller livestock, mainly chickens, which she keeps on her farm. Thus she has many opportunities to make progress.  At the moment, her husband is her main helper and she wants to continue with her work as long as she is able. 

This is Segundina's seventh loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support because she has always proved herself responsible in making her repayments. Also, she likes to be part of the community bank because all members are responsible and very supportive. She thanks all those who will be helping out with the loan, which will be very useful in developing her business. 

Segundina will use this loan to buy pigs and guinea pigs.

loans.use: To buy pigs and guinea pigs

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo S., 36, is married and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. Since 2008, she has been making and selling cakes with her daughter to sell at the local market, typically making $8 of profit each day. Her husband is teacher and makes $5 per day. 

Keo S. is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Nha's Group

texts.en:
Nha T. N. is 33 years old and has three children. They live in Phuc loc village. She manages a small grocery shop at her house. She sells many  kinds of products, such as wine, rice, beer, etc. Her business has had strong development since she got her first loan from our credit program in 2005.  Everyday, she gets close to $5 profit from this shop and it helps her cover her family's expenditures. She is also growing flowers to sell and raising four pigs for meat.  Currently, she wants a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy fertilizer for the flowers and food for the pigs.

At T. N. is 35 years old with two children. She raises chickens for their eggs. She needs a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy food for them.

Mien T. D. is 33 years old with 2 children. She is growing fruit trees and raising chickens for meat. She wants to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy chicken food and fertilizer for the trees.

Ha V. T. N. is 33 years old with 2 children. She has a shop that sells electrical equipment. She wants a loan of 8,502,000 VND to invest in her shop.

loans.use: to buy flower fertilizer and pig food.

loans.name: Purevdorj

texts.en:
Purevbat is 40 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in Ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  His older daughter currently graduated from college and other children are attending a local secondary school. He moved to UB from a rural area in 2000 so he could give his children a proper education. Since then, he has been employed at “Makhachkala” LLC as a truck driver during summer time and during the winter he drives his director’s car as driver. 

His wife, Dorj, is 24, and she runs a decoration business. He is planning to give a proper education to his children and teach them good morals.

Purevbat is currently building a small house on his land. The building work is 80 percent complete and he wants to do some plasterwork to the house. Therefore he is requesting a 1.000.000 MNT loan to purchase some construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for his house.

loans.name: Kajumba

texts.en: Forty-nine-year-old Kajumba F., a married mother of six school-going children, resides in Kyenjojo where she grows bananas and makes local brew from her home in Enjeru. She employs two part-time people to help with her businesses and earns 300,000/= as monthly income from farming and 500,000/= monthly income from making and selling local brew. Now in business for 25 years, she used savings from her late husband to begin her enterprises and would like to expand to commercial farming in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pestcides and other farm inputs for increased productivity.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy tiene 42 años, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en su casa que es propia. Hace más de 5 años que ofrece el servicio de transporte, para ello cuenta con su propia movilidad, ya que antes se dedicaba a la agricultura y crianza de animales en el campo, pero sus  deseos de superación lo llevaron a adquirir su propia movilidad, y hoy ofrece el servicio de transporte. Desde entonces cubre la ruta urbana de su ciudad, con el tiempo ha logrado tener ganancias, que le ayudan en el sostén  de su familia. Asimismo no descuida su antigua labor, y debe también afrontar los gastos tanto en la siembra y en la compra de animales. Pero su mayor anhelo es adquirir otro carro más. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP,  considera que este préstamo es de gran utilidad y agradece por el apoyo con su compromiso de ser puntual en sus pagos.  Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá una parte para el pago del mantenimiento mecánico y el pago de repuestos para su carro así como también en la compra de ovejas.
texts.en:
Fredy is 42 years old and he lives with his wife and their 4 children in a house that they own. He has been providing public transportation for the past 5 years and he has his own car for the business. Prior to this business he was an agriculturist and a farmer raising livestock in the fields. But his dreams of self-improvement motivated him to get his own car and today he provides public transportation. 

Since then he has been covering an urban route in the city. With time he has managed to have a profit and it helps him to support his family. But he has not left his previous occupation so he also faced with the expenses of the plantation and with the purchase of livestock. But his greatest goal is to acquire another car. 

This is his first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he says that this loan will be of great use and he is thankful for the support. He is committed to be on time with his payments. He will invest a portion of the loan which he requests in carrying out maintenance repairs and to purchase spare parts for his car, he will also purchase sheep.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance repairs to his car, to buy spare parts, and to also purchase sheep.

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz is 56 years old and lives in the village of Kobuleti, a seaside resort in the western part of the country. Revaz is married and lives with his wife Tina, sister and four adult children: two daughters and two sons. 

Revaz is an electrician who works in his profession in the village. In addition, he contributes to the profitable functioning of family dairy farm. They have three milk cows. They sell the dairy products from the cows on the local market. Also, the family grows nuts, maize and tangerines and sells them on the local market.  The total average monthly income of the family is 1,200 Laris.
