Family members want to expand the dairy farm by purchasing more cows, but the existing cattle shed doesn’t allow them to keep more livestock. 

With the requested loan, Revaz will purchase construction materials and expand the cattle shed. In the near future, the family will purchase more cows and sell more dairy products. With the increased income, the family will afford themselves better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to expand the cattle shed

loans.name: Yhasmany

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Yhasmani; el tiene 23 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cigarros, el negocio es de su mama y juntos trabajan juntos, el socio distribuye los cigarros al por mayor a las diferentes tiendas de abarrotes, el socio también estudia en un instituto y también trabaja en una empresa de seguridad, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar en sus negocios y en su estudio. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar cigarros al por mayor y también para pagar algunas mensualidades de su instituto.                                       
                   
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yhasmani, 23, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” (Let’s Walk Together) communal bank located in Cusco District which belongs to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

He is single.  He alternates his daily chores with selling cigarettes.  The business belongs to his mother and they work together.  He sells the cigarettes at wholesale to various grocery stores.  He is also studying at an institute and is employed by a security firm.  He wants to expand and improve his business and his schooling.  

He is asking for the loan to buy some cigarettes at wholesale and also to pay some of his institute’s monthly fees.  He is happy about the loan and commits to pay his installments.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes at wholesale and also to pay some of his monthly school fees.

loans.name: Maritza Del Pilar

texts.es:
Maritza tiene de 30 años de edad, ella es soltera, cuenta con casa propia,  la cual está ubicada en el distrito de Catacaos, Piura en el norte del Perú. Maritza vive en la parte Rural de este distrito, pero si cuenta con los servicios básicos.

Maritza se dedica a la venta de verduras en su domicilio y a  la venta de comida en un taller mecánico cerca a su domicilio, Maritza  cuenta con clientela ya establecida en el taller mecánico ya que es la única persona que vende comida y menús en dicho local. 

Maritza desea comprar más insumos para prepara sus alimentos, ya que dicho taller mecánico se ampliara y de esta manera se ampliará el número de empleados. Por ello maritza está solicitando a  Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles. Para poder realizar lo que se ha propuesto.

Maritza  es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Maritza is 30 years old, single, and owns her own home in Catacaos district, Piura, in the north of Peru.  Maritza lives in the rural part of this district but her home has basic services.

Maritza sells vegetables from her home and she also sells food in a car repair shop near her home.  She already has an established customer base in the car repair shop as she is the only person who sells food and meals in these premises.

Maritza would like to buy more supplies for preparing her food since the car repair shop is going to expand and so the number of employees will grow.  For this reason, Maritza is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Maritza is a hard-working woman who works hard every day to get ahead and enjoy a better quality of life.  People who know her consider her to be a kind person who is always ready to help others.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making and selling food

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
This is Melisa, 36, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Elvis, a contract worker, and is the mother of four children. By the grace of God, Juanita has managed to support her children's schooling — a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Juanita as she herself has been a college graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Melisa operates an LPG business. What she basically does is buy Liquefied Petroleum Gas tanks from wholesalers, and sells them per tank with a little profit. LPG tanks can range from small to regular size. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippines pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of LPG tanks to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Melisa dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a store in the community market. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for new stockof LPG tanks and products for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Las Tesoritos del Distrito de Yarinacocha. Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.
Ella se dedica a la venta de lubricantes y repuestos de motos, recién lleva cuatro ciclos trabajando con este banco comunal.  Los préstamos solicitados le han servido para ir implementando cada día su negocio, el cual se encuentra ubicado en una calle muy transitada.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 caja de lubricante, 1 docena de cámara para moto, 1 caja de rodaje, 6 catalinas, 6 cadenas, 6 intermitentes, 1 caja de grasa, 1 caja de sera.
Estos productos no tienen que faltar en este negocio ya que tienen mucha demanda.  Su negocio está instalado en su propia casa, su hija es la que se queda a cargo de todo cuando Rosa sale a realizar algunas compras.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos, que por medio de sus promotoras, le están dando las pautas de ¿cómo manejar adecuadamente su dinero?.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Las Tesoritos del Distrito de Yarinacocha” (Treasures of Yarinacocha District) communal bank, Ucayali Department.  She’s 42 years old, married and has two children.

She sells lubricants and motorcycle spare parts.  She’s just been working with the communal bank for four cycles.  The requested loans have served to stock the business, which is located on a very busy street, every day.

With her new, 1700 new sol, loan she will buy: 1 box of lubricants, 1 dozen motorcycle inner tubes, 1 box of ball bearings, 6 gears, 6 chains, 6 turn signals, 1 box of grease and 1 box of wax. These products can’t be lacking in this business because they are in very high demand.  Her business is located in her house and her daughter takes charge of everything whenever Rosa has to go out shopping.

She is grateful to Manuela Ramos because she is getting guidance through its advisors on such topics like: how to adequately manage her money.

loans.use: to buy wax, grease and lubricants.

loans.name: Humphrey

texts.en:
Humphrey has been in farming for over 10 years in his hometown of Kitale in Western Kenya. He produces vegetables and milk, which are both sold to the local market. He gets additional income from his employment as a driver. He is married with five children

Humphrey has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. This is his second loan request after his first loan of 30,000 KES. He says it will help him provide for the family needs. He hopes to be a major supplier of eggs in the market.

Humphrey says however that harsh weather conditions and diseases are challenging to farming efforts. He wishes Juhudi would diversify loan products more.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 70 years old and married.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Emma has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and pig fattening.

Emma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda Hernestina

texts.es: Yolanda a sus 53 años ve con satisfacción el fruto del arduo trabajo realizado, vive en su casa con el menor de sus 4 hijos.Tiene su tienda de abarrotes desde hace 3 años que instalo en su misma casa, sus hijos que la visitan con frecuencia la apoyan en la atención y ofrece a su clientela variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Ella atiende su negocio mayormente por las mañanas ya que por las tardes tiene otras ocupaciones. Los días jueves de cada de semana se abastece de mercadería en otro negocio de carne que tiene ya que compra mercadería en carne, queso y  algunas cosechas de la zona rural y lleva a vender a sus cliente de manera ambulante los días sábados. Yolanda manifiesta que lo que le agrada de su trabajo es que  puede ver sus ganancias de manera diaria y para el futuro su deseo es incrementar su capital.Esta es la séptima solicitud de crédito y trabajo financiero que tiene con MFP de las cuales  siente la gran satisfacción de pertenecer a un banco comunal unido y muy cumplido en el pago de sus cuentas que le genera tranquilidad y confianza de saber que esta rodeada de personas honestas Y en esta ocasión comprara mas mercadería para su tienda
texts.en: Yolanda is 53 years old and is pleased that her hard work is paying off.  She lives with the youngest of her 4 children.  3 years ago she set up her small shop in her home.  Her children visit often and help her with the business, providing good service and a variety of every day necessities.  Yolanda works in her store primarily in the mornings, as in the afternoons she has other responsibilities.   On Thursdays each week, she buys meats and cheeses and products from local harvests in another market, and brings them to sell to her clients on the weekends.   What Yolanda likes about her work is that she can see her income every day.  In the future she would like to increase her income.   This is the 7th loan she has had with MFP and she feels very pleased to be a member of this communal bank, as it gives her a sense of confidence to work with a group of honest people.   She will use the loan to purchase merchandise for  her store.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her small shop

loans.name: Norata

texts.en: Norata is a married woman who lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with her family. She and her husband are both farmers. Norata helps her husband grow rice crops on their land. Aside from rice farming, Norata also raises pigs in their backyard. She works hard to support her family. Norata has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds and pig feed. She hopes to provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and pig feed

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius, a married father of two boys and a girl, all of whom attend school, lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

For over ten years, Julius has operated a sculpture-making business, selling along the coastline to tourists visiting Mombasa for holidays. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business, and dreams of purchasing plots of land to build houses in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business, with a loan Kshs 30,000 Julius wants to purchase wood for making sculptures for sale.

loans.use: to purchase wood for making sculptures for sale.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years. Delia earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear [clothes].

Delia is borrowing 10,500 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her beauty parlor business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian works hard to support her family.  She is single and has a variety store business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Lilian requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy different products to sell in her variety store.   In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: buy products to sell in her store

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, single and lives with two family members, one of whom works.

Ali has owned a large electric generator since 2009, leasing electric lines for his area and surroundings. He has worked in this field for four years so he has good experience, a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to purchase a new generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a new generator

loans.name: Huyagdulam

texts.en: Huyagdulam is 52 years old and lives with her husband. They rent a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent, in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business. She started her parts supply retail business in 1996 by renting a counter in the biggest market in Mongolia. She is a strong and hardworking woman who says, "In past years I have concentrated on my kids. Now that they are independent, it's time to expand my business." She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more spare parts to expand the range of products that she sells.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia, de 38 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy responsable, esta casada y es madre de dos hijos de 6 y 4 años, vive en una casa alquilada a lado de su esposo y sus dos menores hijos por quienes trabaja mucho para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. EL trabajo de Patricia consiste en la venta de productos, herramientas, ya que tiene una ferretería. Su negocio esta ubicada en el centro de la ciudad y es una zona muy concurrida, lleva recién tres meses con este negocio, tiene el respaldo y apoyo de su esposo con quien trabaja, como todo nuevo negocio aun esta entrando al mercado y espera poder crecer de a pocos para así tener el ansiado crecimiento que tanto desea. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que esta a lado de sus esposo y juntos trabajan muy bien. Le esta yendo bien ya que el movimiento es diario, no como quisiera pero al menos entra y sale los productos dejando ganancias. Espera poder consolidar su negocio y así poder crecer mucho más en su faceta de empresaria ferretera. Este será el segundo crédito con la MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con su objetivo, por otro lado se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos los integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mercadería para surtir un poco más a su ferretería.
texts.en: Patricia, 38, is a friendly, responsible woman.  She and her husband have two children who are 6- and 4-years old, respectively.  They rent the house where they live.  Patricia works hard because she wants to give her family a better quality of life.  She owns her own hardware business.  The store is in the center of town, on a street with lots of traffic.  She started the business three months ago and can count on help from her husband because he also works at the store. The business is small, like most new businesses, but Patricia hopes to grow it over time.  So far, she's doing pretty well.  Not as well as she wants, perhaps, but merchandise is going out as fast as it's coming in and she's making money.  She hopes to consolidate her gains and firmly establish herself as a hardware merchant.  This is her second MFP loan and she's counting on your support.  For her part, she is committed to repaying this loan in the time agreed, just as she did her first loan.  She says, too, that she is happy with her community bank because the members are responsible and supportive.  Patricia will use this loan to buy merchandise to stock her hardware business.

loans.use: to stock her hardware store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es socia del Banco Comunal “Kapia Marca”  ubicado en el distrito y  provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 48 años D. edad, está casada y  tiene cinco hijos, 2 independientes.

Virginia trabaja con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 6 años,  nos cuenta que el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para  incrementar el capital D. su negocio D. compra y venta D. ganados vacunos y crianza D. truchas.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma D.  S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que servirá para comprar quince sacos D. alimento para las truchas  (purinas y  naltech), en el negocio le ayudan sus hijos y su esposo.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener más jaulas para truchas y ser una gran empresaria

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, compartir ideas y experiencias con las demás socias.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the “Kapia Marca” communal bank located in Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department.  She’s 48 years old, married and has five children two of which are independent.

Virginia has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for six years.  She relates that her first loan was for 300 new soles that she used to increase capital in her business raising cattle and trout.

She is asking for a new, 300 new sol, loan to buy fifteen sacks of feed for the trout (Purina and Naltech).  Her children and her husband help her in the business.  Her dream for the future is to have more cages for the trout and to be a great businesswoman.  What she likes best about her communal bank is the meetings; sharing ideas and experiences with her fellow members.

loans.use: to buy fifteen sacks of trout feed.

loans.name: Maturu Hill Group

texts.en:
Rodah is the facilitator of the Maturu Hill Group. Rodah and her group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 
Rodah takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate her children. In the recent 2011 season, she had a very good maize yield harvesting eight bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest two bags of maize on half an acre of land. 
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rodah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 
With income from maize sales, Rodah will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Maturu Hill Group will each plant maize plots between half and one acre of land.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is 26 years old, married but not yet fortunate to be blessed with child. He is a farmer in their village who dreams to provide a comfortable life to his wife and to his future children. With his dream, he dedicates himself to operating a farming business where he plants corn and harvests to sell. Last cropping, he earned P15,000, which he spent on their household expenses such as food.

Rolly wants to further develop his business through asking for a loan amount of P25,000 to purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizer and pesticides used in improving his farm. With his tirelessly working in the field, he knows that he can provide a comfortable life to his wife and future children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizer and pesticides used in improving his farm

loans.name: Eloisa Cristina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Eloísa, ella tiene  48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y  uno de 16 años que estudia en colegio, sus hijos mayores estudian en universidad, todos aún viven con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes a comprar sus productos. Trabaja todos los días y sus hijos también le ayudan con sus ventas en sus lugares de estudio, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada 8 días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a Guayaquil y Huaquillas cada vez que necesita. Tiene 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad y  lo mas vende es ropa de mujer.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 8 años y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The community bank Honduras 2000 meets every two weeks in the Jaramijo (Manta) canton, which is known for its beautiful beaches along the coast of this beautiful place.  The majority of the inhabitants are very hardworking and work with the sea.

In this place we meet Eloisa, who is 48 years old, married, and has three children, two who are adults, and one who is 16 years old and studies in high school.  Her older children study at the university and all of them live with her.  Her husband is a fisherman.

In order to earn money herself and help with the household expenses, she works selling all types of clothing.  She sells from door to door and also sells from her house, where customers come to purchase her products.  She works every day and her children help her with the sales where they study.  She gives her customers credit and collects every eight days.  She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil and Huaquillas whenever she needs it.  She has done this work for eight years and she sells the most women's clothing.

She will use this loan to purchase merchandise like pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.  She has been a member of the community bank for eight years and she likes it because she used her first loan to start her business.  

Her dream is to have a car to make her sales.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Rachiel

texts.en:
Rachiel is a 27-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Rachiel is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Nilton Ysac

texts.es:
Nilton tiene 21 años de edad y tiene como pasatiempo el escuchar música sobre todo cuando han culminado sus exámenes, ya que Nilton se encuentra estudiando la carrera de electrónica en un instituto de su ciudad, Nilton a su vez trabaja como chofer de taxi y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de sus estudios y apoyar a sus padres en algunos gastos del hogar; Nilton es un joven muy trabajador, diariamente trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente; el cree que está saliendo adelante en su trabajo porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es responsable y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Nilton está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar juguetes al por mayor para poder venderlos en campaña navideña, de esta manera el tendrá un ingreso extra para solventar los gastos de sus estudios y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera de electrónica y ser el orgullo de sus padres”.
texts.en:
Nilton is 21 years old and likes to listen to music in his free time, especially when his exams are finished. He studies electronics at an institute in his city. 

Nilton works as a taxi driver. With the fruits of his labor, he can cover his tuition fees and help his family with some home expenses. Nilton is a very hardworking young man. He works for about 9 hours and serves up to 15 clients every day. He believes that he is succeeding at work because he is friendly to his clients, and above all because he is responsible and has the willpower to succeed.

Nilton is very grateful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help, he will be able to buy wholesale toys to sell during the Christmas season. He will then have extra income to pay his tuition fees and continue fighting to make his greatest dream come true: to finish his electronics degree and to be a source of pride for his parents.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a seamstress who makes childrens clothing. She learned how to sew at a training school. For several years she worked with her sister in law who provided her with the sewing machine. Slowly she started to build her own customer base and she was able to save up to buy her own machine. Today she runs her own operation, although it is very limited. She works in production during the week and then sells her final products during the weekend.

Martha needs the loan in order to purchase cloth and other materials. This is a very busy time of year for her and she wants to take advantage of the increase in demand.

Martha is 56 years old and has 6 children who are all grown up. When she was young, she became a widow and had to take charge of her family on her own. Because of the economic situation, her children had to work from a very young age. Her home is now made out of wood and her dream is to have it built out of cement.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Martha needs the loan in order to purchase cloth and other materials

loans.name: Lydia Ngwen

texts.en:
Lydia is a single parent with four children, three girls and one boy. She is facing great challenges in taking care of her children, niece, nephews, and aunties. She is responsible for so many because of the poor health situation of her sibling and the death of her father. The smiles from her dependents give her the strength to forge ahead. With previous loans she succeeded in providing her community with Food Supplements and sweaters for newborn babies. From her profits she succeeded in providing her family with minimal basics of tuition, food, and generic medications.

Given a loan of $1000, she plans to increase her stock by buying Tianshi Products, wool, needles (different sizes), and planting seeds of yam, corn, and beans. She is confident she will succeed because of the great demand among the old and young requesting Food Supplements to maintain physical health, and warm clothing for the newborns, the future of tomorrow.

She plans to repay her loan in 18 months. The first installment shall be due on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.

loans.use: Selling Food-Supplements, sweaters for newborns, and cultivation of crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Elidah would like to buy vegetables, including potatoes, kale, spinach, tomatoes, onions, and carrots

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mrs. Leang K. N. is 29 years old and a mother of 3 children. She lives in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. Leang stays at home, cooking meals and looking after her children, who are too young to attend school. Her husband, 28 years old, is the one who manages and provides for the family’s needs by working as a motor-taxi driver. However, he only earns about US$5 a day. 
To earn more income, Leang's husband would like to purchase and operate a tuk-tuk (a passenger cart attached to a motorcycle). The couple is therefore asking for a loan of US$550.

loans.use: Purchase of a passenger cart to operate a tuk tuk

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is 53. She is a mother and a grandmother. For many years she made and sold pork rind snacks, a business she learned from her parents. The business served her well and made it possible for her to raise two children. Now she cares for her 7-year-old granddaughter, who spends every day helping her grandmother. Not long ago, after losing her husband, Graciela faced the need to increase her income and took to raising hogs. She used her savings to buy good breeding stock and hopes now to keep them healthy and growing so she can see some return on her investment. She is asking for a loan of $650 and promises to repay the sum in 6 months. The loan will pay for balanced hog feed. Graciela and her granddaughter await your prompt and favorable response.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Graciela es madre y abuela tiene 53 años y el oficio de la venta de chicharrones al que se dedica desde hace muchos años lo aprendió y heredó de sus padres. Esta actividad le ha dado muchas satisfacciones y gracias a el ha podido educar con mucha satisfacción a sus 2 hijos. Actualmente vive y pasa el mayor tiempo posible con su nietecita de 7 años, quién la acompaña a desarrollar sus actividades de crianza y venta todos los días. Hace poco la separación física de su esposo la alentó a iniciar un negocio aún más rentable, la crianza y venta de cerdos y adquirió algunos ejemplares e inició su proyecto con el ahorro que contaba; ahora su deseo es mantenerlos sanos y fuertes para poder recuperar su inversión e incrementar su capital. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo de 650 dólares con un compromiso de pago durante 6 meses para comprar comida concentrada y balanceada a fin de tenerlos sanos, cuidados y bien alimentados. Graciela y su nietecita aguardan tu pronta respuesta.

loans.use: To buy hog feed.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira belongs to the village bank Nuevo Amanecer, ‘New Dawn’. She is in the popular business of renting taxis. Elvira owns two taxis that she rents out every day, from 6:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night. She rents each taxi for 75 Soles a day, about $25. The drivers are responsible for paying for the gas and returning the taxi on a full tank.

Both taxis are getting quite run down, driving constantly through the crowded streets of Lima, so Elvira's goal with this loan of $100 is to perform standard maintenance on each car to make them safer and more reliable. Elvira has two children, ages 7 and 2.

loans.use: perform standard maintenance on the two taxis she rents out

loans.name: Marach Din

texts.en: Marach Din lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has four children: two sons and two daughters. He is uneducated, and he is a farmer. He has lots of land to cultivate, but he is unable to cultivate all his land, so he requested an individual loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to work hard on his land. He wants to make a good income to help his family and enroll his children in a better education center. He is happy with all parts of his family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ana Fortunata's Group

texts.en:
Ana Fortuna, Nieves and Sabina have been members of the community bank “Prosperidad” for 9, 8, and 12 years respectively.  All of the women are very happy with their experience in the community bank.  They say that the community bank helps them to be self-sufficient.  Through the community bank they have learned to save and run their businesses more efficiently as well as finding companionship.
And Fortuna is 42 years old and has three children aged: 14, 9, and 6.  She runs a school supply store from her house.  She has had this store for the past five years.   Before that she rented VHs tapes.  When tapes became less popular Ana was able to take out a loan from her bank and start a new business.
Nieves is 53 years old and has four adult children and four who have passed away.  She raises animals and sells them at the markets.  She has been doing this all of her life.
Sabina is 47 and has three living children who are 28, 25, and 19.  Three of her children have passed away.  Sabina travels around the region buying grains at various markets and then sells them in Ayacucho.  She has been doing this for the past eight years.  
Ana Fortuna, Nieves, and Sabina need loans of 200, 300, and 350 dollars respectively.  Ana needs to go to Lima to buy supplies and prepare for the upcoming school year.  Sabina hopes to expand her business with the loan.  Both she and Nieves would buy animals.
They all dream of a better life and a successful business.  Ana dreams of sending her oldest child to medical school.  Nieves hopes to open a second stand, and Sabina wants to continue expanding her merchandise and make sure that her children receive an education.

loans.use: Ana Fortuna, Nieves, and Sabina need loans of 200, 300, and 350 dollars respectively.  Ana needs to go to Lima to buy supplies and prepare for the upcoming school year.  Sabina hopes to expand her business with the loan.  Both she and Nieves would buy animals.

loans.name: Marach D(V) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Kamiati . She currently operates a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more shop items. Kamiati is 42 years old and married.. She has 4 children ranging in age from 6 to 13, and her children go to school. Each week, Kamiati makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy another refrigerator for her shop. Kamiati previously received a loan from BRAC Uganda in the amount of UGX 400000 to invest in her business, and the loan was paid back on time.

Kamiati is joined in her small group by Hasan R. and Aisha N.. Hasan R. owns a small hotel and wants a loan to expand the business. Aisha N. operates a business selling yellow/ripe bananas and wants to purchase more bananas from neigboring villages in order to expand.

loans.use: To increase stock in retail shop

loans.name: Kiyinki B1 South E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Aisha K.. She is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to add more furniture. Aisha is 39 years old and is a widow. She has 4 children ranging from age 12 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Aisha makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy building materials and also cater for her home. Aisha has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Aisha is joined in her small group by Nuru N., Suaya N., Louisa N., and Hadija N.. Nuru N. has a business selling matooke and wants to purchase in bulk. Suaya N. is currently operating a restaurant business and wants a loan to buy more utensils, raw food and ingredients. Louisa N. operates a business selling clothes and wants to start a business selling shoes. Hadija N. is currently in the business of running a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to purchase a hair dryer and steamer.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment and improve services

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 28 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 12 and 8 years old. Rose owns a small beauty salon, which she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 7am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $225 from her sales.

In the past, Rose has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her  business.

loans.name: Darlin Del Carmen

texts.es:
Darlin M. is a business woman in the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León. She works arduously in this field with the aim of supporting her two nephews, who are under her care. It is necessary to note that she is single, which means that her only source of income is this job that she carries out daily in order to cover the household expenses and offer her children an education.

It is important to emphasize the area in which she lives does not offer electricity, so she has obtained a solar panel in order to accomplish both the education of her two young nephews and the household chores. For this reason, upon obtaining the solar panel, she has sought Ceprodel’s financial support so that she can receive a loan that will allow her to pay off her debt, thus acquiring a better quality of life along with her loved ones and moving forward as the head of the household.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Darling M. es una dama que se dedica al negocio en el municipio de El Sauce en la ciudad de León. Se dedica arduamente a este trabajo con el propósito de mantener a sus dos nietos que están bajo su responsabilidad. Es necesario destacar que esta dama es soltera y por este motivo su único sustento es el trabajo que a diario ella lleva a cabo para suplir las necesidades del hogar y también para brindarles a sus hijos las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo escolar.

Es necesario destacar que en la localidad donde ella habita no cuentan con energía eléctrica y por tal motivo ha adquirido un panel solar para lograr llevar a cabo tanto el estudio de sus dos pequeños sobrinos como los quehaceres del hogar. Por esta razón es que al adquirir el panel solar ha buscado el apoyo crediticio en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la cancelación de esta deuda y así tener un mejor nivel de vida junto con los suyos para lograr mejorar y salir adelante como cabeza del hogar.

loans.use: Payment of home solar panel

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Mrs. Blessing B. lives in the town of Ajamgbadi in Lagos State, Nigeria. For the past four years, she has made a living selling cooked foods and drinks. She studied this trade for two years before opening her shop. Blessing is 30 years old, married and has two children. She has been a client at LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. Blessing has applied for a loan of $1,200, which she will use to expand her business by buying more drinks and food items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and food to sell

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi A. is 39 years old, married, and the father of 4 children. He's a motorcycle taxi driver in Assahoun, a village located approximately 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Koffi would like to use this loan to buy a new motorcycle since the old one does not work reliably anymore. He's a good client of FECECAV, since he is applying for his second loan. The first one was repaid without problems.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Koffi A. est âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de 4 enafnts. Il est conducteur de taxi moto à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Monsieur Koffi souhaite par ce crédit acheter une nouvelle moto étant donné que l'ancienne ne fonctionne plus normalement. Il est un bon client de FECECAV puisqu'il est à son deuxième crédit et le premier était bien remboursé.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando started his business when he was deported from the United States after working there illegally.

Once he arrived in Mexico, he started with part of the money he had sent to his wife and which she had saved. He bought his first lambs 3 years ago and from there, began a business buying and selling these animals. which has allowed him to generate income to support his wife and 3 children who are 10, 8 and 3 years old.

He needs a loan for US $300, which will be repaid in 6 months, to purchase more lambs. With your support, Armando will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Armando inició el negocio cuando lo deportaron D. Estados Unidos, ya que estaba trabajando ilegalmente en ese país.

Comenzó una vez que llego a México y con parte del dinero que había enviado a su esposa, mismo que ella ahorro, compro los primeros borregos hace 3 años y D. ahí comenzó el negocio D. compra y venta D. estos animales, lo que le ha permitido generar ingresos para mantener a su esposa y sus 3 hijos D. 10, 8 y 3 años.

El necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mas borregos. Con tu apoyo Armando saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase lambs.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline O. is a widow and she is struggling to raise her five children alone. She sells tomatoes and peppers and she also has a grinding machine for grinding tomatoes and other food items. She also sells frozen foods.

Roseline is 44 years old and has five children. She needs the loan amount of $450 to purchase more tomatoes and peppers for sale.

loans.use: To buy more peppers and tomatoes for sale

loans.name: Rahib

texts.en:
Rahib was born in 1974. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, known as Fuzuli town, and settled in the Fuzuli region in Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. 

He has been in this business for six years. He is married and has one child. Now he needs a loan of $1,200 to buy shoes and clothes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes

loans.name: Thi Hien's Group

texts.vi:
Vũ Thị Hiên, sinh năm 1948(Ms 23060014), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.876.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Hàng ngày, cô đi chợ bán hoa quả thu nhập khoảng 50.000 vnđ/ ngày. Các con cô đã lớn và đi làm có thu nhập khoảng 2.500.000 đến 3.000.000 vnđ/ tháng. Cô rất thích cách hoàn trả vốn dần vì nó rất thuận tiện và phù hợp với khả năng gia đình cô và cô mong muốn tham gia vay vốn lâu dài. Trong nhóm vay của cô còn có:
Tạ Thị Minh Tâm, sinh năm 1978 (Ms 23060017), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Hàng ngày chị đi làm thuê thu nhập khoảng 50.000 đến 75.000 vnđ/ ngày.
Năng Thị Mai,.sinh năm 1976 (Ms 23060026), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Chị có thu nhập ổn định theo tháng, trung bình khoảng 1.500.000 vnđ / tháng.
Nguyễn Thị Thành, sinh năm 1979 (Ms 23060029), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ và chăn nuôi.
Hoàng Thị Hòa, sinh năm 1975(Ms 23060018), tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi lợn.
texts.en:
Mrs. V. Thi Hien (ID Number 23060014), born in 1948, would like to borrow 4,876,000VND to rear pigs. Everyday, she also sells fruits at the local market, earning about 50,000VND (around 3.00USD) a day. Her children are all grown up and have stable monthly income of about 2,500,000 to 3,000,000 VND (about 156USD to 187USD). Mrs. Hien is really keen on repaying the loan on an installment basis because it is very suitable and convenient for her family. She would like to continue borrowing for a long period of time. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. T. Thi Minh Tam (ID Number 23060017), born in 1978, borrows 4,028,000VND to rear pigs. Everyday, she also works as a hired worker with the daily income of 50,000VND to 75,000VND (about 3USD to 5USD).
  • Mrs. N. Thi Mai (ID Number 23060026), born in 1976, borrows 4,028,000VND to rear pigs. She has a stable monthly income of 1,500,000VND (about 94USD).
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thanh (ID Number 23060029), born in 1979, borrows 3,604,000VND to raise livestock and do business at the local market.
  • Mrs. H. Thi Hoa (ID Number 23060018), born in 1975, borrows 4,028,000VND to rear pigs.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rearing pigs

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.en: Pierette S. was born in 1976 in Agonlin and married Benjamin Kpamegan, a gardener and refrigerator repairman.  They have four children in school.  Pierette has been in the business of selling coal for four years and paid off her first loan.  With this loan, she will solidify her client base by continuing to supply necessary fuels.  She is asking for a loan of 120,000 franc CFA ($250 US).

loans.use: To purchase 12 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Dong

texts.en:
Dong K., 29, has one young child and lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband. She sells vegetables in the market to earn a living and is able to make $5 US a day while her husband is a taxi-driver and makes $8 US per day as well.

Mrs. Dong K. would like to take out a loan of $400 US to make a new investment. She will purchase grocery products for sale.

loans.use: To open a grocery store.

loans.name: Bertha Sofia

texts.es:
Siendo madre de tres hijos y con tan solo cuarentaitres años, Bertha ha logrado construir un negocio rentable para ella y su familia. Antes de conocer a EDAPROSPO, las ventas de su tienda eran menores a las de hoy en día.

Ella atiende durante las veinticuatro horas del día un minimarket y licorería. Ella agradece que su casa se tenga buena ubicación pues la calle donde habita es muy concurrida. Sus mismos clientes muchas veces le han dado ideas sobre qué cosas debe vender y que otras no. Atender las demandas de su público es algo que esta creciendo crecer su negocio.

Su esposo es obrero textil en una fábrica. Junto con él ha logrado terminar de construir su casa y brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos. Ella quisiera seguir implementando más su negocio y poder satisfacer los requerimientos de sus clientes más frecuentes.
texts.en:
Bertha is 43 years old and she has three children. She had managed to build a very profitable business for her and her family. Before coming to EDAPROSPO, her sales were lower than what they are today. She runs a minimarket and a liquor store 24-7. She is very lucky as her home has a great location, so her business is very well-attended. Some times, there are her very own customers who have given her ideas about what items to sell. Serving the needs of her customers is what’s making her business grow. Her husband is a textile worker in a factory. Together they managed to finish building their home and to provide their children with a good education. She would like to diversify her business in order to be able to fully satisfy her more frequent customer’s needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Diversify her business

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Mr. Socheat T., 28 and his wife, Mrs. Sreymom Boeun, 19, married in 2006 and just have one young daughter. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Socheat has been a blacksmith for seven years and started his own business five months ago. Before he started his own shop, he was employed in a shop near his village. His wife stays at home to take care of their daughter. Socheat lacks money to expand his business so he is requesting his first loan of US$ 1000 to purchase blacksmith's materials for his new shop.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith's materials for his business

loans.name: Vũ Văn Kỷ Group

texts.vi:
Chú Kỷ, 49 tuổi hiện đang sống cùng vợ và 2 con nhỏ đang đi học. Gia đình chú có rất nhiều hoạt động: vừa buôn bán các laọi thức ăn chăn nuôi, cung cấp rất nhiều mặt hàng cho các cửa hàng trong và ngoài tỉnh. Thu nhập gia đình chú rất ổn định trung bình khoảng 180000-200000 vnđ/ ngày. Lần này chú vay chu kỳ 2 với mức vốn 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để bổ sung vốn buôn bán. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm của chú ;
+ Chi Phan Thị Lý vay 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn buôn bán hoa quả.  
+ Chi Dương Thị T. vay 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn  bán hàng tạp hoá. 
+ Chi Dương Thị Q. vay 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn đi chợ. 
+ Chi Nguyễn Thị Cừ vay 4256000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn mua nguyên liệu sản xuất giấy. 
+ Chi Tô Thị L.  vay 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn buôn bán bánh kẹo.
texts.en:
Mr Ky, 49 years old, currently lives with his wife and two young children who are still going to school. He is selling a variety of cattle food to stores inside and outside his province. His family income is very stable, approximately 180,000 to 200,000 VND per day (11 to 12 USD per day). This is his second loan cycle, and he hopes to borrow 4,704,000 VND (271 USD) for a period of 50 weeks to have more fund investing in his business. Other members in Mr. Ky's group are: + Mrs. Phan Thi Ly wants to borrow 4,704,000 VND (271 USD) for a period of 50 weeks to sell fruit. + Mrs. Duong Thi Tam wants to borrow 4,704,000 VND (271 USD) for a period of 50 weeks to invest in her sundry goods store. + Mrs. Duong Thi Q. wants to borrow 4,704,000 VND (271 USD) for a period of 50 weeks to sell goods at the market. + Mrs. Nguyen Thi Cu wants to borrow 4,256,000 VND (245 USD) for a period of 50 weeks to buy more materials to produce paper. + Mrs. To Thi L. wants to borrow 4,704,000 VND (271 USD) for a period of 50 weeks to invest in her candy store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in small businesses

loans.name: Fatima Adoké

texts.fr:
F. Fatima Adoké est mariée à SOTON Robert et mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. F. Fatima Adoké est née vers 1966 et réside depuis 25 ans au quartier Fidjrossè de Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. F. Fatima Adoké vend des tissus, chaussures, sacs, mèches, produits de beauté et tenues. F. Fatima Adoké s’approvisionne au marché international du Bénin et à Lomé Capitale du Togo, pays frontalier du Bénin. Dans le souci de répondre au mieux à la demande de ses clients, F. Fatima Adoké sollicite son troisième prêt à ALIDé.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
F. Fatima Adoké is married to SOTON Robert and is the mother of two children, who are both in school. She was born around 1966 and for 25 years has been residing in the Fidjrossè district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She sells fabrics, shoes, bags, hair extensions, beauty products, and clothing. Fatima supplies herself at the international market of Bénin and in Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country bordering Bénin. Concerned about improving her response to the demands of her customers, she's requesting her third loan with ALIDÉ.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, shoes, bags, and clothing for children

loans.name: Mawero East B- Nabwire Sawuya Group

texts.en: Mrs. N. Sawuya, 42, is married with four kids. Her first born is 20 years old while her last born is 6 years old. She also takes care of three orphans, all of whom attend school. She lives in Mawero East B in Busia where she has been selling cereals (maize, beans, soya, millet, sorghum) for over 20 years. She requests a loan of USD 1800 to purchase cereals.

loans.use: To purchase cereals (maize, beans, soya, millet, sorghum)

loans.name: Bexi Yolanda

texts.es: La Sra. Bexi Yolanda G. tiene mas de 2 años de dedicarse a lo que es la venta de ropa y calzado, las ventas las realiza de forma ambulante, domiciliar y en centro de trabajos privados y estatales, ella tiene 4 hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela primaria del barrio en donde ella vive, con los ingresos que le genera este tipo de actividad le sirven para cubrir con los gastos familiares y cumplir con las obligaciones financieras, ella necesita el credito para comprar mas producto ya que ella esta pasando un tiempo dificil y necesita recuperarse.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bexi Yolanda G. has been selling clothing and footwear for more than two years. Sales are made by traveling to customers, to households and in private and public work centers. She has 4 children who are studying in the neighborhood primary school where she lives. Income earned from this activity is used to pay household bills and to meet financial obligations. She needs a loan to buy more products, as she going through a difficult time and needs to recover.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, footwear, skirts and blouses.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Irene K. from Mbeya. She is a widow with three children between the ages of 12 and 18. Irene has been running a grocery business since 2008. A grocery store is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to, to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient. Irene works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, seven days per week and currently earns about $120 a month. Irene is requesting a loan in order to purchase commodities in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Irene thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase commodities in bulk for her business

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric N. is married with two children. Raising pigs in Belo, Cameroon is his primary source of income. With this loan Eric will buy three piglets, five bags of feed, wooden fencing, and vaccinations for the pigs.

Eric believes that he will raise his pigs well because "I work with my wife." He also notes his plans to work hard so that he may earn the highest income. He knows that he has to be present in order to be successful.

This is Eric's second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2007. He used his last loan to tend to his pigs, as he will do with this loan. Eric takes out GHAPE loans because the conditions of GHAPE membership require you to pay back the loan in regular, small installments, which works well for Eric. With the profits from this loan, Eric will pay for his children's school fees, add a little to his business, and generally help his family to lead a better life.

About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy 3 piglets, pig feed, fencing and vaccinations.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Cataggaman Viejo is near Tuguegarao city proper. No wonder many of the residents here choose to operate tricycle transport for their livelihood. The family of Rosemarie is among the residents who depend on tricycle operation as their source of income. Her husband is the one who drives their tricycle.  

Rosemarie would like to borrow PHP12,000 from Kiva lenders for the maintenance of their motorcycle, including their license renewal. Rosemarie is 36 years old and married to Lamberto. They are blessed with three children who are studying in high school and the elementary level of education. Rosemarie hopes that through their humble business, they will someday send all their children to college.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Abdusharif

texts.ru: Саломов Абдушариф проживает в районе Шахринава. Возраст 53 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Абдушариф более 27 лет работал крановщиком. Вот как более 5 лет начал свой бизнес. Он занимается торговлей, продает детские игрушки. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Abdusharif S. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 53 years old, married and has 5 children. Abdusharif spent 27 years working as a crane operator. He started his own business just over 5 years ago. He sells children’s toys. He is requesting a loan to increase his goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Forty-nine-year-old Thelma O. is a rice grower. She manages a hectare (2.5 acres) of farmland that provides her family with all their needs. Aside from the farm that she has managed for years now, she is also starting a new business, which is pigs.

Because to start a business is a bit expensive, Thelma would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers for her farm and, for her pigs, two sacks of Lactatex feed and two sacks of Gestatex feed.

Thelma is active in the CEVI credit program. CEVI provides her with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Julia Inocenta

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Prosperidad.
Julia es casada, tiene 42 años y 5 hijos, Julia tiene una ferretería en un local alquilado en el distrito D. Carmen Alto, venD. materiales D. construcción, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus esposos e hijos.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cemento y tubos.
Los sueños D. Julia son mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Communal Bank “Prosperidad” (Prosperity). She is 42 years old, married, and has 5 children. Julia sells construction materials from her hardware store in the Carmen Alto district. Her husband and children help her with the business.

She needs a loan of 2000 soles to purchase cement and pipes. Julia dreams of improving her business and that her children pursue professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement and pipes

loans.name: Wanglei A Paculal Joyce Group

texts.en: Joyce P., 37, is married with four children, three of whom attend school, and she looks after three dependents that are schooling as well. In business for over ten years, Joyce sells both stationery and charcoal.  She is now requesting a loan to purchase stationery items and 50 bags of charcoal for sale in town. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to increase her stock and improve upon her stationery

loans.use: To purchase stationery items and charcoal (50 bags) mostly from far villages for sale in town

loans.name: Molortsetseg

texts.en:
Molortsetseg P. is 41 years old and the mother of three children. She currently resides with her husband and three children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her husband is a teacher in a local high school and her eldest daughter goes to a university in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her other two children are both high school students in Arhangai province.

Molortsetseg runs a small convenience store located in the town. She has been running this small convenience store for the last nine years and this business has been a major source of family income. She mostly sells food products including baked goods, soft-drinks, etc. Since starting the business in 2000, she has been doing pretty well and her business capital has expanded from 150,000 MNT to 400,000 MNT.

Molortsetseg says that her eldest daughter is in university and she would like to secure her tuition money with her business profit. She requests a loan to purchase more goods for her small business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana S. is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of Savalalo.  She is married and has 6 adult -aged children.  To make a living, Mariana owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Mariana has been engaged in this business for over 3 years.

Mariana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Mariana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1250 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  Mariana is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Mariana plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El microempresario Carlos Hernández García tiene 61 años de edad es casado con 7 hijos, todos estos ya han hecho su vida propia y viven en sus propios hogares. El conductor Hernández se dedica hace más de 30 años a la actividad de transporte selectivo conduciendo un taxi el cual es de su propiedad.

Este microempresario ya fue beneficiado con un crédito por parte de Kiva, el cual ya cancelo en tiempo y forma. Aprovecha a la vez para agradecer a los prestamistas que le solicitaron el crédito, ya que le fue de beneficio y pudo obtener algunos repuestos.

Sin embargo por las condiciones de las calles a estos  vehículos se les debe dar mantenimiento con bastante periodicidad y cambiarles algunos repuestos por lo que solicita se le financie para comprar lo siguiente:

1 Batería para carro a US$ 100, 2 amortiguadores delanteros a US$ 55 cada uno, 2 amortiguadores traseros a US$ 30 cada uno, 8 balineras para patente a US$ 8 cada uno, 2 aspirales delanteros a US$ 25 cada uno, 2 aspirales traseros a US$ 20, 1 alternador a US$ 120, 2 puntas flecha a US$ 20 cada una, 3 correas de alternador a US$ 8 cada una y 2 tijeras delanteras a US$ 46 cada una.
texts.en:
The small businessman Carlos is 61 years old, is married with 7 children all of whom have made their own lives and live in their own homes. Carlos is a driver who for more than 30 years has been working in personal transport, driving a taxi that he owns.

This small businessman has already benefited from a Kiva loan, which has already been paid back in a timely way. He takes advantage of this opportunity to thank the lenders who gave him that credit which was of benefit to him and enabled him to obtain some spare parts.

However, because of the condition of the streets, these vehicles have to be maintained quite often and parts need to be changed, so he requests financing to buy the following:

1 Car battery for $100

2 front shock absorbers at $55 each

2 reach shock absorbers at $30 each

8 bearings at $8 each

2 front coil springs at $25 each

2 back coil springs at $20 each

1 alternator for $120

2 axels at $20 each

3 alternator belts at $8 each and

2 front jacks at $46 each


Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Spare car parts

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer laboriosa de 41 años que ha sabido sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos: Anthony de 16, Lizeth de 10 y Johanna de 3 años, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. No ha sido fácil, pero lo ha logrado, y sola pues así vive muy feliz con ellos.

Ella se dedica a la asistir en diferentes eventos sociales durante los fines de semana, la contratan para apoyar en boletería, en la venta de recuerdos o para ayudar en la organización de las personas. Así pasa los fines de semana entre el bullicio de los shows, se gana honradamente la vida y está muy orgullosa de trabajar duro para mantener a sus hijos.
Yolanda dice que este negocio es muy rentable porque en los eventos pagan bien a las personas que colaboran en la producción, además ella es enfermera y también se dedica a su profesión durante los días útiles de la semana. 
Así es como ella se las ha ingeniado para mantener a sus hijos y darles una buena educación, para que en el fututo sean hombres de bien, ya que sabe que esa será la mejor herencia que les pueda dejar.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser responsable con sus pagos, ya que no le gusta tener deudas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita remodelará las habitaciones desocupadas que tiene en su casa, para alquilarlas y así obtener un ingreso adicional para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a hard-working 41 year old woman who has known how to get her three children ahead. Anthony is 16, Lizeth is 10, and Johanna is 3. She has worked with much effort and dedication. It has not been easy, but she has done it alone. She lives very happily with them. Her work is assisting at different social events during the week ends. They contract her to help in the ticket office, in selling mementos, or to help in the people’s organization. That is how she spends the week ends. She honorably earns a living among the excitement of the shows. She is very proud to work hard to support her children. Yolanda says that this business is very profitable because the people who collaborate in the production are well paid for the events. Also, she is a nurse. She works in this profession during the week days. This is how she figured out how to support her children and give them a good education. It is so that in the future they will become good people. She knows that this will be the best inheritance that she could leave them. This is her third loan with MFP. She promises to be responsible with her payments because she does not like to have debts. She will use the money that she is asking for to remodel the unoccupied rooms in her house to rent out. That way she will get an additional income for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel the unoccupied rooms in her house to rent out

loans.name: Swalehe

texts.en:
Swalehe M. is a small-businessman, married with three school children. He runs a business buying and selling music CDs at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases the business goods from the wholesale suppliers and sells retail to his customers. His business income helps him to pay his children’s school fees and to capitalizing his business.

Swalehe is requesting a loan of Tsh 800,000 to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Mohsen

texts.en: Mohsen is a 20-year-old single man living with his family. He has five years of experience in air-conditioning. He has owned a shop since 2004. Today he is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy a car to facilitate his business movements and satisfy the needs of customer, and increase his income.

loans.use: Buy a car for air-conditioning business

loans.name: Awo

texts.en: Awo is forty years of age. She is widowed and has given birth to two children who are both currently in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana. As a result, the occupation of the people is mainly farming. Awo is a trader in coconut cooking oil. She supplies to other retailers and food vendors in her community. Awo procures the oil from nearby towns. According to her, she has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy cooking oil in large quantities so she can supply to more customers.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil.

loans.name: Mukiibi

texts.en:
Ms. Mukiibi M. is married and blessed with five children of whom one child is still studying. She is a resident of Tank Hill Cell, Ruti, Mbarara.

Mukiibi is a businesswoman dealing in scrap (waste material) from the community. She is acquiring a loan to purchase more scrap to sell to the factory.

Mukiibi’s future hope is to look forward to opening a retail shop to generate more daily income.

loans.use: To purchase more scrap to sell

loans.name: Ulduza

texts.en: Ulduza B. is married and has 4 children. She is 45 years old. Ulduza is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, but is now settled in Absheron town, Masazir village. She has been in her business for 8 years. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 15 sheep.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Lidia Saraí

texts.es: Lidia Saraí G. R. de 19 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Morazán, vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad en casa alquilada. Lidia se dedica a elaborar hamacas, en variedad de colores y estilos, los cuales posteriormente sale a comercializar a las zonas de turismos del departamento de Morazán. Su trabajo es muy bien pagado, ya que los precios de las hamacas pueden ser algo costosos por ser elaborados a mano, a pesar de esto no es una venta muy constante, ya que no siempre se logra vender. Es por esto que Lidia, solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar por mayor, el hilo que se utiliza para hacer las hamacas, esto con el fin e poder obtenerlo a precios más bajos y así ofrecer las hamacas a menor costo. Lidia es una mujer muy constante en su trabajo quien desea poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que esto trae grandes beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Lidia Saraí G. R. is 19 years old and lives in the Morazán department along with her husband and two-year old son in a rented house. Lidia works making hammocks in a variety of colors and styles which she later sells in the tourist zones of the Morazán department. Her job is very well-paid since the hammocks can be somewhat expensive because they are handmade. Despite this, she does not have steady business and does not always manage to make sales. For this reason, Lidia is requesting a loan with the goal of being able to buy at wholesale the thread she uses to make the hammocks. This will allow her to get the thread at lower prices and offer the hammocks at lower prices. Lidia is a very persevering woman in her work and hopes to be able to improve her sales since this will bring great benefits to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread for making hammocks.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Ousmane  Cissé  est marié et âgée de 24 ans. Il vit chez son père dans une grande  famille traditionnelle avec sa mère et ses 5 frères dans le quartier Sébougou de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ousmane a abandonné l’école en classe de 8ème  année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour faire le commerce auprès de son grand frère qui tenait une boutique de vente d’articles divers. Après  2 années passées avec ce dernier, il maîtrise bien les rouages du commerce. Depuis maintenant trois ans, il mène seul son activité d’achat et de vente d’articles divers de boutique au quartier Angoulême. Sa boutique située auprès du   boulevard CAN 2002 est le lieu des affaires  par excellence à Ségou. 
Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce il a  fait recours à     Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est en relation  depuis 24 mois. Après 2  prêts individuels tous bien remboursés, il est à son 3ème prêt individuel qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, ½ tonne de sucres et 1 barrique d’huile alimentaire. 
Il s’approvisionne  à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes.
Monsieur  Ousmane  Cissé vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son père dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales. 
Son ambition est de diversifier ses activités en  ouvrir une station d’essence.
texts.en:
Mr. Ousmane Cissé is married and 24 years old. He lives in his father's house in a large traditional family with his mother and five brothers. This is in the Sébougou district of Ségou (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Ousmane left school in the eighth grade of elementary school (according to the Mali education system) to work with his older brother who had a shop selling various items. Having spent two years there, he had mastered the mechanics of business. For the past three years he has been carrying out his own business purchasing and selling a variety of items in a shop in the Angloulême neighborhood. His shop lies close to Boulevard CAN 2002, a strategic business area of Ségou. In order to increase his working capital, he turned to Soro Yiriwaso, and he has had relations with this company for the past 24 months. After two individual loans which were repaid without incident, he is on his third individual loan with which he plans to buy half a ton of sugar and a barrel of (edible) oil. He gets his supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers. Mr. Ousmane Cissé sells for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of men and women. He expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA. This profit will allow him to help his father cover the household expenses. His ambition is to diversify his activities and open a petrol station.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new tires and cement.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells local gin at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is a widow with three children. She sells for long hours to enable her to meet the basic needs of her family. She hopes for a loan of 80,000 nairas to purchase more local gin to sell. She hopes to expand her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more local gin to sell

loans.name: Tet

texts.en:
Mr. Tet T. is 55 years old, lives in Steung Sen commune, the province of Kompong Tom. He and his wife are local cultivators who work on their own farm field. They have 5 teenage children who are no longer in school. All of them are employed at different occupations and also provide their small income to contribute to their whole family.

In addition, Tet T. owns a generator and he provides a battery charging service for extra profit. Tet T. leads his charging service very well, which several day provides him with much income.

Unfortunately, the machine recently has broken and he may need to replace some problem parts. Because Tet T. doesn’t have enough money he decided to seek a loan to pay the fee for mending his old generator.

Tet T. is not in the picture because he was busy on that day so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To pay the fees to mend his old generator.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter operates a computer school and a cyber cafe where he provides Internet services to the public for a fee. He is 32 years old and unmarried. His business, which has been operational for two years, has really grown. This is because he has been saving his money with a group called Wangige Business Pioneers in Faulu, Kenya. Using his savings, he has been able to expand his business.  

He has requested a loan of Kes. 40,000 to purchase computers and printers and to expand the business premises. He hopes to start offering web design lessons and secure contracts to train at other schools. 

In ten years, he hopes to operate a fully established computer college.

loans.use: purchase computers and printers and to expand the business premises

loans.name: Souheil

texts.en:
Souheil is a 46 year old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He is married and has six children. He has been working as a concrete carpenter. He has sixteen years of experience in this field of work. Because of his extensive experience, he has a large number of customers. His clients are people from his region, and sometimes from his surroundings. His family has always been in big support for him, either by their financial help, or simply by encouraging him. He is planning to improve his work and expand his stock which he hopes will help him improve his financial situation. He is confident that this will help get him more projects.
