With the requested loan she will buy a larger quantity of beauty products and would like to increase her sales to generate more income, since her baby will be arriving soon.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise of beauty products

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr: Madame Georgette ANAYADRI a pour activité la vente de pagnes, elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2006 à Nukafu, son point d’approvisionnement est le grand marché de lomé. Elle veut agrandir son stock raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES son premier cycle de prêt qui lui permettrai d’acheter des pièces de pagnes de haute qualité. Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est  un conducteur de Taxi, avec le revenu qu’elle gagne de son commerce elle aide son mari dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer.
texts.en:
Ms. Georgette ANAYADRI works in the business of selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth). She has been in this business since 2006 in Nukafu. The grand marketplace of Lomé is where she acquires her supplies. She wants to expand her inventory, which is why she’s requesting her first loan from WAGES. This loan will enable her to buy bolts of high quality pagnes. She is married to a gentleman who is a taxi driver. With the revenues she earns from her commerce, she helps her husband with day-to-day household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagne cloth

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.es: El Sr. Isidoro S. G. tiene un pequeño taller de satreria hace 23 años, este opera bajo el nombre de Satreria S., su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion y es atendido por el y su esposa donde confeccionan ropa de varon y de damas para toda ocacion siendo una de las especialidades los pantalones y camisas de varon. el Sr. S. es muy conocido por su espiritu de superacion y conducta moral, honestidad, en este momento nos comento que este oficio le ha generado los ingresos en su hogar para poder sacar adelante a su familia dandoles estudio a sus hijos que hoy en dia son profesionales.
texts.en:
Mr. Isidoro S. G. has had a small tailor shop for 23 years which operates under the name of S. Tailor Shop. His business is located in his home and is run by him and his wife where they make clothing for men and women for all occasions. Their specialties are pants and shirts for men. Mr. S. is very well known for his spirit of self-improvement and his moral conduct and honesty. He told us that this profession has generated the income for his home to be able to move his family ahead, educating his children so that today they are professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and sewing accessories

loans.name: Hoàng Thị

texts.en:
Thuỷ Hoàng Thị makes a living primarily from raising cattle for sale. She is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xuong. She is married and has three adult children. Thuỷ has just started this business and earns approximately 500,000 VND a month.

In 2005, Thuỷ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her situation and enable her to engage in business activities. Thuỷ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. Thuỷ is now requesting a loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her fifth loan from TYM Fund. Thuỷ plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

No. 1434050976.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Hoyo Del Toro 1 Group

texts.en:
Hoyo del Toro is a small community on the side of the road to San Pedro de Macoris. Yicer A. (group coordinator) is married to Filiberto Heredia and they have 4 children. Yicer sells different kinds of food. Her best selling items are mabi (a Dominican drink made of boiled roots) and sorbet-like ice cream. With summertime approaching, she expects these sales to pick up, so Yicer will use this loan to buy fruit and plastic bags for the ice cream, and bottles for the mabi drink, along with the roots to make it. Yicer expects her sales to allow her to expand her business and make it into a cafeteria. Yicer wants to see her children choose a profession freely, graduate and have successful lives in the workforce. 

Please help us support Yicer's dream, along with the other entrepreneurs in this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase food items to sell more portions.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is engaged in a food vending business. The business has become a big help in supporting the education of her children. She is married to Romeo, who is a farmer, and they have nine children. One is already married, two are working and helping them earn a living, three are still in school, and some are still young. Having a big family is not that easy, Concepcion says, because it is accompanied by great responsibilities. 

She is thankful that she has been able to maintain her food vending business in their village. She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her request to borrow 7,000 PHP to further develop her business. Through the added capital, she will be able to increase her daily income, and she looks forward to being able to support the educational needs of all her children. Concepcion also dreams of expanding her business into a typical store in the future.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Salma M. from Mwanza. She is married, with five children between the ages of 5 and 11 years old.

Salma has been running a café business since 2008. Her business is called Café/Mama Lishe. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces.

Salma works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by two employees. She currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase potatoes and wheat flour. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Salma thanks you for your support!


About SELFINA: 
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes and wheat flour

loans.name: Yar Mohammad Group

texts.en:
Y. M. is the group leader of Y. M. group. There are five members in this group and each of them would like to receive money for their business. Therefore, they have requested a group loan of 50,000 Afghani. 

Y. M. wants to take a loan for his business as a taxi driver.

M. Hasham and Laylama want to take a loan for their general store businesses.

A. kafell wants to take a loan for his metal-shop business. He has just begun his business wants to develop it.

Zowjana wants to take a loan for her beading business.

They are very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan and thank AFSG and Kiva lenders around the world.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for his business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna S. is from Binuangan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married to Norberto and they have six children, all of whom are in school. She is a new member of PAGLAUM MULTI-PUPOSE COOPERATIVE. Myrna decided to join PMPC because of the loan facilities and other incentives for members. She reached MPC for her capital needs. She has applied for a PHP 3,000 loan to buy farm fertilizers. She deeply wishes that their family's living condition will improve and with a good farm harvest.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her farm

loans.name: Erick Otieno

texts.en:
Erick Otieno is thirty one years and married to Lilian. They have three children aged 7, 5 and 3. He runs a shoe selling business and is assisted by his wife. He's been in this business for the last three years. Erick buys shoes from vendors in Nairobi and sells them for a profit in Migori, a populous town.

Erick learned about KADET Ltd from a friend who is an existing client. This is his first loan. He is excited about the loan and has ambitions to grow the scale of his business. He intends to use the loan to increase stock in readiness for the school re-opening and the approaching festive season, when he expects to make great sales.

He harbors a dream to expand his business and start importing expensive shoes, thereby changing his target market and profits.

------------ About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Increase stock of shoes.

loans.name: Soronzonbold

texts.en:
Soronzonbold Banzrach is a 43-year-old man and lives with his wife and 18-year-old daughter. He currently lives with his family in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. This is Soronzonbold's second Kiva loan. He took his first Kiva loan to purchase spare parts for his truck. But he needed more funds to repair his truck engine and other parts. Thus he is requesting a greater loan. He is a XacBank (Kiva's partner Microfinance institution) repeat client.

Soronzonbold has been in the trucking business since 1998. He owns an old Russian truck that he uses for carrying freight between his city and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family is very supportive of his business and helps whenever he needs some help.

Soronzonbold says that he works hard to make sure that his daughter receives good education without any financial strain. Further, he dreams of exchanging his old truck for a new, powerful one.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his truck

loans.name: José Mauricio

texts.es: José Mauricio V. A. reside en la capital de El Salvador. José tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su esposa, sus tres hijos, una sobrina y su madre. José lleva consigo una gran responsabilidad al velar por el bienestar y estabilidad económica de su familia, el se dedica a su negocio, una panadería que surte a muchas tiendas de los alrededores y colonias cercanas, José necesita de su automóvil para movilizar con eficiencia sus productos a sus clientes, el crédito que solicita es para su carro; ya que la caja de velocidades se ha arruinado y necesita cambiarla.

loans.use: Reparacion de su automovil

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es:
Ludith tiene 55 años, es una mujer muy amable y alegre, vive en su cada propia, es soltera y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.

La vida de Ludith ha sido muy difícil, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar mucho para poder mantenerse. Con el tiempo, su arduo trabajo dio frutos y poco a poco pudo construir una casa con un patio enorme, el cual ahora ha convertido en una cochera donde guarda los carros de sus vecinos y en este negocio le va muy bien, ya que por día guarda cerca de 20 carros.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que dispone de tiempo para realizar sus tareas domesticas, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse en la madrugada para atender a algunos de sus clientes que desean guardar su carro. 

Para más adelante, Ludith anhela poner una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le brinde mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los mil quinientos soles que ahora solicita planea arreglar su cochera para brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ludith is a kind, cheerful, single, 55-year-old woman who lives in her own home and more than anything else wishes to have a peaceful old age. Ludith's life has been very difficult since she has had to work to support herself from a very early age. With time, her hard work yielded some benefits and little by little she was able to build her house with a large yard which she has now turned into a car port where she lets her neighbors store their cars. This is a profitable business for her since she can store nearly 20 cars daily. She has been doing this for 8 years and what she most likes about her job is that it allows her time to do her domestic chores and believes that the most difficult aspect of it is having to get up at dawn sometimes to attend to some of her customers who wish to store their car. In the future, Ludith would love to have a grocery store which would produce better income. This is her second loan with MFP and she expects to repay it on time since she doesn't want to cause the other members of the communal bank any problems where whe is held in high regard thanks to the discipline she imposes on the group. With the 1,500 soles she requests she plans to improve her car port so as to provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her car port.

loans.name: Vianca Vanessa

texts.es: Vianca es una mujer colaboradora y alegre, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 24 años y es madre de un menor, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, pues cuenta con una bodega que funciona en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es jefe de almacén de una tienda de repuestos. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “La Lupuna”, desde hace 3 años, el primer préstamo fue de 300 soles que  utilizó para invertir en productos para su bodega, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1500 soles que será utilizado para comprar productos de abarrotes y bebidas para  vender en su bodega. La meta de Vianca es tener una distribuidora de gaseosas.
texts.en:
Vianca, 24, is a cheerful, cooperative woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She has one child and sells groceries from a store that she has set up in her home. Her husband, who is the warehouse manager at a replacement parts store, supports her. She has been a member of the "La Lupuna" communal bank for the past 3 years. Her first 300 sol loan was used to buy inventory for her store and she needs a 1500 sol loan to buy more inventory items, groceries and beverages, to sell. Vianca's goal is to be a soft-drink distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and beverages.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace L. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and maize flour and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.  Grace is 25 years old and is married.  Her husband is a car driver. They have two children who attend school.  With the extra profits she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

About BRAC:
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Muyumbu Kagara Provia Group

texts.en: K. Provia, who represents her group, is 48 years old and married with 14 children, all of whom attend school. She also has two other dependents who are in school. K. Provia is a farmer and she has been a farmer for over 28 years. She is using the loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and so forth, for planting. She is hardworking and active. Her dream is to educate her children and improve upon her farming.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farming supplies

loans.name: Jose Alfonso

texts.es:
José P. de 27 años de edad, vive en el sector de la Perimetral de Guayaquil,  cuenta en su vivienda con agua, alcantarillado, luz y caminos pavimentados su casa es de ladrillos pero quiere seguir construyéndola, José se dedico a la venta de víveres hace ya muchos años atrás ya que vio que todos sus familiares han tenido negocios similares y han sido prosperados e independientes y el decidió que fuera igual su futuro.

Ahora José trabaja en su tienda desde las 06h00 hasta las 21h00 de lunes a domingo, comprar arroz a $ 0.25 la libra y la vende a $ 0.30, colas a $ 0.28 y las vende a $ 0.35 c/u y aceites a $ 1.80 y los vende a $ 2.20 c/u una de las mayores dificultades es la delincuencia ya que no dejan que la tienda prospere, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio a veces pero para sacar mas ingresos para su familia ella se dedica a la venta de legumbres, no tienen hijos porque primero quieren asegurar su futuro.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz a $ 25.00 cada quintal, aceites a $ 22.00 cada caja y colas a $ 8.50 cada jaba, en el futuro poner otro local y seguir con su  negocio para poder asegurar el futuro de su familia y terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
José P. is 27 years old and lives in the area surrounding Guayaquil. He has water, sewage, and electricity at his home, and a paved road in front of it. His house is made of brick but he would like to continue building it. José started selling produce a long time ago after seeing all of his relatives prosper and become independent with similar businesses. José decided he wanted the same future. Today, José works at his store from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. seven days a week. He buys rice at $0.25 a Lb. and sells it at $0.30; soft drinks at $0.28 and sells them at $0.35 each; and oils at $1.80 and sells them at $2.20 each. One of the biggest problems is crime, which impedes the store from getting ahead. Sometimes, José's wife helps out with the business, but to help increase the family income, she sells vegetables. They don't have any kids because they want to have a secure future first. With the loan he is requesting, José wants to buy rice at $25.00 per "quintal" (46 Kg); oils at $22.00 per box; and soft drinks at $8.50 per crate. He would like to start another store and continue with his business to ensure a good future for his family and to finish building his house.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice, soft drinks, and oils

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is thirty-six years old, is single, and has no child. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a commercially dominated community. She is a hardworking young woman.

Comfort is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves). She hawks to sell (goes door-to-door) and also sells by the roadside in her community.

Comfort procures bags of maize (corn) and other ingredients from nearby communities. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure maize in bulk.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy K. is a businesswoman. She is 45 years old. She owns a retail shop and has worked in this business for over three years. She is using the loan to purchase retail items such as soap, rice, maize flour, sugar, sweets, bread, drinks like soda, milk, water, and so forth to meet her clients’ demands. Her future dream is expanding her shop to wholesale.

loans.use: Purchase retail items such as soap, rice, maize flour, sugar, sweets, bread, drinks like soda, milk, water, etc.

loans.name: Elsy Guadalupe

texts.es: Elsy Guadalupe V. D. L. D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en Ilopango, departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Elsy posee una tienda D. productos perecederos en su propia casa D. habitación, negocio en el cual se encarga D. comercializar productos D. primera necesidad. Este negocio nació con la esperanza D. poder obtener ganancias extras, a través D. las cuales fuera posible brindarle estudios a sus hijos y así mismo una vida mejor. Elsy solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos perecederos, aumentado la cantidad D. los que ya posee y obteniendo nuevos, D. esta manera ella podrá obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales sean D. gran beneficio para sus hijos y para todo su hogar, ya que será posible contar con una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Elsy Guadalupe V. D. L., age 42, lives in Ilopango in the San Salvador department. She lives with her husband and two children. The children go to school. Elsy has a store, which carries perishable products, in her own house. She sells basic needs products. This business was born with the hope of being able to get extra income to give her children an education and a better life. Elsy is asking for a loan to be able to buy a larger quantity of perishable products. That will increase the quantity that she has and add new products. That way she will be able to get greater earnings, which will be of great benefit to her children and the whole household. It will then be possible to have economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perishable products

loans.name: Ta Marr Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Ta Marr' group from the township of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesswomen who have applied for a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders of SLL 500,000 for each person in order to expand their businesses in size and quality. 

Forty-five-year-old Kumba T. is the leader and head of this group of entrepreneur. Born in Magburaka town, she is married to a subsistence farmer and they have 6 children. Two of her children are already married and 4 are attending secondary school. For many years now, Kumba has been selling chains, earrings, and cosmetics. With her share of the loan, she will invest in jewelry and cosmetics. 

(On the right in the photo is Loan Officer, Abdul Karim C., handing over the loan during disbursement.)

loans.use: Buy jewelry and cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of corn

loans.name: Amida

texts.en: Amida A. is 27 years old. She was born in Sokodé, in the center of Togo and now lives in the Agoé district of Lomé. She is married to a technician and has one child. Mrs. A. purchases grocery products from the Grand Marché in Lomé, and then sells the products outside of her home. She began this business in 2006 and is now requesting her first loan from WAGES. She will use this loan to purchase two sacks of rice, two boxes of powdered milk, and dried gombo, a fruit used in a popular Togolese dish served with smoked fish.

loans.use: To purchase rice, powdered milk, and local fruit

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn O. is from the village of Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old. Marilyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie E. is from the village of Omonay, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Norie is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Norie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Norie has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Norie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Norie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Norie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Alto chijini de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja en una empresa pública como secretaria.

 El crédito que solicita es para pagar la consulta médica de su señor padre el cual esta enfermo y no cuenta con seguro medico.

Es la primerva vez que solicta crédito en Impro y  por el carácter social del mismo, Lourdes puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Lourdes lives in her parents' home in the Alto Chijini area of the city of La Paz; she works in a public company as a secretary. She is seeking a loan to pay for medical help for her elderly father who is sick and has no health insurance. This is the first time she is seeking a loan through Impro, and due to her social character, Lourdes should receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical consultation and medicine for her father who has no health insurance

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Collana Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Santa de Rosa de Collana”, actualmente se encuentra en el VI ciclo y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. El banco comunal está representado por los socios; Erika Maritza es la presidenta, Florencia es la secretaria, Jeannete es la tesorera y Deivis es la fiscal. Los socios se reúnen cada treinta días en la comunidad de Collana del distrito de San Jerónimo del departamento de Cusco. 
       
Las actividades económicas de los algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo, venta de comestibles, venta de anticuchos, elaboración de bordados y estandartes, venta de chicha, cerveza y gaseosas, venta de comida, crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas y cuyes. Otros socios brindan servicio de taxi y sastrería. 

Remigia, tiene 47 años, tiene seis hijos y vive en la comunidad de Collana. 

Remigia nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Santa de Rosa de Collana”  somos 13 integrantes y me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Su actividad económica principal de la señora Mercedes es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas, ella tiene un pequeño corral donde tiene 75 cuyes y varias gallinas que se encuentra en su domicilio. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Su actividad económica complementaria es la agricultura, ella alquila un terreno para sembrar papa, maíz y otros productos más. Remigia requiere el préstamo para comprar alimento para los animales como por ejemplo forraje y también va comprar pollitos para criar.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa de Collana community bank is currently in its sixth loan cycle. It is made up of hardworking and enterprising people who are always seeking opportunities to get ahead in life, and to provide their children with a brighter future by working hard every day. The following people are members of the community bank: Erika Maritza is the president, Florencia is the secretary, Jeannete is the treasurer and Deivis is the auditor. The members get together every month in the community of Collana, San Jerónimo district, in Cusco department. Members have jobs in different fields. For example, some sell food, some sell anticuchos (Peruvian kebab); others do embroidery or make banners. Some sell chicha (drink made from corn), beer, and soft drinks; others raise animals such as chickens or guinea pigs. Some members drive a taxi or are seamstresses. 47-year old Remiga has six children and lives in the community of Collana. She tells us: “In the Santa Rosa de Collana community bank, there are thirteen of us. They chose me as their representative to give information about my work." Her main job is raising animals like guinea pigs and chickens. She has a small pen in her house in which she keeps 75 guinea pigs and several chickens. She’s had this business for two years and it’s doing well. Remiga also does some farming. She rents a piece of land and grows potatoes, corn, and other produce. Remiga needs a loan to buy food such as fodder for the animals and also young chickens to raise.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy animal food

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita B. is from the village of Campo 4, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 56 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Anita owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Anita has been involved in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Anita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the third loan taken out by Anita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma A. is from the village of Tumbao, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 52 years old. Vilma is married and has three school-aged children. Vilma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Vilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Vilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Meissa

texts.fr:
Voilà 15 ans que Monsieur Meissa D. fait du commerce après une courte expérience d’apprenti chauffeur. La vente de mil, arachide ou de niébé l’intéresse le plus et il les place en gros à ses clients. 
Agé de 44 ans, Monsieur D. est à sa deuxième demande de crédit et sollicitait 250 000 FCFA pour compléter son approvisionnement.
texts.en:
Mr. Meissa D. has been is sales for 15 years after a brief stint as an apprentice driver. He focuses primarily on millet, peanuts, and black-eyed peas, which he often sells to his customers in bulk. This is the second loan application for Mr. D., age 44. He is seeking a credit of 250,000F CFA to supplement his stocks.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock up on supplies

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James T. is a fifty-year-old teacher as well as a businessman. He is married to a teacher with five children: two are in primary school and the other three are in secondary school.

James established a bar business three years back when he noticed that he needed another source of income to support his family. His bar is located in Njai Town, Bo. His college teachers and other people in the Njai town community spend their leisure time in his bar, particularly in the evening.

James has a good loan repayment history. He needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL so that he can fully stock his bar as he has more customers now, including his colleague teachers who love to spend more time at the bar.

James believe that the proceeds from this loan will help him provide livelihood for his family, educate his children and enable him to start to building a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for his bar

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie R. is from the village of Centro Sur, Alcala, Cagayan. She is 58 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. Tessie owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Tessie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Tessie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 57 year old widowed woman and mother of one child.  She works selling coffee in a nearby school. Siham started this work in 1995, after her husband’s death, in order to raise her only daughter and to insure a secure life. Siham is proud of herself and of what she achieved until now

This is her sixth loan with Al Majmoua and she’s requesting a loan in order to buy necessary merchandise for her business. She hopes to open a coffee shop in the future as she likes this business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
La señora Juana A. García tiene sesenta y cinco años, vive en Santa Catarina Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor Esteban Reyes López, en total tuvo diez hijos quienes todos ya están casados, en su poder tiene a una nieta de nueve años Lithiel Reyes Hernández que cursa  el cuarto grado en la primaria.

    Ella  se dedica a la venta de quesos desde hace diesi ocho años  y  otros productos como son: pinol blanco elaborado de maíz, plátano, hoja de plátano para tamales entre otros, lo cual comenta que la va muy bien con esta actividad y que la asacado de apuros con los gastos de su hogar.

    Su inspiración por este tipo de trabajo, comenzó cuando Hera muy joven ya que ayudaba a su mama a vender en el mercado y cuando se cado dejo de practicarlo, pero cuando se vio en la necesidad comenzó de nuevo y gracias a dios le ha dado buen resultado.

    Con las ganancias que obtiene de su venta, se surte de nuevo para obtener mejores ingresos cada día y para que su clientela adquiera lo que busca para su hogar.

   Su seño es tener trabajo mientras dios le preste  vida  y a horrar para apoyar a su nieta a que termine una carrera y tenga buenos inicios en  la vida, teniendo un buen trabajo para que pueda Salir adelante siendo independiente.

  Juana formo el grupo con sus con pañera ya que le intereso mucho como se trabaja en el programa y se animaron a pertenecer a dicho grupo llamado santa María la razón del nombres por que donde se ubica el grupo se llama santa María.

   Las personas que integran en el grupo son la siguiente:
Juana A. García: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de quesos, como también frutas para venderlo en el mercado.

   Amparo Villarreal M.: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de quesos, como  también compra frutas para venderlo en la misma región.

   Aurora Sánchez C.: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de carnes variadas, viceras para venderlo en l misma región.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana A. García is 65 years old. She lives in Santa Catarina, Copainala municipality, Chiapas state, México. She is married to Mr. Esteban Reyes López. She had a total of 10 children who are all married now. She has a nine year old granddaughter, Lithiel Reyes Hernández, in her care who is in fourth grade. She has sold cheese for the last 18 years. She also sells other products like: white pinol (a drink made from corn), bananas, banana leaves for tamales, among others. She tells us that she does quite well in this work since it has solved many difficulties regarding household expenses. Her inspiration for this kind of work started when she was quite young for she helped her mother sell in the market. When she married she stopped doing but when she found herself in need she started up again and thanks to God it has had good results. With profits from her sales she stocks up again to earn daily income and so that her customers can find what they are seeking for their homes. Her dream is to have work while God gives her life and to save to support her granddaughter until she finishes a career and has a good start in life, having a good job that she can go forward with and be independent. Juana formed the group with her fellow members because she was very interested in the way the program works and they were encouraged to belong to the group called Santa María, so called because that’s the name of the place it’s located in. The group members are: Juana A. García who will use the loan to buy and sell cheeses as well as fruits in the market; Amparo Villarreal M. who will use the loan to buy and sell cheeses as well as fruits to sell in the same region and Aurora Sánchez C. who will use the loan to buy assorted meats and offal to sell in the same region.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk for cheese making as well as to buy regional products like: banana leaves and chayote, among others.

loans.name: Seidy

texts.es: Seidy tiene la edad de 37 años, es casada, y tiene trés hijos de 10, 15, y 18 de edad. Ella quiere comprar cerdos para el engorde. Ya cuenta con un local adecuado para el engorde de los lechones. Está el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Ella espera de tener más ingresos para invertir y con las ganacias brindarle a sus hijos una mayor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Seidy, 37, is married and has three children who are 10, 15 and 18 years of age.  She wants to buy pigs to raise.  She already has a site that is adequate for piglet raising.

This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the terms offered.  She hopes to have more income to invest and to use the profits to provide her children with better economic stability.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Tas-Wop N' Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Isatu K. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born 45 years ago in one of the villages that makes up Sanda, Isatu is married and has four children.  For many years now, Isatu has been selling palm oil (the favorite cooking oil), vegetable oil, fish, etc.  Isatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business. She will buy palm oil, vegetable oil and fish in large quantity. 

This is not the first loan that Isatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this new loan however, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower, Fatu K., who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy palm oil, vegetable oil and fish in large quantity

loans.name: La Loma De San Juan Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama La Loma de San Juan porque  la casa  de reunión se realiza en una loma en la localidad de san Juan,  el grupo está formado por 11 personas.La señora rosa Hernández  es casada tiene tres hijos, es la presidenta del grupo, la actividad a la que se dedica es la siembra de maíz, lo ocupa hasta que está convertido en mazorca listo para nixtamal, posteriormente elabora tortillas de comal, menciona que tiene a sus clientes por lo que la mitad de sus ventas son puros pedidos, así mismo tiene un puesto colocado en una población cercana a su casa. También se dedica a la siembra de frijol, lo desenvaina y lo vende por medios kilos. La clienta nos comenta que con las ganancias de la venta de sus tortillas y el frijol espera seguir ayudando a su esposo para darle escuela a sus hijos y sean personas de provecho.
texts.en: This group is called the Hill of San Juan because they meet on a hill in the town of San Juan.  The group is made up of 11 people.  Rosa Hernández is married and has three children.  She is the president of the group and grows corn.  When they are ready, the ears of corn are treated with lime, and are then used to make tortillas on a griddle.  She has customers, and half of her sales are orders.  She also has a stand located in a town near her house.  In addition, she grows beans, shells them, and sells them by the half kilo.  She tells us that with the earnings from the sale of her tortillas and beans she hopes to continue to help her husband give their children an education so they will be successful.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 30 years old. She is married and has four children who are between three and ten years old. All her children are enrolled in school except the youngest. Her husband works as a stonemason. Jeanne has a restaurant business. She has been doing this business for a period of five years. 

Jeanne would like to get a loan to purchase more utensils and other food and beverages to sell. With the profit from the business, she would like to establish a new business of tailoring because she is qualified in that field. Her business helped a great deal as she has managed to raise enough to help with construction.

loans.use: To buy more food and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita L., 57, is married and her family lives in the town of Sta. Josefa.  To make a living, she raises crops, mostly rice.

Lolita joined CEVI to access financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. 

Lolita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP  to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rhodah

texts.en:
Rhoda is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transport.

She has operated a clothes selling business going door to door, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Rhoda faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and become a wholesaler of clothes.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of no harassments of clients.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel  tiene la edad de 42 años, casado con una familia de cuatro hijos, trabaja a una empresa privada como técnico en mantenimiento desde hace siete años, en donde ha venido mejorando la infraestructura de su casa. 
Cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposa ya que labora como maestra de primaria. 
Hoy mediante el financiamiento es para poder terminar de cerrar todo el techo de su casa, comprara ventana y puerta ya que solo las tiene con verjas lo que le es de gran relevancia poder tener en mejores condiciones de privacidad a su familia. Lo que comprara láminas de zinc, golosos, ventana y puertas hechas para cerrar.
texts.en:
Manuel is 42 years old, married and has four children.  He works in a private company as a maintenance technician.  He has been in this job for seven years and, over this time, he has been improving the infrastructure of his home.

Manuel has the financial support of his wife who works as an elementary school teacher.  He is requesting this loan so that he can finish off the roof of his house and buy a window and door since he only has iron grilles right now. This would help to improve his family's privacy.  He will buy sheets of corrugated metal, bolts, a window and a door so that he can close up his house.

loans.use: To buy sheets of corrugated metal, a door and a window so that he can finish closing up his house

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is 63 years old, married to a midwife and has 10 children, all of whom live in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is known for being very hard working and has made a living for the last 40 years by raising animals and selling milk. He has earned enough money to educate six of his children, and would like to improve his prospects further by setting up a ranch. He has applied for this loan to buy a cow to raise and breed.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise and breed.

loans.name: Sonanet

texts.en:
Mrs. Sonanet U. is 48 years old. Her husband, Mr. Vanthan MoU., is 56 years old. They live together on an island of the Mekong River, approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1982 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. 

Sonanet has been a weaver since she was eighteen years old. She sells her finished products to a retailer who then in turn sells them in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a construction worker. 

She is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase weaving materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elvira Pérez Hernández, vive en Chicoasen Estado de Chiapas México, es casada  y tiene dos hijos a su responsabilidad, quienes son: Kevin Jasiel de trece años y la más pequeña es Martha Eunice de once años de edad.


        El préstamo que ha estado solicitando para invertir en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, en donde lleva ocho años y comenta que le va bien ya que le ha dejado buenos ingresos en su hogar.


        Con esta actividad  y inicio por el ánimo de sus suegra ya que ella era la que tenia este tipo de negocio, pero luego decidió vender verduras  y se lo dejo a su nuera para que se apoye con sus gastos  de sus familia.


       Con las ganancias que va obteniendo lo invierte en la compra de más mercancía, para que se vea  mejor surtida y sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan  comprar, y mejor sea su ganancia en su actividad.


        Lo que  desea es lograr ahorrar para que  ha sí logre aumentar más su negocio, como también de eso mismo obtener para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos que están estudiando.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira Pérez Hernández lives in Chicoasen in the state of Chiapas, México.  She is married and has 2 children in her care, who are: Kevin Jasiel, 13, and Martha Eunice, 11.

The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store, which she has had for 8 years.  She comments that the business is going very well, as it has provided a good income for her household.

Her mother-in-law, who had a grocery store, encouraged her to work in the business. Later, her mother-in-law decided to sell vegetables and left the business to Rosa so that she could help support her family.

With the earnings that she is getting she invests in the purchase of more merchandise, so that she can better stock her store and so her customers can find what they are looking to buy.  In this way she can improve her profits.  What she wants is to be able to save so that she can manage to expand her business, and so that she can provide for her two children, who are in school.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Morng

texts.en: Morng S., age 31, owns a small kiosk where she sells meat, shampoo, soft drinks and food in her village in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She typically makes around 5 USD in profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable life. She has a life partner in her husband who is a car taxi driver at the local factory. He has an income about 5 USD each day and shares responsibility with Morng S. to support the whole family. She now has two school-aged kids, both of whom attend school. She will use her first loan to buy a tractor for her husband to dig land. This loan is going to improve the whole family with additional assets, and earning more profit.

loans.use: To buy a tractor

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma E. is from the village of Tambo, Iligan City. She is 42 years old. Salma is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Salma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & beverages in the local community. Salma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Salma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Salma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Salma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Salma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods & snack foods.

location.town: Tambo, Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 40 years old and married with four children. Two of her children attend school. Mary is currently in the business of selling soft drinks and is requesting a loan to stock more soft drinks. In the future, Mary hopes to construct a house with the profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
A product line that never ceases to gain regular customers is one that serves the food market. Sarah M., 62, banks on this fact and runs a food micro-enterprise. Sarah is married to Wilfredo, a driver, and together they have raised children who are now in college. Sarah is out to prove that having finished only three years of high school does not limit her in business.

At present, Sarah runs a food stall, called a "carinderia", in the Philippines. The carinderia is annexed to their house, so she is able to manage both the household chores and the daily routines in the carinderia. This business of hers has been running for 15 years now, and with the diligence she puts into her work and the quality training and spiritual support she receives from CCT*, Sarah manages to earn Php 15,000 net income every month. She has one employee hired to help her with the daily tasks in her carinderia.

Because Sarah aims to serve nothing but quality food to her customers, she decided to borrow Php 10,000 to better finance her business. She intends to use this loan money to purchase meat products, vegetables, and other nutritious ingredients to come up with daily sumptuous meals. With this loan, Sarah is also equipped to meet the daily needs of her family and pay for the tuition fees of her children.

One challenge Sarah faces is the competition she has in the community, since there are not a few business-minded people like her who have set up food stalls in the vicinity. But Sarah is not going to give up the fight. She holds on to the hope of making her business grow, so that she may be able to finance the education of her children up to college and take care of the family's health.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: purchase of daily ingredients and condiments.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem lives in an industrial city of Pakistan known as Faisalabad. She has been living in the area of Dhanona in a two-room brick house for the past 25 years. She is 35 years old, married to M. A. and has two sons and two daughters. None of the children has attended school (except the eldest one, who studied 'til 10th) due to the poor financial conditions of Naseem and her family. Now that son operates a timber selling business while the others stay at home. Her son’s business is going well because most of his clients live in areas where gas is not available and they use wood for cooking food. 

Naseem's husband runs a construction supplies business. He makes deals with different construction companies and individuals and makes profit by fulfilling their orders. 

Naseem is a housewife. She spends most of her time at home and carries out her household responsibilities. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her son's business. With the loan, he will buy timber in bulk quantity that will help him fulfill the demand of his clients and make extra income. Naseem is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for her son. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Naseem.

loans.use: to buy timber for a timber selling business.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine M. N. is 40 years old and has two children, 4 and 14 years old. He and his wife hope to give their children good education to the university level. Justine's business is located in Thika, a region in Kenya known for pineapple production.

Justine has been selling brake fluid, brake pads, clutches, corner lights and headlights to minibus, truck and car owners in Thika for two years and he says that this business is profitable. The major challenges he faces are financial constraints and lack of proper business management skills. However, he works very hard to keep his business going well. He is using this loan of KES 20,000 to buy brake fluid and brake pads to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. In the future, he hopes to open a big auto spare parts store in Thika. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to buy brake fluid, brake pads, etc.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: La Sra. Alejandrina tiene su casa en la zona D. Tutimayu,  D. la localidad D. Sacaba Cochabamba, tiene un hijo  su esposo es agricultor, su hijo se encarga D. ayudar al Papa, ella realiza la venta D. chicharrón solo los días domingos en un puesto alquilado que se encuentra sobre una avenida, Los Sábados se levanta desD. tempranas horas D. la mañana  para ir a comprar carne y ya la prepara para elaborar el riquísimo chicharrón el día domingo,  tiene muy buenas ventas ya que la Sra. Alejandrina es muy conocida por la buena elaboración del chicharrón por la calidad del preparado, el préstamo lo invertirá para la compra D. material D. construcción para hacer construir un  cuarto en la casa para a si brindar mayor comodidad a su hijo, es una persona muy trabajadora y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Alejandrina lives in the town of Sacaba, in Tutimayu region, in Cochabamba.  She has one child (a son) and her husband is a farmer.  Her son helps his dad and Alejandrina sells 'chicharrón' (fried pork rinds) every Sunday from a stall that she rents on an avenue.  On Saturdays she gets up early in the morning to go and buy meat and prepare it for making her delicious 'chicharrón' on Sunday.  She makes good sales since she is very well known for the quality of the 'chicharrón' that she prepares.

Alejandrina will invest her loan in buying construction supplies so that she can build another room in her house and make her son more comfortable.  Alejandrina is a very hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support that they have given her.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo hombre de 45 años casado y con  2 hijos en las edades de 21 y 22 años, tiene un negocio de venta en mayor cuantía de lácteos y víveres que distribuye entre muchos clientes que a su vez venden al detal. Él compra de contado buscando entre sus proveedores los mejores precios, para poder ofrecer sus productos en condiciones competitivas y su negociación sea: yo gano tus ganas. Su negocio inició cuando él y su esposa vivían en otro país y  enviaba estos productos a una familiar y de allí aprendió mucho, primero lo hacía entre unos pocos clientes y ahora tiene un local como punto comercial con muchos más clientes.  Para Gustavo negociar con víveres y queso se convirtió en el sustento de su familia, su actividad es el principal ingreso y por eso tiene como meta hacerla crecer para cumplir sus sueños de lograr cada día mayor bienestar para su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante su credikiva y con el surtirá su negocio comprando en mayor volumen, queso,víveres, pollo y verduras, para continuar ofreciendo un servicio de excelencia y productos con muy buenos precios.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a 45 year old man, married with 2 children aged 21 and 22. He owns a business selling dairy and food products wholesale, which we distributes to his many customers who in turn retail them. He buys the goods in cash, looking for the best prices amongst his suppliers, so as to be able to sell his goods in competitive conditions and under a win-win premise. 

He started his business when he and his wife lived abroad. He used to send this kind of products to a relative and that's how he learned a lot about the business. He initially had few clients and now he has many more, as well as business premises. Trading with food and cheese is supporting Gustavo's family. His business is the main source of income and that's why his goal is to grown it so he can fulfil his dream of providing his family with a better quality of live. 

This is his first loan application for a Kiva loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With it he will stock up and buy cheese, food, chicken and vegetables for his business in larger quantities, so as to continue to provide an excellent service and products at very good prices.

loans.use: to buy cheese, food, chicken and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor, 29, is married and has three children who attend school.  For two years, he has been operating a retail shop.  He was previously employed in an industry.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable because he has managed to improve his business. He dreams of venturing into more business in the future so as to generate more income.  He has requested 15, 000 Kenyan shillings to open another retail shop.

loans.use: To open another retail shop

loans.name: Oty Katty

texts.es:
La señora Oty es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000 del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Lleva muy poco tiempo como socia de Manuela Ramos, pero tiene todas las ganas de querer trabajar  y salir adelante por ese motivo ahora ha tenido la idea de poner una tienda de comestibles (bodega).

Con su nuevo préstamo S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 estante de madera, 2 mesas, 8 sillas, 2 docenas de escobas, 1 docena de recogedores, 3 paquetes de agua mineral, 2 paquetes de gaseosa.
Su esposo es de profesión administrador y es quien le da las pautas de cómo manejar su negocio.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo brindado.  Gracias a los préstamos ha podido hacer realidad uno de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Oty is a member of the 'Mujeres del 2000' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 23 years old, married, and has one child.  She has not been a member of Manuela Ramos for very long but she has a great desire to work and get ahead in life.  For this reason, she decided to set up a grocery store.

Oty will use her loan for 1,700 Peruvian soles to buy: 1 wooden shelf, 2 tables, 8 chairs, 2 dozen brooms, 1 dozen dustpans, 3 packets of mineral water and 2 packets of soda.

Oty's husband is an administrator by profession and he provides her with guidance on how to run her business.

Oty is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the support they have provided.  Thanks to their loans, she has been able to make one of her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy a wooden shelf, tables, mineral water, etc.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, aged 40, is married and blessed with six children. He does farming, mainly tea growing and dairy keeping, which he has been doing for four years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 30,000.

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the loan funds to buy a dairy cow for milk production. He intends to use the expected profits to educate his children and hopes to be a renowned farmer in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Erdenetsooj

texts.en:
Erdenetsooj, age 45, lives with her family in a ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent) in the outer ger districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a construction worker at a local company while her son works at a cashmere manufacturing company. Her 4-year-old daughter attends kindergarten.
 
Erdenetsooj has been operating a cooperative felt-manufacturing business since 2006 with 24 partners. They produce pure felt out of raw felt by themselves; hence the products are completely handmade and qualified. They make various products such as baby boots, slippers, hats, blouses etc., and sell them to the local souvenir shops in Ulaanbaatar. 

Erdenetsooj is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy raw materials with the intention to increase production before the end of this summer since large numbers of tourists interested in Mongolian felt and cashmere products. 

She is working hard to achieve her goal which is to expand her business by opening several branches around the city.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to increase sales

loans.name: Ivania Isabel

texts.es:
Ivania de 29 años de edad, vive en Chacaraseca una comunidad de León, esta casada, es madre de tres hijos, es comerciante, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, lleva 6 años dedicándose a este negocio. Inicio a los 23 años de edad con el apoyo de su esposo quien le enseño a como criar y vender cerdos este negocio lo tienen en su finca , cuando obtuvo su primer ganancia ella compro una manzana de tierra mas para utilizarla como terreno de siembra . 
Solicita el préstamo para  comprar cerdos de desarrollo y componer el establo para los cerdos. Con esta inversión podrá adquirir con más facilidad la compra de cerdos e invertir para acondicionar mejor el lugar para crianza de sus animales. 
Su meta próxima es sembrar maíz.
texts.en: Ivania is 29 years old and lives in Chacaraseca, a community in León. She is married and is a mother to three children. She is a trader. She is dedicated to raising pigs. She has been dedicated to this business for six years. She began when she was 23 with the support of her husband who taught her how to raise and sell pigs. She has this business on her farm. When she obtained her first earning, she bought one more block of land to use it as planting land. She is requesting the loan to buy pigs for development and build a barn for the pigs. With this investment, she will be able to acquire with greater ease the purchase of pugs and to invest in better conditions for raising animals. Her next goal is to plant corn.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and compose the barn for the pigs.

loans.name: Jamilya

texts.en:
Jamilya is 53 years old. She purchases and resells cattle with her husband. 

Jamilya would like to request a loan of 1,000 AZN in order to purchase additional cattle to increase her inventory and meet customer demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. 

In the future, Jamilya would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional cattle and increase their income further. For this reason she applied for a 1,000 AZN loan.

loans.use: to purchase three baby calves.

loans.name: Maria  Magdalena

texts.es: La Sra. María  se  preocupa  por acondicionar  su  vivienda  en esta   ocasión  ella desea    realizar   acabados  en  el interior  y exterior  de  su  vivienda, primeramente   requiere   pintar  su  hogar , para  de  esta  manera  brindar  a su  familiares  y  amigos  que  la  visitan un  ambiente   agradable  así  como también  requiere  realizar   acabados  en el  exterior  de  su  domicilio,  agradece  el apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su  proyecto .
texts.en: María is concerned about making her house livable and on this occasion she wants to complete the interior and the exterior finishing touches; in particular, she needs to paint her house to provide her family and friends who visit a pleasant environment.  She also needs to do some of the exterior finishing touches.  She is grateful for the support provided to carry out her project.

loans.use: to paint the exterior of her house.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Tessie has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Tessie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.fr:
Cliente de 39 ans, mariée et mère d'un garçon age de 9 ans, elle se lance dans le commerce bientôt 8 ans, quand elle finit ses études universitaires.
Parmi les première cliente de Hope, elle a déjà bénéficie de 3 cycle de prêts, elle a toujours eu  une grande capacité de remboursement et détient des épargnes considérables, ses revenus ont largement augmentes, elle vend en moyenne 25.000 fr a 100.000 fr par jour.
Pour ce quatrième prêt , elle persévère en achetant plus de marchandises, continuer avec la vente des produits divers , comme poisson sale, le poisson fume, les produits d'alimentation, elle fait les gâteaux, du yaourt,tous  ce dont les clients cherchent.

Toujours motivée par ce qu'elle fait , elle tient a aller loin , atteindre ses objectifs et être une femme d'affaire.
texts.en:
A client aged 39, married and the mother of a son of nine years old, she got into business about eight years ago when she finished her university studies. 

Among the first clients of Hope, she has already received three loans and she has always had a great capacity for reimbursement and has put aside considerable savings. Her income has gone up a lot and she makes sales for on average between 25,000 and 100,000 francs per day.  

For this fourth loan, she will persevere in buying more merchandise and continue selling various sorts of goods such as salted fish, smoked fish, grocery items. She has cookies, yogurt, everything her customers are looking for. 

Always motivated by her business, she intends to go far, attain her objectives, and become a businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy items for her business to bolster her stall inventory.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en: Yousef is a 43-year-old man, and he is married with five sons and three daughters. He has a grocery store in addition to a project of raising sheep and poultry. Yousef wants to purchase more groceries for his store in order to have a better collection for sale and increase his income, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Yousef gets the loan, he will be able to purchase more groceries and have a better collection. This will increase his sales, improve his income, and enable him to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 6 children, all of whom go to school, and also takes care of two other family members (father and mother). Tessie operates a rented retail shop where she sells her products. Her customers are her neighbors. She has been in business for the last 5 years and works seven days a week.

Tessie has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, 50 kgs. of rice, soap, and maize flour. Her goals and aspirations are to own a wholesale shop, to buy a plot of land, and to educate her children to university level. Her major challenges are defaulters and transportation. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, 50 kgs. of rice, soap, and maize flour

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is from Calabayan in Ozamiz City. She is 46 years old. Edna is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Edna owns & operates a transportation service. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 27 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 43 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and has three children between 20 to 25 years old. All of them are living on their own.

For the past five years she has been selling charcoal in the community. She makes more profit and has more customers, since she is the only one who sells charcoal in her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, a 24-year-old single mother of two children, both attending school, lives in Caldwell where she has been selling red oil (palm oil) and plantains in the local market for the past two years. One of her main challenges is fluctuating prices.

Josephine is now requesting a loan to purchase more red oil and plantains for her business. in the future, she hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase  more red oil (palm oil) and plantains for her business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is married with eight children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Vivian is forty years old and has five children who are in school.

Vivian has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Vivian has been in this business for six years. In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El Sr. Marcos tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero, vive en la Ciudad de Itá , aun vive en el terreno familiar pero con casa y actividad propia, se independizó y posee su propio taller de confecciones ,posee dos maquinas rectas industriales y una overlock de 5 hilos.
El se define como un joven muy trabajador y emprendedor, que lucha por un futuro mejor, ya que pese a su corta edad desea salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia y también en los gastos de la casa. Quiere seguir creciendo con su negocio por lo que desea poder seguir invirtiendo en el.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, cierre y demás insumos con los cuales podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Marcos is 19 years old, single, and lives in the city of Itá. He still lives on his family’s property, but in his own house and has his own business. He became independent and has his own tailoring shop, where he has two industrial machines and a 5-thread overlock sewing machine.

He considers himself to be a very hardworking and enterprising young man who fights for a better future. Despite his young age, he wants to get ahead so that he can help his family and contribute to the household expenses. He wants his business to continue to grow, which is why he wants to be able to continue investing in it.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabric, thread, zippers and other supplies to meet his customers’ demands. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity provided to him.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers and other supplies.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJIGUISSEME  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FARANI, un des villages de SELINGUE, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  NAMINATA, 1ere debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de TAGAN, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Maa Chanchala Shg(A) Group

texts.en:
Labani is a 41-year-old divorced woman who lives with her four children in a small village in Odisha, India. She is engaged in paddy cultivation. Her husband was doing the same business, so after the separation from her husband, she continued this.
